column2: The Para region which controls the west bank of the Amazon river has been under Spanish domination for decades. However it is a backward place where nobody lives except the local tribes and some Guianan outposts. Settlers from the Equinoxian Republic have begun inhabiting the region and are advancing more every day. We could take advantage of the current war to seize Para and annex it to Equinoxia. However we should be aware that when the war ends, the victor could come back reclaiming these lands ...
Take the opportunity while no one is watching
It is not our territory, call them back !
The Amazonian settlers have seized the entirety of the Para area !

My king, one matter has come to the attention of our councillors. The region of Para was nominally under our protection for decades but the Amazonian settlers have profited from the war to seize it. It is worthless lands and swamps but by principle we should ask a compensation. We could threaten to go to war or ask a monetary compensation to finance our war debts ...
We will settle the matter if they pay us
Why bother about some inhospitable jungle ?
The Spanish delegates have approached us about our seizure of Para. They are willing to drop the matter if we pay them "reparations" on a 12year basis. What do we do ?
Just some money ? Take the chance while they are asking !
And what will they do if we don't ?
The Amazonian have accepted. The first payment is fulfilled.
I think we have made a great deal gentlemen
The Amazonian have refused to pay reparations. There is only one solution : war.
They want war ? They'll get war !
It is the time to pay our "reparations" to Spain
The Amazonian government has sent us another payment of the reparations
We have to pay for the reparations. Just one more time and it will be finished
Finally we must complete the reparations
Amazonie has paid all the reparations
It was good while it lasted
The Spanish government has asked us to relinquish our control of Para. Should we choose not to give it up, it will mean war ....
We don't have a lot of choices ...
Amazonie has bowed before our demands !

While we were rejoicing over our total victory over the insurgents, some our councillors have reminded us of Para. The region of Para was nominally under our protection for decades but the Amazonian settlers have profited from the war to seize it. It is worthless lands and swamps but by principle we should ask a compensation. We could threaten to go to war or ask a monetary compensation to finance our war debts ...
We will settle the matter if they pay us
Why bother about some inhospitable jungle ?

We have faced many hardships : we vanquished Spain definitely and proved to the world that we stand united and it is now time to settle the conflict with Amazonia. They seized Para during the war, thinking no one would try to take it but they are wrong, we did not forget and foremost, we didn't forgive. We can ask them to give up the area or we could settle for some monetary "reparations"
We will settle the matter if they pay us
Why bother about some inhospitable jungle ?
The Colombian delegates have approached us about our seizure of Para. They are willing to drop the matter if we pay them "reparations" on a 12year basis. What do we do ?
Just some money ? Take the chance while they are asking !
And what will they do if we don't ?
The Amazonian have accepted. The first payment is fulfilled.
I think we have made a great deal gentlemen
The Amazonian have refused to pay reparations. There is only one solution : war.
They want war ? They'll get war !
It is the time to pay our "reparations" to Gran Colombia
The Amazonian government has sent us another payment of the reparations
We have to pay for the reparations. Just one more time and it will be finished
Amazonie has paid all the reparations
It was good while it lasted
The Colombian government has asked us to relinquish our control of Para. Should we choose not to give it up, it will mean war ....
We don't have a lot of choices ...
Amazonie has bowed before our demands !

The loss of Atlantia has created a great distrust between the government and the military, the latter accusing the former of having betrayed them and that victory was near. A circle of officer has decided to end the democratic rabble and plan to take the Parliament by force.
The military take control of the Parliament

The Equinoxian republic has always been distinct inside the Federation and also one of the most democratic. The end of the democracy in Amazonia has made some Equinoxian think about secession and it seems their movement spread to Vaura ...
We'll have to watch them closely ...
The Equinoxian patriots have risen against the government decided to leave the Federation to create their own democratic state !
With the capture of the military commandment, the war has been declared null and void. The Equinoxian leader has proclaimed the Federation and reestablished the Constitution
We shall reestablish democracy in Amazonia !
With the last strongholds taken by our forces, Amazonia is once again one and indivisible !
Many in the military are supporters of a monarchy in Amazonia. Should we start looking for a monarch ?
It is time for the return of the king.
We are fine as we are thanks
Two possible monarchs were found. The Duke of Brittany and the duke of Leonie. Choosing one will also guide our external policy
The duke of Brittany will become king
The duke of Leonie will become king
The new monarch must choose how he will rule (or not).
The military knows best how to rule this country
The king reigns but does not rule

With the inauguration of Edward IV's statue in Fort Lothar, we see an opportunity to bring Beornia and Lotharingia even closer. We could invite King Edward for a summit to cement our friendship for the years to come.
We can only gain from this.

Lotharingia has paid tribute to our king Edward IV in their capital, Fort Lothere. Seeing as a fit opportunity, they called for a meeting with our government and our king, and presented us with the possibility of a friendship agreement. We could benefit a lot from their alliance, but we must consider well.
Beornians and Lotharians have always be friends.
While they are ouf friends, we have our divides.
Attend the summit, but keep our distance.

The tribute to King Edward IV has gone smoothly, and the summit was a success. Our friends in the south have accepted our proposal of a friendship agreement. Let the world know we are brothers, and Ameriga tremble before our power.
The tribute to King Edward IV was appreciated and the summit was amiable, but in the end there were differences that still kept us apart. And alliance was signed, but nothing further than that.
The tribute to King Edward IV was appreciated, but the Beornian delegation was uninterested in further commitment towards an alliance.
Our relations with Beornia have been cooling for some time. By evoking our Friendship agreement, we can come closer again.
Try talking to their ambassador, but there's no need for a fuss over this.
In fact, we rather let them cool down a bit.
This non-sense has gone too far.
Our relations with Beornia have been cooling for some time. By evoking our Friendship agreement, we can come closer again.
Try talking to their ambassador, but there's no need for a fuss over this.
In fact, we rather let them cool down a bit.
This non-sense has gone too far.
For too long, our nations have grown apart from our friendship. Now it is time we accept the divide between us is too big to heal.
For too long, our nations have grown apart from our friendship. Now it is time we accept the divide between us is too big to heal.
Rebels in control of Fort Lothere have vandalized the monument to King Edward IV.
Missing localisation. Please report to Divergences' developer.
Missing localisation. Please report to Divergences' developer.
Missing localisation. Please report to Divergences' developer.
Incan forces have occupied more of the lands in the southern continent. The pacification of the local natives is ongoing.
For the glory of the Inca!
Beornian forces have occupied more of the lands in the southern continent. The pacification of the local natives is ongoing.

Through the judicious use of force, confiscation of native lands and the introduction of roads and other vestiges of civilization, conditions in $PROVINCENAME$ have greatly improved. The native Patagonians are proving to be contentious, but their numbers are far too few for us to worry about.
Our forces have occupied more of the lands in the Amazonas. The pacification of the local natives is ongoing.

The partisans of Amazonian expansionism are divided into three camps. First are those who only want to annex the border states near la Cote du Café. But some are also wanting to take all lands where Guarani people inhabit and integrate them into our society to balance the power of the Lotharians in the area. And eventually a fringe minority calls for the complete annexation of Lotharingia to form a greater Amerigan Federation. But should we declare such an ambition, the greater powers would surely act against us ....
We will only take the states along our border
We will create a greater Amerigan Federation
We have assembled the representatives of the newly acquired states of the Federation to discuss their integration into our state. What will they decide ?
We have assembled the representatives of the newly acquired states of the Federation to discuss their integration into our state. What will they decide ?
We have assembled the representatives of the newly acquired states of the Federation to discuss their integration into our state. What will they decide ?

With the reconquest of Atlantia, some people are beginning to argue about the benevolent rule of Denis d'Aigle. Our president has now announced that he will be making a speech to answer the question of the nature of our government.
Denis d'Aigle will continue to lead us as he always did !
Denis d'Aigle will call new elections
What Lotharingia needs is a strong monarch. D'Aigle will be crowned Denis Ier
The winner of the Columbian war has relinquished all claims on Para
I knew invading this jungle would not give trouble to the Federation !
We have been proposed to enter a greater Federation with $FROMCOUNTRY$
With $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forces occupying the vast pampas of New-Cornwall, our claim is now recognized by the entire World !
With $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forces occupying the detroit between the Pacific and Atlantic oceans, our claim is now recognized by the entire World !
With $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forces occupying the territories west of the Andes, our claim is now recognized by the World !

Representatives from the Amerigan State have arrived to our capital to discuss the integration of Beornia into their state. We have had ties with the Lotharians for centuries and should we refuse it is likely they will invade us anyway.
They can go to hell with their Federation !
The Beornians have accepted, the whole Amerigan Atlantic Coast is now united !
From the Jungles, to the Pampas, Long Live Ameriga !
The Beornians have refused to integrate the Federation
Well we'll let them in their backwater pampas !
They thought that no was an answer ? Across la Rivière d'Argent gentlemen !
The Beornian representatives have been assembled there in their old capital. What will be their choice ?
The Granadan representatives have been assembled there in their old capital. What will be their choice ?

Now that the lands of Araucania and Patagonia are fully settled, the Argentinians have approached us to work out a border treaty. They intend to claim the lands east of the Andes and are willing to concede the lands east of the Andes to us. If we do not come to an agreement, future conflict is almost guaranteed.
There is no need for such an agreement.
There is no need for such an agreement.
There is no need for such an agreement.

The Scramble for Africa, also known as the Race for Africa was a process of invasion, attack, occupation, and annexation of African territory by Great Powers of the civilized world during the New Imperialism period during the end of the 19th century and the first half of the 20th century. As a result of the heightened tension between European states in the last quarter of the 19th century, the partitioning of Africa may be seen as a way for the Europeans to eliminate the threat of a Europe-wide war over Africa. Popular European ideas in the 19th century also aided the partitioning of Africa. The eugenics movement and Imperialism helped to foster the expansionist policy.

During the New Imperialism period, by the end of the century, Europe added almost 9,000,000 square miles (23,000,000 square kilometres)  one-fifth of the land area of the globe  to its overseas colonial possessions. Our master decided that our territory should be added to this area as well.

The Europeans who settled Waka o Aoraki sent an envoy to our chiefs. They claim that they want to bring peace and prosperity to our lands. But we have seen only death and treachery from their hands, they brought us evil weapons and made us skirmish against each other. Do you think that their intentions are pure now?
They came with an olive branch

White man came across the sea, he brought us pain and misery, he killed our tribes, he killed our creed, he took our game for his own need. We fought him hard, we fought him well, out on the plains we gave him hell. But many came, too much for Cree. Oh, will we ever be set free?
By extending our southeast African holdings, the are of the Zanzibar claims increased as well.
The Burgundian enclave in the Sahel area, formerly known as Grand Bassam, is now strategically worthless. Maybe we can ask for it as a favor?
Our former trading post at Grand Bassam is in a very bad shape. Perhaps we could handle it to another country and gain international prestige as a reward?
I want to keep that place!
The Scandinavian enclave in the Southwest African area, formerly known as Grand Bassam, is now strategically worthless. Maybe we can ask for it as a favor?
Our former trading posts in South Vestpost are in a very bad shape. Perhaps we could handle them to another country and gain international prestige as a reward?
I want to keep that place!

My Duke! The King of the North demands our unconditional annexation into the realm of Scandinavia! Our state while a small colonial war is weak compared to Scandinavia and they have a solid claim on our Duchy. On the other hand, we could try to fight back the Scandinavians and take back our inheritance to reform an independent Baltic German kingdom!
Go into exile in Neu Kurland

With the growing power of Malacca our Malaysian colonies have become almost worthless. If we cede our colonies to Malacca it would simultaneously relieve us of the headache of running them and greatly improve our relationship with Malacca.
It is our gate to Indonesia!

With the growing power of Malacca our Malaysian colonies have become almost worthless. If we cede our colonies to Malacca it would simultaneously relieve us of the headache of running them and greatly improve our relationship with Malacca.
It is our gate to Indonesia!

With the growing power of Indian natives our local colonies have become almost worthless. If we cede our colonies to them it would simultaneously relieve us of the headache of running them and greatly improve our relationship with them.
It is our gate to India!

With the growing power of Indian natives our local colonies have become almost worthless. If we cede our colonies to them it would simultaneously relieve us of the headache of running them and greatly improve our relationship with them.
It is our gate to India!
We have acquired several lands in Mauritania but the small colony of Terra d'Oro is not our hands. We could offer to buy it for a small price ?
Today the Spanish government has formally demanded our coastline. Shall we accept their demands or fight them?
We will give them the coastline ...
The various Arab tribes are asking our help to overthrow the European oppressors!
We will fight against the oppressors!
We will not risk our precarious independence
The Arab tribes invaded our colony!
The Arabs rebelled against our control and now are pushing us out of Maghreb!
We will fight against the heathens!
The infidels are pushing us back!
The infidels are pushing us back!
We should divide the new territories between us!
The Arabs in Maghreb are now defeated and now we can officially proclaim that the end of the Reconquista!
What? Constantinople is still Turk, pls fix!
With the arrival of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonial governor into $PROVINCENAME$, an effort has begun to incorporate $COUNTRY_ADJ$ $STATENAME$ into the larger Yakutian colony
With the arrival of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonial governor into $PROVINCENAME$, an effort has begun to incorporate $COUNTRY_ADJ$ $STATENAME$ into the larger Numidian colony
With the arrival of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonial governor into $PROVINCENAME$, an effort has begun to incorporate $COUNTRY_ADJ$ $STATENAME$ into the larger Libyan colony.
The Mauretanians have asked to be granted a special status as an autonomous dominion within the empire.
This can only be good for the empire.
No, they shall remain under our direct control
The Numidians have asked to be granted a special status as an autonomous dominion within the empire.
This can only be good for the empire.
No, they shall remain under our direct control
With the arrival of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonial governor into $PROVINCENAME$, an effort has begun to incorporate $COUNTRY_ADJ$ $STATENAME$ into the larger Yakutian colony
After long debates, the people of Vinland have embraced the idea of united Arcadia with their minds and their hearts.
After long debates, the people of Vinland have returned with demands on reforming our government that need to be fulfilled before they submit to the Arcadian rule.
Vinlanders oppose the idea of Pan-Arcadianism
After long debates, the people of Vinland have decided to oppose the idea of united Arcadia and are now ready to actively fight against our cause in the name of independence.
After long debates, the people of Belgica have embraced the idea of united Arcadia with their minds and their hearts.
After long debates, the people of Belgica have returned with demands on reforming our government that need to be fulfilled before they submit to the Arcadian rule.
Septimans oppose the idea of Pan-Arcadianism
After long debates, the people of Belgica have decided to oppose the idea of united Arcadia and are now ready to actively fight against our cause in the name of independence.
After long debates, the people of Plantagenia have embraced the idea of united Arcadia with their minds and their hearts.
After long debates, the people of Plantagenia have returned with demands on reforming our government that need to be fulfilled before they submit to the Arcadian rule.
Plantagenians oppose the idea of Pan-Arcadianism
After long debates, the people of Plantagenia have decided to oppose the idea of united Arcadia and are now ready to actively fight against our cause in the name of independence.

Since the end of the colonial rule, Arcadia has been a place of constant rivalry and warfare. Immigrants hoping to flee from the war-torn Europe arrived here only to find more violence and bloodshed. But now it is possible that this era is over. Pan-Arcadianism, the idea of united Arcadia, idea that has been something only avid Romantics have dreamt of...maybe this dream of freedom and unity can actually see reality?

With the discussion over a new capital of Arcadia being now taken to an official level, two actual options have arisen for the construction of Tripolis, symbolical soul of the young union. Cap Valois, on the Atlantic Coast with the advantage of strategic position, but deep in Septiman territory and Nye Nidaros, territory originally contested by all the three nations in the heart of the continent...but far from urban important centers.
Cap Valois is the perfect spot
The capital shall be the heart of the country

Representatives of Plantagenians, Septimans and Vinlanders have arrived to Nye Nidaros, a middle ground of all the three nations, eager to discuss the possibility of the union existing not only on paper.
The future is in their hands
The Nidaros Congress is over. Weeks of discussions, quarrels, arguments have passed and the fate of national unity is decided. What shall it be?
And it is a success! The idea of unity and equality in Arcadia is seeing rebirth and the concept of Pan-Arcadianism will now blossom in the Land of the Free
Sadly, the Congress collapsed into petty squabbles and one of the delegations eventually stormed off and the concept of Pan-Arcadianism can now only be enforced by raw power

$MONARCHTITLE$, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ambassador has presented us with news from the $UNION_ADJ$ Congress. $FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted the $UNION_ADJ$ crown, and proclaimed themselves the one true $UNION_ADJ$ nation. These winds of change will be hard to resist.
column3: $MONARCHTITLE$, l'ambassadeur $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ nous a donné des nouvelles du Congrès $CULTUREGROUP$. $FROMCOUNTRY$ a accepté la couronne $CULTUREGROUP$ et s'est proclamé comme l'unique véritable nation $CULTUREGROUP$. Il est difficile de résister à ce vent de changement.
column4: $MONARCHTITLE$, der $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Botschafter hat uns Nachrichten vom $CULTUREGROUP$-Kongress präsentiert. $FROMCOUNTRY$ hat die $CULTUREGROUP$-Krone akzeptiert und sich selbst als die einzig wahre $CULTUREGROUP$-Nation proklamiert. Diesen Veränderungen wird man sich nur schwer widersetzen können.

column2: We will not have our ancestral rights infringed!
column3: Ne laissons pas nos droits ancestraux se faire ainsi bafouer !
column4: Wir werden nicht zulassen, dass jemand unser Erbrecht verletzt!

column2: After long debates, the people of Lusitania have embraced the idea of united Arcadia with their minds and their hearts.
After long debates, the people of Lusitania have returned with demands on reforming our government that need to be fulfilled before they submit to the Arcadian rule.
Lusitanians oppose the idea of Pan-Arcadianism
After long debates, the people of Lusitania have decided to oppose the idea of united Arcadia and are now ready to actively fight against our cause in the name of independence.
With out claims fully staked we can now ask Sanbao to relinquish all of our rightful territory.
Our claims are clearly defined, now it is their turn

The Arcadian star is growing like no ever state did in the New-World. The influx of migrants is impressive and they have offered to buy at a reasonable price all the territories we possess in the Rockies. It would be sad to give up all this territory we have acquired at the cost of many lives but can we face the full might of Arcadia ?
We will sign it, better to gain a hefty sum of money from this loss...
We won't be manipulated like that!
Qingqiu has refused to give up their territories!
Our military could use the target practice.
We don't need this to come to a war yet.

The Qingqiuan government has accepted the proposal of the Arcadian government and has relinquished all their claims outside their core territories on the West Coast of Arcadia. Many hope it will be sufficient to stop the greed for land of the new continental power...
Excellent, one step closer towards Arcadian domination of the (New) World!
Even if Sanbao signed the treaty it does not mean they accepted the loss of their northern states and the local community reminds us of it everyday.

The novel of the Plantagonian author, Mr Armstrong has become one of the best sold book of the decade. The story which takes place in a plantation in Alibamon is virulently abolitionist and has sensibilized many people in Plantagenia and abroad about the inhumanity of the practice.
Well at least it's selling abroad
The pesky states of Plantagenia and Vinland must be united with our Confederacy!
The pesky states of Belgica and Plantagenia must be united with our country!
The pesky states of Belgica and Vinland must be united with our country!

With the ongoing growth of our country's population and the continuing struggle to claim new lands in the center of the continent, the question has arisen of how to deal with the native Arcadian tribes in our country. Some have proposed that the natives be confined into autonomous Reservations, while others have argued that the natives be encouraged to adopt our ways and conform in our society. Finally, some have asked  if it would be possible to accept the native cultures as part of a plurinational state.
Encourage them to adopt our ways
Integrate them into our social fabric

Since the conquest of the Six Nations in 1828, and the subsequent establishment of the Republic of Carolina within our Union, a large number of the Iroquois have fled into the Great Lakes region. Now, it has become apparent that the remaining Iroquois are planning to join their kin further west. How should we respond?
Whoever wishes to go may leave.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has requested excavation rights in the Valley of The Kings. While we ourselves do not have the know how or money to fund a serious excavation of the area, and allowing a foreign contractor might be good for that reason, it might also be best to let the secrets of our proud nation's history lie undisturbed until such a time when we ourselves can find them. Turning down a foreign power will spoil our relations, though.
column4: $FROMCOUNTRY$ hat Ausgrabungsrechte für das Tal der Könige beantragt. Obwohl wir selbst weder das Knowhow noch die Geldmittel für ernsthafte Ausgrabungen in diesem Gebiet haben und die Genehmigungserteilung an eine ausländische Expedition deshalb Sinn machen würde, wäre es vielleicht besser, die Geheimnisse der Geschichte unserer stolzen Nation ruhen zu lassen, bis wir in der Lage sind, sie selbst zu finden. Wenn wir den Antrag einer ausländischen Macht abweisen würde, wäre das wiederum schlecht für unsere Beziehungen.

column3: L'Égypte accorde un permis de fouille

column2: The government of Egypt has granted us the exclusive right to excavate and investiagate ancient ruins in the Valley of The Kings. The potential discoveries there will prove an enormous opportunity for us to increase our scientific renown in the world.
column3: Le gouvernement égyptien nous a accordé le droit exclusif de fouiller d'anciennes ruines de la vallée des rois. Les découvertes que nous pourrons y faire représenteront pour nous une belle occasion d'accroître notre renom scientifique dans le monde.
column4: Die Regierung Ägyptens hat uns die exklusiven Rechte gewährt, Ausgrabungen im Tal der Könige durchzuführen und die uralten Ruinen zu untersuchen. Die potentiellen Entdeckungen dort stellen für uns eine fantastische Gelegenheit dar, unser wissenschaftliches Renommee zu steigern.

column3: L'Égypte refuse un permis de fouille

column2: The government of Egypt has refused to allow us excavation rights in The Valley of The Kings. Our international prestige has been lowered as a result, and relations with Egypt have soured.
column3: Le gouvernement égyptien nous a refusé le droit de fouiller la vallée des rois. Résultat, notre prestige international a été réduit et les relations avec l'Égypte en ont pâti.
column4: Die ägyptische Regierung hat uns die Ausgrabungsrechte für das Tal der Könige verweigert. Dies hat unserem internationalen Prestige geschadet und unsere Beziehungen zu Ägypten haben sich verschlechtert.

column2: Egyptian officials in Alexandria have refused our Egyptian Expedition to unload vital excavation equipment in the Alexandrian port. The Egyptian customs system is a byzantine construction which is nigh on impossible to penetrate without personal pull or money. We could put pressure on the Egyptian government over the issue, but it might be best if the expedition simply bribes its way through Egypt.
column4: Ägyptische Offizielle in Alexandria haben unserer Ägypten-Expedition verweigert, im Hafen von Alexandria wichtige Ausrüstungsgegenstände für unsere Ausgrabungen zu entladen. Das ägyptische Zollsystem ist eine byzantinische Konstruktion. Mit anderen Worten: Ohne Bestechungen kommt man so gut wie gar nicht weiter. Wir könnten die ägyptische Regierung deswegen unter Druck setzen, aber es wäre wohl besser, wenn sich die Expeditionen einfach mit Bestechungen ihren Weg durch Ägypten freimacht.

column2: Our archeological excavation team working in the Valley of The Kings in Egypt has discovered a tomb from the Eigteenth Dynasty. The tomb is rectangular, and divided into upper and lower pillared sections, with a royal sarcophagus located in the lower section. This fantastic discovery has made our Egyptological department the talk of the historically aware Europe!
column4: Unsere archäologische Ausgrabung im Tal der Könige in Ägypten hat ein Grab der achtzehnten Dynastie freigelegt. Das Grab ist rechteckig, und in einen oberen und unteren, von Säulen getragenen Bereich unterteilt. Der königliche Sarkophag befindet sich im unteren Bereich. Diese fantastische Entdeckung hat unsere Ägypten-Abteilung zum Gespräch des gesamten historisch interessierten Europas gemacht!

column2: How it started, we do not know, but what we do know is that what was once a rumor has now become public wisdom. The rumor that has grown from breeze to storm is that a curse befalls anyone who disturbs the Tombs of the Pharaohs in the Valley of The Kings, and some even claim that our excavation team threatens to draw down the curse on all of $COUNTRY$. It is a hysterical rumor, of course, but the hysteria is there nevertheless.
column4: Wie es angefangen hat, wissen wir nicht, aber eins ist sicher: Was einst lediglich ein Gerücht war, wird nun fest geglaubt. Das Gerücht, dass sich von einer leichten Priese zu einem Sturm entwickelt hat, besagt, dass jeder, der die Gräber der Pharaonen im Tal der Könige stört, von einem Fluch befallen wird. Manche behaupten sogar, dass unsere Ausgrabungsexpedition den Fluch auf ganz $COUNTRY$ bringen könnte. Natürlich ist dies nur ein hysterisches Gerücht, aber die Hysterie ist nicht von der Hand zu weisen.
Was kommt als nächstes? Die Sichtung eines Kometen?

column2: ...opening the inner granite lid leading into the tomb, I was met by a breath of air that had been left undisturbed for some three thousand years. To the best of my knowledge, I was the first to disturb the Pharao's sleep since he was laid to rest all those thousand years ago. There, standing in the ancient air of the crypt, I felt the smells of wheat growing on the Nile, perfume in alabaster vases, and a hint of dying papyrus.'\n\nThe most marvellous discovery of the century has been made by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ archeologists working in The Valley of The Kings: The previously undiscovered tomb of the 19 year old Pharao, Tutankhamun.
column4: ... als ich den inneren Granitdeckel anhob, kam mir ein Schwall Luft entgegen, der dort dreitausend Jahre lang eingeschlossen war. Nach meinem Wissen war ich der erste, der den Schlaf des Pharaohs störte, nachdem er vor Tausenden von Jahren zur letzten Ruhe gelegt wurde. Als ich dort in der Luft des altertümlichen Ägyptens stand, vermochte ich den Weizen zu riechen, der an den Nilufern wuchs, Parfüm in Alabastervasen und einen Hauch von verrottendem Papyrus.'\n\nDie $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Archäologen im Tal der Könige haben die größte Entdeckung des Jahrhunderts gemacht: Sie haben das bislang ungeöffnete Grab des neunzehnjährigen Pharaohs Tutanchamun gefunden.

column2: Our excavation team working in the Valley of The Kings has uncovered a hereto undiscovered tomb, and the mummified remains of an Egyptian High-Priest of the 19th dynasty. The interior of the tomb is rich in decorations, and the discovery is an enormous success for our Egyptian expedition.
column4: Unsere Ausgrabungsexpedition im Tal der Könige hat ein bislang unentdecktes Grab und die mumifizierten Überreste eine ägyptischen Hohepriesters der neunzehnten Dynastie gefunden. Das Innere des Grabes ist reich verziert - die Entdeckung stellt für unsere Ägypten-Expedition einen enormen Erfolg dar.

column2: A great power has come to us asking to excavate local ruins.
The Greeks have agreed that we may excavate at Mycenae
The foolish Greeks have refused our antiquarians access!
There's been some unfortunate allegations in Greece...
A royal tomb has been found in Greece.
Some of the jewelery our excavators have found is of questionable validity...
And as we pulled the mask from the body, I gazed into the face of Agamemnon.
A great power has come to us asking to excavate local ruins.
The Cretans have agreed that we may excavate at Knossos.
The foolish Cretans have refused our antiquarians access!
There's been some unfortunate allegations in Crete...
A great palace has been found in Knossos!

Before work began in Crete by one of the most famous $COUNTRY_ADJ$ archaeologist teams, the ancient Minoan culture was only faintly reflected in classical Greek myths. After months of systematic excavations the team has now finally discovered a complex near Knossos which, according to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ team leader, appears to be the foundations of King Minos Palace. The prestigious finding has already given much international attention to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Excavation Office in $CAPITAL$ and will surely enhance further research in these fields.

An $COUNTRY_ADJ$ scientists team has found bones of primitive ancient men at a location near Dusseldorf in German territory. According to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ team leader, the 'Neanderthals' appear to be an extinct species or subspecies of the genus Homo which seem closely related to modern humans. As scientists have never seen bones like this before the prestigious finding has already given much international attention to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ National Council of Science in $CAPITAL$ and will surely enhance further research in these fields.

An $COUNTRY_ADJ$ scientists team has found bones of primitive ancient men on the island of Java in the Indian Ocean. According to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ scientists, 'Homo Erectus' appears to be a human species which has lived in Asia and probably Africa, and eventually evolved into the species of 'Homo Sapiens'. As this type of ancient bones has been unknown so far the prestigious finding has already given much international attention to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ National Council of Science in $CAPITAL$ and will surely enhance further research in these fields.

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ scientists have found a skull of an odd ape-creature child near Taung in South-African territory. According to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ scientists leader, 'Australopithecus Africanus' or simply 'Taung-child' by our reporter - could possibly represent a viable candidate for the ancestor of the genus Homo. As this type of ancient skull has been unknown so far the prestigious finding has already given much international attention to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ National Council of Science in $CAPITAL$ and will surely enhance further research in these fields.

When the Andagoya Canal was planned, several expeditions were sent into the depths of Central America. The inhabitants of the deep jungles of Yucatan told them stories of ruined cities and ancient treasures. What precious artifacts may be waiting in the depths of the jungle? This news may interest our archaeologists.

An archaeologist travelling through Peru has stumbled across an entire ruined Inca city, forgotten by the outside world for centuries. This magnificent pre-Columbian city of Machu Picchu has sparked new interest in archaeological exploration in the Andes Mountains. Local legends have long told of hidden temples, vast golden treasures and priceless artifacts--- yes, we've heard it all before, but the archaeological promise of the region seems real enough.
It's time to fetch my fedora again!
It's time to fetch my fedora again!

A foreign power is asking for access to the jungle region of Yucatan. They've dispatched a team of archaeologists led by a representative of the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ National Museum. They are willing to pay and to share any discoveries.
Odd people. What is so interesting about some stones in the jungle?
The government of $FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to grant our researchers access to the Yucatan. Our expedition can begin.
Unfortunately, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to give us access to the Yucatan jungles.
But I've already bought this handsome leather jacket!

A foreign power is asking for access to the ancient ruins of Mesopotamia. They've dispatched a team of archaeologists led by a representative of the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ National Museum. They are willing to pay and to share any discoveries.
If they want to dig in the desert, they're welcome to it.
We refuse out of sheer spite.
The government of $FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to grant our researchers access to their Mesopotamian ruins. Our expedition can begin.
Unfortunately, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to give us access to their Mesopotamian ruins.

$COUNTRY$ has become a leader in the field of archaeology. Our scientists routinely conduct excavations in far-off exotic places, and our National Museum in $CAPITAL$ has amassed a world-class collection of archaeological artifacts. A major exhibition is to be held this week, to celebrate new finds from Africa, Asia and South America. Around the world, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ archaeology inspires pride, admiration, and envy.
Archaeology is truly a fascinating science.

Science forges ahead! The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ intelligentsia have become quite taken with the study of antiquities and lost civilizations. A group of scientific and social leaders have today established the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Archaeological Society as a civilian organization for the advancement of the study of ancient man. New findings will be published regularly, and our nation's science (and prestige) will be substantially advanced.
I should subscribe to their Journal...

A member of our Archaeological Society has become a leading expert, with a global reputation and many prominent discoveries to his name. He has introduced new methods and written a popular guide for future generations of aspiring antiquarians. $COUNTRY$ is proud of its famous son.
He should serve as an example for our scientific community.
He should serve as an example for our nation.

Deep in the jungle, our archaeologists have uncovered an old stele of the Maya classical period. This artifact is not only a wonderful piece of art, but will provide new insights into the ancient world of the Maya.

Haze lies over the forests and hills of Yucatan. The mist thins, as our expedition pushes on through the wild and perilous jungle. Jaguars and other fierce beasts prowl the canopied hills. Malarial mosquitoes fill the air with their buzzing. Engravings appear among the rocks. A hill is crested, and the lead archaeologist's eyes flit over stairs, broken and mossy. The ancient hulk of a lost Maya pyramid rises up ahead. One of the porters raises his hand and shouts: 'I think I've found the entrance!'

Ruins stretch up from the jungle as far as the eye can see. These structures are old--- very old, as our specialists affirm. This lost city is one of the largest archaeological sites ever discovered, and older even than the other Maya sites at Tikal and Waxaktun, dating to the Maya pre-classical period. El Mirador, one of the oldest and greatest cities of the Mayan civilization, was rediscovered by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ archaeologists.
To think that these ruins waited all this time for us!

Clay tablets were used as a writing medium in the ancient Middle East. Satisfyingly, our archaeologists have unearthed a substantial archive of such tablets on their latest expedition. They believe that this archive was part of a large palace complex belonging to an as-yet unknown ruler. The imprinted cuneiform characters can give us a new perspective on Babylonia in antiquity.

Today is an exceptional day for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ archaeology. After months of research and excavations, our team has located a buried palace complex, dating back to Sumerian times. Our archaeologists estimate that these structures are more than five thousand years old!

Meticulous research and aerial photography leave no doubt: Babylon, once only a legend of power and decadence out of Biblical tales, is now an established archaeological site. The Hanging Gardens of Semiramis and a large palace complex have been found and carefully examined. Archives filled with clay tablets have been unearthed and translated. But the most prestigious find was the discovery by a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ archaeologist that even the legend of the Tower of Babel has an historical basis. A massive unfinished ziggurat has been found, larger by far than any yet known. This is an unforgettable day!
And I thought it was only a legend.

A cache of human figurines made of worked gold have been uncovered in our Inca dig site. The craftsmanship is exceptional, and both the designs and the construction will give us meaningful insight into the culture and technology of the Inca people.

A breakthrough in the Andes! Our archaeologists have located a major Inca temple complex. Its walls are covered in brilliant frescoes depicting myths and religious ceremonies, and a number of tools, garments and textiles have been remarkably well preserved by the arid Andean climate. It is clear that the Inca were wealthier and more culturally sophisticated than was previously suspected.

After all the careful exploration of major Inca sites, the most dramatic breakthrough yet has come from a farming village. A ceramic vessel was unearthed, and inside was a breathtaking golden sculpture of an early Inca chief on a log raft, surrounded by priests and servants. Comparing the sculpture with frescoes from the temples and regional legends, we now believe that the chief painted himself with gold dust and leapt into a mountain lake to make offerings to appease the gods. It seems likely that this ritual is the ancient origin of the legend of "Golden Kings" that so tantalized Spanish explorers centuries ago. What a triumph for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ archaeology!
You mean El Dorado isn't real...?

Machu Pichu, an old seat of power from the Great Incas, which no one visited for hundreds of years is once again under our control! Most of the knowledge about the mountain has been lost during the Spanish conquest and the few inscriptions we have tell us that it was Pachacuti himself who chose the site to be one of his residences. We have also found a great temple dedicated to Inti in the ruins and the priests of the Empire have asked that they be given the site to build a great sanctuary to honour Inti and the past Incas. The site would also be a magnificent retreat for our sovereigns if we renovated the whole place. Also the European advisers of our court have expressed their interest in funding missions to study this example of our old Civilization.
Open it to archaeologists from the whole world!
Rebuild a Great Palace for the Inca!

Foreign immigrants arriving in new countries often find themselves living together concentrated in relatively small areas, living in close proximity to, and seeking mutual support from, their national brethren, often forming little 'ethnic enclaves', such as New York's 'Little Italy'. One of our provinces is no exception, as the immigrant community there has formed a just such a thing, complete with all the cultural," linguistic and culinary flavors of the immigrants' homeland
column3: Les immigrants étrangers en provenance de nouveaux pays avaient tendance à se concentrer dans des quartiers relativement restreints et à vivre à proximité les uns des autres pour se soutenir"," créant ainsi de petites """"enclaves ethniques"""" comme """"Little Italy"""" à New York. $PROVINCENAME$ n'y fait pas exception et cette communauté d'immigrants y a réinstauré les notes culturelles"," linguistiques et culinaire de sa terre natale.""
column4: Ausländische Einwanderer finden sich in ihren neuen Ländern häufig stark konzentriert in relativ kleinen Gebieten wieder", wo sie in enger Nachbarschaft zu ihren Landsleuten leben und sich mit diesen gegenseitige Unterstützung bieten. Oftmals bilden sie 'ethnische Enklaven', wie beispielsweise New Yorks 'Little Italy'. $PROVINCENAME$ ist da keine Ausnahme, da die Einwanderergemeinde dort gerade solch eine Enklave mit allen kulturellen, linguistischen und kulinarischen Aspekten ihres Heimatlandes gebildet hat.

column2: A victory for our tolerant society!
column3: Une victoire pour notre société tolérante !
column4: Ein Sieg für unsere tolerante Gesellschaft!

column2: An excellent opportunity to promote local harmony!
column3: Une belle occasion de promouvoir la cohabitation locale !
column4: Eine hervorragende Gelegenheit zur Förderung der lokalen Harmonie!

column2: It has been twenty days. Twenty days without work, without money, without any chance to feed or clothe my family. Twenty days... Twenty days is an eternity when you have to rummage through the garbage to find something to eat. I don't want to beg, I don't want to steal, but twenty days without work...'\n\nFew immigrants, who left their country to live and work in $COUNTRY$, are able to find work.
column3: Vingt jours sans travail, sans argent, sans aucune chance de se nourrir ou de vêtir ma famille. Vingt jours... Vingt jours sont une éternité quand vous avez à fouiller dans les poubelles pour trouver quelque chose à manger. Je ne veux pas prier, je ne veux pas voler, mais vingt jours de travail...\n\n Peu d'immigrants, qui ont quitté leur pays pour vivre et travailler dans votre pays, sont en mesure de trouver du travail.
column4: Es sind schon 20 Tage vergangen. 20 Tage ohne Arbeit, ohne Geld, ohne eine Möglichkeit, meine Familie zu ernähren oder zu kleiden. 20 Tage ... 20 Tage sind eine Ewigkeit, wenn man die Mülltonnen nach Essbarem durchsuchen muss. Ich will nicht betteln oder stehlen, aber 20 Tage ohne Arbeit ...'\n\nWenige Einwanderer, die ihr Land verließen, um in Ihrem Land zu leben und zu arbeiten, finden tatsächlich Arbeit.'
column6: Han pasado veinte días. Veinte días sin trabajo, sin dinero, sin posibilidad alguna de alimentar o vestir a mi familia. Veinte días... Veinte días es una eternidad cuando tienes que buscar en la basura para encontrar algo para comer. No quiero mendigar, no quiero robar, pero veinte días sin trabajar...\n\nPocos de los inmigrantes que dejaron su país para vivir y trabajar en el tuyo han podido encontrar trabajo.

column2: Romance is in the air in one of our provinces, where a marriage between one of the province's immigrant sons, and a young local girl, is being celebrated by friends and family. Some decry the development as the end of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ civilization, but the young couple sure do look happy. Immigration is changing $COUNTRY$ in ways both big and small.
column3: Il flotte un parfum de romantisme en $PROVINCENAME$ où, amis et familles célèbrent le mariage d'un fils d'immigrant avec une jeune fille du coin. Certains dénoncent ce mariage comme la fin de la civilisation $COUNTRY_ADJ$, mais le jeune couple semble aux anges. L'immigration modifie indéniablement le visage de $PROVINCENAME$.
column4: In $PROVINCENAME$ liegt Romantik in der Luft: Freunde und Familie feiern die Hochzeit zwischen einem Einwanderersohn und einem jungen lokalen Mädchen. Manche verunglimpfen diese Entwicklung als das Ende der $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Zivilisation, aber das junge Paar sind auf jeden Fall sehr glücklich aus. Die Immigration verändert $PROVINCENAME$ im Großen wie im Kleinen.

column2: We wish them all the best
column4: Wir wünschen ihnen alles nur das Beste.

column2: A clear sign that immigration must be curtailed
column3: Un signe clair qu'il faut endiguer l'immigration !
column4: Ein klares Zeichen, dass wir den Einwanderungsstrom reduzieren müssen.

column2:
Anja Yesi-whatnow?'
'Aniya Yezierska. Is my name unpronounceable?'
'Kind of. Would you like to change it? It could be difficult for you to get a job otherwise.'

Unpronounceable names and strange spellings could cause trouble for job-seeking immigrants.
column4:
Anja Yesi-was?'
'Aniya Yezierska. Ist mein Name unaussprechbar?'
'Irgendwie schon. Möchten Sie ihn ändern? Es kann sonst schwierig für Sie sein, Arbeit zu finden.'

Unaussprechliche Namen und merkwürdige Buchstabierungen können für arbeitsuchende Einwanderer Ärger bedeuten

column2: The many immigrants who have arrived in the country have created a demand for housing. The construction of new homes must be speeded up when reports show that many immigrants share housing with up to ten or twenty people. This is a minor disaster as this could create epidemics, revolts and other disturbances.
column3: Le nombre d'immigrants qui sont arrivés dans le pays a créé une forte demande pour le logement. La construction de nouveaux logements doit être accélérée car les rapports montrent que de nombreux immigrants partagent un logement avec un maximum de dix ou vingt personnes. Il s'agit d'un désastre mineur, car cela pourrait créer des épidémies, des révoltes et d'autres perturbations.
column4: Die vielen ins Land strömenden Einwanderer haben einen Bauboom ausgelöst. Der Bau neuer Häuser muss beschleunigt werden, da Berichten zufolge viele Einwanderer sich zu zehnt oder zwanzigst ein Haus teilen. Dies ist eine kleine Katastrophe, da diese Umstände zu Epidemien, Revolten und anderen Unannehmlichkeiten führen könnten.
column6: Los muchos inmigrantes que han llegado al país han generado una demanda de alojamiento. La construcción de nuevas casas tiene que acelerarse. Los informes muestran que muchos inmigrantes comparten casa con grupos de entre diez y veinte personas. Se trata de un pequeño desastre que puede generar epidemias, revueltas y otras molestias.

column2: Immigrants in one of our provinces have gone out in a demonstration, protesting the lack of equal citizenship, and demanding equal recognition under the law for all $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens.
column3: Les immigrants de $PROVINCENAME$ ont manifesté pour protester contre un traitement qu'ils jugent inégal et exiger la reconnaissance légale de tous les citoyens $COUNTRY_ADJ$.
column4: Die Immigranten in $PROVINCENAME$ haben sich zu einer Demonstration zusammengefunden und protestieren gegen ihre eingeschränkten Bürgerrechte. Sie fordern die rechtliche Gleichberechtigung aller $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Bürger.

column2: Interesting, let us listen to them...
column4: Interessant. Lasst uns hören, was sie zu sagen haben ...

column2: Riots have broken out in one of our province's immigrant communities. While formally citizens, many immigrants feel that the state does not accord them proper recognition, and that they do not have the same opportunities as proper nationals.
column3: Des émeutes ont éclaté dans les communautés d'immigrants en $PROVINCENAME$. Officiellement naturalisés, bon nombre d'immigrants estiment que l'État ne leur accorde pas suffisamment de reconnaissance et qu'ils ne bénéficient pas des mêmes faveurs que les nationaux.
column4: In den Einwanderergemeinden von $PROVINCENAME$ sind Aufstände ausgebrochen. Obwohl sie formell Bürger sind, haben viele Einwanderer das Gefühl, dass der Staat ihnen die volle Anerkennung verweigert, und dass sie nicht dieselben Möglichkeiten wie vollwertige Bürger haben.

column2: Let us listen to their grievances
column4: Wir sollten uns ihre Sorgen anhören.

column2: I pledge allegiance, to the flag of $COUNTRY$, and to the government for which it stands'\n\nNot one eye dry in the audience today, as some of our immigrants today took the pledge of allegiance," and confirmed their loyalty to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ state.
column3: Je prête allégeance au drapeau de $COUNTRY$ et au gouvernement qui le dirige"""".\n\nBeaucoup d'émotion aujourd'hui en $PROVINCENAME$"," alors que nos immigrants ont prêté allégeance et confirmé leur loyauté envers l'État $COUNTRY_ADJ$.""
column4: Ich schwöre der Flagge und Regierung von $COUNTRY$ die Treue'.\n\nHeute blieb beim Publikum in $PROVINCENAME$ kein Auge trocken", als einige unserer Immigranten einen Treueschwur ablegten und ihre Loyalität für den $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Staat bekräftigten.

column2: Immigrants arriving in $COUNTRY$ often have small means both in terms of money and in terms of opportunity. Many of them have wound up in poor quarters, and those quarters are increasingly taking on the characteristics of a ghetto. It could be a good idea to do something about these squalid living conditions, lest they worsen.
column3: Les immigrants qui arrivent en $COUNTRY$ sont souvent démunis. Bon nombre d'entre eux se sont installés dans les quartiers pauvres de $PROVINCENAME$ et ceux-ci ressemblent de plus en plus à des ghettos. Il serait bon d'agir pour améliorer ces conditions de vie déplorable avant que la situation ne s'aggrave.
column4: Neuankömmlingen in $COUNTRY$ fehlt es oft an Geld und Gelegenheiten. Viele von ihnen sind in den Armenvierteln von $PROVINCENAME$ gelandet, die zunehmend die Eigenschaften von Ghettos annehmen. Es wäre vielleicht eine gute Idee, etwas gegen diese verwahrlosten Lebensbedingungen zu unternehmen, sonst könnten sie schlechter werden.

column2: I'm not sure we can be bothered
column3: Je suis certain qu'on peut le faire.
column4: Ich bin mir nicht sicher, ob uns das interessiert.

column2: We shall certainly investigate the situation
column3: Nous devrions certainement approfondir la question.
column4: Wir sollten die Situation auf jeden Fall untersuchen.

column2: Newly arrived immigrants in of our provinces are finding it hard to assimilate into the broader $COUNTRY_ADJ$ populace, and many among the local population have come to view them as an alien presence. Immigrants live in separate areas of the city, go to separate schools and shops, and generally have very little contact with the extended community.
column3: Les immigrants nouvellement arrivés en $PROVINCENAME$ ont bien du mal à s'intégrer à la population $COUNTRY_ADJ$, au sein de laquelle nombreux sont ceux à les considérer comme des étrangers. Les immigrants vivent dans les quartiers bien distincts de la ville, fréquentent des écoles et des magasins différents et ont, de manière générale, que très peu de contact avec la communauté au sens large.
column4: Kürzlich eingetroffene Immigranten in $PROVINCENAME$ finden es schwierig, sich der breiteren $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Bevölkerung anzupassen, und viele Mitglieder der lokalen Bevölkerung nehmen sie mittlerweile aus ausländische Präsenz wahr. Einwanderer leben in gesonderten Stadtteilen, gehen auf andere Schulen und kaufen in anderen Geschäften ein. Generell haben sie kaum Kontakt zur allgemeinen Bevölkerung.

column2: They must be integrated, by force if necessary
column3: Ils doivent être intégrés, par la force, si nécessaire.

column2: Seems that the locals have the right ideas there!
column3: La population locale semble avoir raison sur ce point !
column4: Anscheinend hat die lokale Bevölkerung hier die richtigen Ideen!

column2: Following an extended period of civil unrest in one of our provinces, local anti-immigrant sentiments have exploded into a full scale riot. Shop windows have been smashed, and several of the recently arrived have been murdered, as immigrants are blamed for all manner of social ills, real or perceived
column3: Suite à l'agitation civile dont a été victime $PROVINCENAME$, des sentiments xénophobes se sont manifestés au cours d'une manifestation d'envergure. Des portes de magasins ont été défoncées et plusieurs immigrants ont été assassinés, ceux-ci étant jugés comme responsables de tous les maux sociaux, réels ou non.
column4: Nach längeren zivilen Unruhen in $PROVINCENAME$ ist die lokale Stimmung gegen Einwanderer nun in einem heftigen Aufstand explodiert. Da man die Immigranten für alle tatsächlichen und vermeintlichen sozialen Missstände verantwortlich macht, wurden mehrere der Neuankömmlinge ermordet. Außerdem wurden Schaufenster eingeworfen.

column2: Newly-arrived immigrants have brought with them the collected experiences of their home country, and their songs now blend with ours in the ever-changing symphony that is $COUNTRY$. Their customs have enriched our own, and created interesting new blends of cultural expression in the fields of art, science and architecture.
column3: Les immigrés qui viennent de s'installer en $PROVINCENAME$ sont imprégnés de la culture de leur pays natal. Leurs chants se mêlent désormais aux nôtres pour former une symphonie en constante évolution, la symphonie de $COUNTRY$. Leurs coutumes ont enrichi les nôtres et ce mélange culturel a engendré de nouvelles formes d'expression dans les domaines des arts, des sciences et de l'architecture.
column4: Die neu in $PROVINCENAME$ eingetroffenen Immigranten haben die kollektiven Erfahrungen ihres Heimatlandes mitgebracht. Ihre Lieder fließen nun in die in stetem Wandel befindliche Symphonie ein, die $COUNTRY$ darstellt. Ihre Gebräuche haben unsere eigenen bereichert und in den Bereichen Kunst, Wissenschaft und Architektur zu interessanten neuen kulturellen Ausdrucksformen geführt.

column2: ... why do people tell me these things?!
column4: ... warum wird mir sowas überhaupt berichtet?!

column2: A recent immigrant was put on the returning ship back home again, when local police caught him stealing from a local street vendor. The case has caused much alarm among the immigrant community, many of whom are unfamiliar with our justice system, who now fear that more deportations will follow.
column3: Un immigré récemment installé en $PROVINCENAME$ a été expulsé vers son pays d'origine après avoir été arrêté pour vol à la tire. L'affaire a fait grand bruit dans la communauté immigrée locale, beaucoup redoutant de nouvelles expulsions par méconnaissance de notre système judiciaire.
column4: Ein kürzlich in $PROVINCENAME$ eingetroffener Immigrant wurde mit einem Schiff zurück in seine Heimat geschickt, nachdem ihn die Polizei beim Bestehlen eines lokalen Straßenverkäufers ertappt hat. Dieser Fall hat die lokale Immigrantengemeinde, deren Angehörige sich meist mit unserem Rechtssystem nicht auskennen, stark alarmiert. Sie fürchten nun, weitere Deportationen könnten folgen.

column2: Try to assure them that all is well
column3: Il faut tenter de les rassurer.
column4: Versucht ihnen zu vermitteln, dass alles in Ordnung ist.

column2: Which is precisely what will happen!
column3: C'est exactement ce qui va se passer !
column4: Und genau das wird auch passieren!

column2: The immigrants to $PROVINCENAME$ have opened several new shops where specialties from their old homelands can be bought and savored, and this has meant that the local population can, for the first time, experience tastes from parts of the world hereto unknown to them. People who, a mere few years ago, ate the same food as their ancestors had for centuries, can now open their eyes and pallets to the culinary delights of a whole world.
column3: Les immigrés de $PROVINCENAME$ ont ouvert des boutiques proposant des spécialités de leur pays natal. Pour la première fois, la population locale découvre des saveurs jusque-là inconnues. Les gens qui, il y a quelques années à peine, mangeaient les mêmes plats que leurs lointains ancêtres, peuvent désormais s'ouvrir aux délices culinaires du monde entier.
column4: Die Einwanderer in $PROVINCENAME$ haben mehrere neue Geschäfte eröffnet, in denen man Spezialitäten ihrer Heimatländer kaufen und essen kann. Dies bedeutet, dass die lokale Bevölkerung zum ersten Mal mit Geschmäckern aus anderen Teilen der Welt in Berührung kommen. Menschen, die noch bis vor wenigen Jahren dasselbe gegessen haben wie ihre Vorfahren für Jahrhunderte, können nun ihren Horizont erweitern und kulinarische Höhepunkt aus aller Welt genießen.

column2: Our capital is now very isolated. We need to reconsider it.
We are maritime power, after all
We can rebuild the capital palace in Anvers right away!

As the Ottoman Empire grew in size and strength, Ottoman rulers beginning with Mehmet II began to claim caliphal authority. Their claim was strengthened when the Ottoman Empire defeated the Mamluk Sultanate in 1517 and took control of most Arab lands. The last Abbasid Caliph at Cairo, al-Mutawakkil III, was taken into custody and was transported to Istanbul, where he surrendered the Caliphate to Selim I.
column3: A mesure que l'empire ottoman grandissait en taille et puissance, les souverains ottomans commencèrent à prétendre à l'autorité califale. Leurs prétentions furent consolidés quand l'empire ottoman vaincu les Mamluks en 1517 et prit le contrôle des terres arabes. Le dernier calife abbasside au Caire, al-Mutawakkil III, fut fait prisonnier et emmené à Istanbul, où il renonça à son titre au profit de Selim I.
column4: As the Ottoman Empire grew in size and strength, Ottoman rulers beginning with Mehmet II began to claim caliphal authority. Their claim was strengthened when the Ottoman Empire defeated the Mamluk Sultanate in 1517 and took control of most Arab lands. The last Abbasid Caliph at Cairo, al-Mutawakkil III, was taken into custody and was transported to Istanbul, where he surrendered the Caliphate to Selim I.

column3: Prétentions arabes au titre de Calife

column2: $MONARCHTITLE$, Arabian fools are contesting your divine right to be the successor of Prophet Muhammad. It is forbidden for Muslims to have two Amirs for this would cause differences in their affairs and concepts, their unity would be divided and disputes would break out amongst them. The Sunnah would then be abandoned, the bida'a would spread and Fitna would grow, and that is in no one's interests. We should crush those daredevils!
column3: $MONARCHTITLE$, les illuminés arabes revendiquent votre titre de successeur du prophète Mahomet, la paix soit avec lui. Il est pourtant interdit aux musulmans d'avoir deux amîrs, car cela causerait des différences dans leurs concepts, l'unité du monde musulman serait brisée et ils se tourneraient les uns contre les autres. Mettons y un terme en écrasant ces illuminés!
column4: $MONARCHTITLE$, Arabian fools are contesting your divine right to be the successor of Prophet Muhammad. It is forbidden for Muslims to have two Amirs for this would cause differences in their affairs and concepts, their unity would be divided and disputes would break out amongst them. The Sunnah would then be abandoned, the bida'a would spread and Fitna would grow, and that is in no one's interests. We should crush those daredevils!

Construction work on the canal locks in Kiel-Holtenau in September 1893.

The Hamburg-American freighter, Palatia, Capt. Kopff, which arrived this morning, was the first steamer to pass through the new Kiel canal. The canal was practically finished, and it was to test the navigability that the Palatia was sent through. She touched bottom several times, but did not stick fast and sustained no damage. The New York Times, June 23, 1895.

column2: Work on the canal has halted. Once we regain control over Kiel we can complete it.

The Kiel Canal was finished in 1895 and took over 9000 workers 8 years to build. It connects the North Sea to the Baltic sea and has a length of 98 kilometres. The highest points lies at 25 metres above sea level, total excavation amounted to 100,0,000 cubic yards and the cost to bout 40,0,000 dollars.

column2: Today armed Bedouins have started a revolt among our workers at the Suez Canal and construction was halted until further notice. We suspect the British are behind this, they opposed our project from the beginning accusing us of using slave labor. The true reason is of course that the canal is a threat to their strategic interests. We have no other choice but to abolish Corvée (a form of unpaid labor) to resume the project. Unfortunately this affair will cost us dearly, both financially and timewise.

'On November 20, 1859 Ferdinand de Lesseps erected a bronze bust of Waghorn overlooking the mouth of the Suez Canal at the port of Tewfik. On the base, he inscribed these words of admiration: 'In homage to the memory of a generous though unfortunate man, who alone, without any help, by a long series of labours and heroic efforts, practically demonstrated and determined the adoption of the postal route through Egypt, and the communication between the East and the West of the world'

column2: A nation has started construction on the Suez Canal.
Annual dividends received from ownership of the Andagoya Canal.
We have assumed control over the Andagoya Canal.
The change of ownership of the canal means that our efforts have ended-- at least for the moment.
The plan for the Andagoya Canal has completed. Construction may now commence!
Let's put it off for at least another year.
The Culebra Cut in 1904 after the French handover. When the canal was finished a total of 76 million cubic metres was excavated, lowering the summit from 59 metres to 12 metres above sea level.
Let's put it off for a couple of years.
Construction of the Pedro Miguel locks, 1911.
Let's put it off for a couple of years.
Opening of the Andagoya Canal in 1914. Steamer SS Ancon entering Pedro Miguel locks from Culebra Cut.
In order to build a canal across the Andagoya isthmus, we will need to come to an agreement with the nation that controls it.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has approached us with a treaty to build a canal across the Andagoya isthmus. While this would have economic benefits for $COUNTRY$, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ negotiators have been incredibly aggressive-- and the terms they offer are almost insulting. If we agree, it will anger the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people and embarrass our country. Is this the act of a close ally?
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has signed our proposed treaty. Construction on the canal may begin!

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ negotiators are outraged. The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has refused our terms, fair though they were. Some have suggested this is hardly the act of an $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ally, and that $FROMCOUNTRY$ can no longer be trusted. They say we should aid the local rebels in the isthmus in setting up an independent government of their own, and that such a nation would be far more agreeable.
Aid the rebels. We will have our canal.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has dealt us a treacherous hand. Believing the Andagoyans will be far more agreeable to their treaty, they have prompted the rebels to declare independence from $COUNTRY$ and actively prevented us from crushing them. Some believe we should give in and repair relations with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ while we can. Still others say we should fight!

The Hay-Bunau-Varilla treaty was an agreement between the USA and the Andagoya granting exclusive canal rights to the USA across the isthmus of Andagoya in exchange for a financial reimbursement of 10,0,000 plus an annuity of 250,000.

The Andagoya Canal joins the Atlantic Ocean and the Pacific Ocean replacing the long and treacherous route around South America. Construction was first started in 1880 by the French but later abandoned due to technical problems, financial mismanagement and a high deathtoll of 22,000 thanks to tropical diseases. In 1904 construction was resumed by the USA who finished it in 1914. Even with medical advances more than 5,000 workers died and total cost was over 600,0,000 dollars.

column2: Diseases, particularly malaria and yellow fever, were one of the primary difficulties during construction of the Andagoya Canal. More than 22,000 were reported to have died during the French construction attempt. In spite of medical advances, more than 5,600 workers still died during the American construction years.

column2: Picture showing a fumigation car eradicating disease carrying mosquitos. In 1881 the mosquite was identified as the vector of malaria and yellow fever by Cuban physician and scientist Dr. Carlos Finlay. In the second construction attempt of the Andagoya Canal widespread measures were taken to prevent diseases and working conditions improved considerably.

column2: A Marion steam shovel excavating the Andagoya Canal in 1908. The Andagoya Canal, in particular the Culebra Cut, not only represented a challenge of excavation but also transportation. John Steven, an American engineer, developed an intricate rail system to move the dirt from the excavation site to dump sites. At the peak of construction effort,25,000 men removed a million cubic yards of material every day.

column2: Picture showing workers digging a small canal through the Cucaracha slide, a mass wasting of almost 400,000 cubic metres of clay. Constant landslides delayed the completion of the Andagoya Canal by nearly 2 years. One third of all excavated material from the Culebra Cut was brought into the cut by the landslides.

column2: Picture showing the Andagoya Canal Company Liquidation Court Trial in Paris, France. The Andagoya Canal Scandal was a corruption affair that broke out in the French Third Republic in 1892. Close to a billion francs were lost when the government took bribes to keep quiet about the Andagoya Canal Company's financial troubles, in what is regarded as the largest monetary corruption scandal of the 19th century.

column2: Start an official investigation (lowers the chance of bankruptcy).
Bankruptcy of the Andagoya Canal Company!

A caricature on the scandal. A concluding picture of the bankruptcy was formed in 1892. Some 800,000 French people, including 15,000 single women, had signed for stocks, bonds and founder shares from the Andagoya Canal Company, to the sum of - the then considerable amount of - approximately 1,8 billion gold Francs.
column3: A caricature on the scandal. It reads: 'Few new toys this year: we're liquidating everything that remains of the stock of jack-in-the-boxes that say: Papa, -Nana, -Mama, -Andagoya.' column2: Andagoya Canal construction is cancelled. (restart possible in 10 years)
Bail out the company, for the good of the country.
In 1902 the French sold their equipment to the Americans for 40 million dollars.

column2: A nation has started construction on the Andagoya Canal.
We wish them the best of luck.

The SS $CAPITAL$, a small military steamer, mysteriously sank yesterday while on port call in a foreign harbor, following a massive explosion on the starboard midship. Military Intelligence suggests that the explosion may have been caused by an overheated boiler, but the widely circulated scandal press, taking its usual liberties with truth in favor of expediency, has already seized the opportunity and are calling the explosion an act of sabotage and aggression by a foreign power. Our citizens are in ire over the affair, and calls for foreign blood to be spilled can be heard echoing on the streets of $CAPITAL$, the ships' namesake.
column3: Alors qu'il faisait escale dans un port étranger, le navire $CAPITAL$, un petit steamer militaire, a mystérieusement coulé hier à la suite d'une énorme explosion sur tribord. Les renseignements indiquent que l'explosion peut avoir été provoquée par la surchauffe d'une chaudière, mais la presse à scandale, et les libertés très controversées dont elle s'affuble, a profité de l'occasion et mis en avant la thèse du sabotage et de l'agression par une puissance étrangère. Cette affaire suscite la plus vive colère de nos concitoyens et des appels aux représailles résonnent dans les rues de $CAPITAL$, qui a donné son nom au navire.
column4: Die SS $CAPITAL$, ein kleiner Militärdampfer, ist gestern in einem ausländischen Hafen unter mysteriösen Umständen nach einer Explosion gesunken. Die Militäraufklärung vermutet hinter der Explosion einen überhitzten Heizkessel, aber die Skandalpresse nimmt sich ihre üblichen Freiheiten und hat die Explosion bereits als Sabotageakt und Aggression einer ausländischen Macht bezeichnet. Unsere Bürger sind wegen der Angelegenheit verärgert, und auf den Straßen von $CAPITAL$, Namensgeber des Schiffes, wird das Vergießen ausländischen Blutes gefordert.

column2: We cannot allow this treacherous act of barbarism to go unpunished!
column3: Il nous faut punir un acte aussi lâche que barbare !
column4: Dieser verräterische Akt der Barbarei darf nicht ungestraft bleiben!

column2: The explosion was an accident, and we cannot allow the mob to dictate foreign policy
column3: Cette explosion était un accident et nous ne pouvons pas laisser la foule dicter la politique étrangère.
column4: Die Explosion war ein Unfall und wir können uns unsere Außenpolitik nicht vom Pöbel bestimmen lassen.

column2: Our ambassador to one of the other great powers has telegraphed home expressing his frustration with the response, or rather, lack of it, that he has received while trying to settle a bilateral extradition treaty with the country in question. Apparently our ambassador has been snubbed repeatedly by this foreign administration, and has been delegated to speaking to civil servants instead of being allowed direct access to the country's decision makers. This diplomatic back-and-forth has been going on for two months.
column3: Notre ambassadeur en poste dans l'une des autres grandes puissances nous a adressé un message pour exprimer la frustration suscitée par la réponse, ou plus exactement l'absence de réponse, qu'il a reçue alors qu'il tentait de conclure un traité d'extradition bilatérale avec le pays en question. Apparemment, notre ambassadeur a été plusieurs fois remis à sa place par cette administration étrangère et s'est vu reléguer au rang d'interlocuteur des fonctionnaires, avec impossibilité de s'adresser directement aux décideur du pays. Ce va-et-vient diplomatique dure depuis deux mois.
column4: Unser Botschafter in einer der anderen Großmächte hat uns ein Telegramm geschickt, in dem er seine Frustration bezüglich der ausbleibenden Antwort auf seine Bemühungen nach einem bilateralen Auslieferungsvertrag mit dem fraglichen Land zum Ausdruck gebracht hat. Anscheinend ist unser Botschafter vom Außenministerium dieses Landes mehrfach brüskiert worden und musste mit Beamten sprechen anstatt Zugang zu den Entscheidungsträgern zu bekommen. Dieses diplomatische Hin und Her zieht sich bereits seit zwei Monaten hin.

column2: Inform them of the potential consequences of continued non-cooperation
column3: Les informer des conséquences potentielles de leur non-coopération persistante
column4: Informiert sie über die politischen Konsequenzen dieser fortwährenden Kooperationsverweigerung.

column2: Send an official letter thanking them for their time, and end the negotiations
column3: Leur adresser une lettre officielle pour les remercier pour leur temps et mettre fin aux négociations
column4: Wir werden uns in einem offiziellen Brief für ihre Zeit bedanken und die Verhandlungen abbrechen.

column2: A colonial regiment in one of our colonies has had an encounter with a regiment from another colonial power, which had, according to a military report, crossed into our colonial claim on an obscure waterway a fair distance into the colony's hinterland. The report further goes on to state that this foreign regiment was, when encountered by our patrol, in the process of conducting a geological survey of the area, the object of which is as of yet unknown to us. Hawkish members of our war cabinet see this as a direct assault on $COUNTRY$'s territorial integrity, and call for the execution of a plan they have termed, quite simply, 'Operation $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Fury'.
column3: Un régiment colonial de l'une de nos colonies s'est heurté à un régiment d'une autre puissance coloniale qui avait, selon un rapport militaire, accédé à notre territoire par un obscur cours d'eau avant de gagner l'arrière-pays de la colonie. Ce rapport indique, en outre, qu'au moment de son interception, ce régiment effectuait un relèvement géologique de la région dont nous ignorons les réelles motivations. Des membres bellicistes de notre cabinet de guerre y voient là une attaque directe contre l'intégrité territoriale de $COUNTRY$ et en appelle à l'exécution d'un plan qu'ils ont tout simplement appelé "Opération Fureur $COUNTRY_ADJ$".
column4: In einer unserer Kolonien ist eines unserer Kolonialregimenter auf ein Regiment einer anderen Kolonialmacht getroffen, das unseren Anspruch auf eine unbekannte Wasserstraße weit im Hinterland der Kolonie bestreitet. Der Bericht sagt weiter aus, dass dieses ausländische Regiment wohl geologische Untersuchungen im Gebiet unternahm, als es von unserer Patrouille gestellt wurde. Was es untersucht hat, ist noch unbekannt. Militaristische Mitglieder unseres Kabinetts sehen dies als direkten Angriff auf die territoriale Integrität von $COUNTRY$, und fordern die Ausführung eines Plans, den sie offensichtlich schon seit einiger Zeit in der Schublade haben: 'Operation $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Wut'.

column2: An invasion through there, and then deploy the troops so and so... interesting
column3: Une invasion par-ci, un déploiement de troupes par-là, etc., etc... Intéressant !
column4: Aha, eine Invasion hier, dann Truppeneinsatz da und dort ... interessant.

column2: I do not believe that this is really worth going to war over, truth to be told
column3: Je ne pense pas qu'une guerre soit nécessaire lorsque la vérité est dite.
column4: Um ehrlich zu sein: Ich glaube nicht, dass dies es wirklich wert wäre, deswegen in den Krieg zu ziehen.

column2: On this subject I would like to bring up the issue of a merchant, operating out of one of my constituencies, who wrote to me last month with a most distressing story of how trade goods of his had been seized by customs officials in a foreign port. Again, I can only reiterate that further tolerance of these abridgments of the unrestricted freedom of international trade will only serve to compound the problem further with every year that passes.'\n\nAn MP known for his ardent support of free trade has held a speech in parliament today, detailing grievances against a foreign power.
column3: Sur ce sujet, j'aimerais attirer votre attention sur le fait qu'un marchand, opérant hors d'une de mes circonscriptions, m'a adressé un courrier le mois dernier, courrier dans lequel il m'expliquait comment ses marchandises avaient été saisies par les fonctionnaires des douanes d'un port étranger. Là encore, je ne peux que répéter qu'une tolérance accrue face à de tels agissements contraires au libre échange international ne ferait qu'accentuer, au fil des années, le problème".\nUn membre du parlement, fervent défenseur du libre échange, a tenu un discours au parlement, aujourd'hui, pour dresser la liste des griefs à l'encontre d'une puissance étrangère.
column4: Bezüglich dieses Themas würde ich gerne von einem Händler berichten, der sein Geschäft aus einem meiner Wahlkreise betreibt: Letzten Monat schrieb er mir, dass seine Güter von den Zollbehörden in einem ausländischen Hafen konfisziert worden waren. Das ist höchst beunruhigend. Deshalb kann ich nur wiederholen, dass die weitere Toleranz dieser Verletzungen der internationalen Handelsfreiheit das Problem mit jedem Jahr, das vergeht, nur noch vergrößern.'\n\nEin Parlamentsmitglied, das für seine Brandreden berüchtigt ist, hat heute vor dem Parlament gesprochen und seinen Groll gegen eine ausländische Macht genau beschrieben .

column2: Intolerable! Forceful action must certainly be considered
column3: Intolérable ! Une mesure de force doit être envisagée.
column4: Eine Unverschämtheit! Gewaltsames Eingreifen stellt definitiv eine Option dar.

column2: Many moons have passed since the foreigners arrived on our shores, but many more shall not pass until they are forced again to leave, or so say the leaders of our religious and military castes. There has been talk in the high councils for some time now of showing the Europeans that they cannot unopposed continue this ravaging exploitation of our native homeland.
