There has been enough support for Italian unification for the Council of Italy to be declared a success, but we need to be wary of how the Great Powers of Europe will react to the Unification of Italy. Perhaps now any Italian state that has refused to support unification will reconsider and join us.
With the Etrurian Republic in control of the former Emilian duchies we appear stronger in the current negotiations!
With the Etrurian Republic in control of the former duchy of Ferrara we appear stronger in the current negotiations!
With the success of the Council of Italy, the new Republic of Italy has asked us to reconsider joining a united Italy. A refusal is likely to lead to war with Italy.
With the creation of the Republic of Italy, we should consider our diplomatic policy towards the new state.

The unification of Italy is a absolutely catastrophic national threat and could cause us to lose our Italian holdings and render our Mediterranean ambitions effectively dead. We cannot under any circumstances allow this to happen. We must conquer this new Italian state and ensure the dominance of Aragon in the Mediterranean.
Italy has been formed in the middle of the Council of Italy event series.

The debates on the future of Italy have been divided since the start between Etrurians and Monarchists. Lately the monarchist orators have been better than their Etrurian counterparts and have thus gained some influence in the Council.

The debates on the future of Italy have been divided since the start between Etrurians and Monarchists. Lately the Etrurian orators have been better than their Monarchist counterparts and have thus gained some influence in the Council.

The Pope, being the head of the Church command a wide respect amongst the faithful in Italy -and abroad. So when he declared that the idea of Italian unification was a noble idea worth of being pursued helped the cause of the Etrurians. Of course his critics on secularism, liberalism and his secular power were left out of the newspapers...

The Pope, the head of the Catholic Church has issued an encyclical against the 'sins' of Etruria and calling for the good Christians to denounce their behaviour and their ideas. Religion is an important societal component and his actions have left the Etrurians weakened.
Etruria is respected as a Great Power in Europe and thus appear as the natural leader of the Risorgimento.
We are the only chance Italy has!
Etruria is far from being respected amongst the European powers and it has thus been hard for them to appear as the obvious leader of the Italians.

Since their conquest of Provence the Dual-Monarchy has been interested in creating an Italian state favorable to their interests. Recently we have heard that some members of the Council would have changed their stance following 'gifts' from Paris, thus hampering our progress toward Italian unity.
The King of Aragon has attacked us wanting to destroy the Italian Republic
We will win in the end

The Trustee System, or 'Trusty System', was a corrections system originated in the U.S. state of Mississippi, but also employed in Alabama, Texas, Louisiana and others, under which prison convicts with a record of good behavior (often equated with obedience) were allowed to police other prison inmates in a strict, pseudo-military hierarchy of power, with some inmates, deemed especially trustworthy, even being allowed to carry firearms. For profit convict labor was a corner stone of the system. The trustee system was first employed on the Parchman Farm prison in Mississippi, and was, as the 19th century turned into the 20th, much lauded as a profitable and modern corrections system. Reports of widespread inmate abuses would end the system in the 1970s, but, in $YEAR$, it was all the rage in certain $COUNTRY_ADJ$ states.
column4: Das Trustee System, oder auch 'Trusty System', war ein Strafvollzugssystem, das im US-Bundesstaat entwickelt wurde, aber auch in Alabama, Texas, Louisiana und anderen Bundesstaaten Anwendung fand. Dabei wurde Insassen, die sich gut geführt hatten (bzw. gehorsam gewesen waren), erlaubt, andere Gefangene in einer strengen, pseudo-militärischen Hierarchie zu überwachen. Einige Insassen, die als besonders vertrauenswürdig eingestuft wurden, durften dabei sogar Schusswaffen tragen. Hinsichtlich des Profits stellte die Arbeit der Gefangenen die Basis des Systems da. Das Trustee System wurde zum ersten Mal in einem Gefängnis in Mississippi angewandt, das auch als Parchman Farm bekannt ist. Während des ausgehenden neunzehnten und beginnenden zwanzigsten Jahrhundert wurde dieses System sehr als profitables und modernes Strafvollzugsverfahren gepriesen. Berichte von umfassendem Missbrauch von Gefangen bedeuteten Ende der 1970er Jahre das Ende des Systems, aber im Jahr $YEAR$ war es in bestimmten $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Staaten wieder in Mode.

column2: The whip cracks out of love!
column4: Die Peitsche schnalzt aus lauter Liebe!
Das klingt aber alles eher ziemlich düster ...

column2: The idea of isolating offenders and breachers of the public peace from society in general is probably as old as time itself. Many classical systems of justice included banishment from the realm as a last resort type of punishment, reserved for serious crimes and offences, and such punishment was not seldom considered worse than a death penalty. With the growth of the European colonial empires during the 18th and 19th centuries, these ideas received a modern incarnation in the form of the penal colony, with renowned (or infamous) examples being the British colony at Botany Bay and the French 'Devil's Island' in French Guiana. Since $COUNTRY$ occupies several territories that could be well suited for such a purpose, perhaps we ourselves should consider establishing such institutions?
column4: Die Idee, Straftäter von der Gesellschaft zu isolieren ist wahrscheinlich einer der ältesten Ideen überhaupt. Viele klassische Rechtssysteme verfügten den Ausschluss aus dem Reich als äußerstes Strafmaß, das für schwere Verbrechen vorbehalten blieb und oft schlimmer als die Todesstrafe empfunden wurde. Mit dem Aufstieg der europäischen Kolonialreiche während des achtzehnten und neunzehnten Jahrhunderts wurde diese Idee in Form der Strafkolonie wieder aufgenommen. Berühmte bzw. berüchtigte Beispiele sind die britische Strafkolonie in Botany Bay und die französische 'Teufelsinsel' in Französisch-Guayana. Da $COUNTRY$ viele solcher Territorien besetzt hält, die für eine Strafkolonie gut geeignet wären, sollten wir uns vielleicht überlegen, solche Kolonien zu errichten ...

column2: No one escapes from Azazel's Atoll!
column3: Personne ne s'échappe de l'Atoll d'Azazel !

column2: I think there are more humane solutions to consider
column3: Je pense qu'il existe des solutions plus humaines
column4: Ich bin der Meinung, das es humanere Lösungen gibt ...

column2: Since we no longer hold any territories suitable for the purpose, our Penal Colony system has been abolished.
column3: Puisque nous ne disposons pas de territoires adaptés à un tel usage, notre système de colonie pénale a été aboli.
column4: Da wir nicht mehr über Territorien verfügen, die für Strafkolonien geeignet wären, haben wir unser Strafkoloniesystem abgeschafft.

column2: Oh well, it had to be so
column4: Na ja, es musste wohl so kommen.

column2:
Two dirty day-rooms, and three offensive night-rooms: That for men eight feet square: one of the women's, nine by eight, the other four and a half feet square: the straw, worn to dust, swarmed with vermin: no court: no water accessible to prisoners. The petty offenders were in irons: at my last visit, eight were women.'
- John Howard

A penal reform league has formed in $COUNTRY$, protesting the miserable conditions in our country's prisons and correctional facilities and institutions. The League argues for single ceiling accommodation policies in prisons, along with several other ideas aiming to improve the cramped living conditions.
column4:
Zwei schmutzige Tageszellen und drei widerliche Nachtzellen. Die für Männer war keine sechs Quadratmeter groß, die für Frauen keine sieben, die andere gar nur zwei Quadratmeter groß. Vom Stroh war kaum mehr als Staub übrig, überall war Ungeziefer und es gab kein Wasser für die Gefangenen. Die Kleinkriminellen waren in Eisen geschlagen. Bei meinem letzten Besuch waren acht Frauen darunter.'
- John Howard

In $COUNTRY$ hat sich eine Liga zur Strafrechtsreform gebildet, die die furchtbaren Bedingungen in den Gefängnisses unseres Landes anprangert. Die Liga plädiert für Einzelzellenunterbringung in Gefängnissen und bietet weitere Ideen zur Verbesserung der eingeengten Lebensbedingungen.

column2: The prisons are dirty for a reason, sweetie.
column3: Les prisons sont sales pour une raison, très cher.
column4: Schatzi, die Gefängnisse sind absichtlich so dreckig.

column2: Certain reforms are arguably in order
We must first secure a majority in the upper house
column3: Il nous faut d'abord obtenir la majorité à la Chambre haute
column4: Wir müssen uns erst im Oberhaus die Mehrheit sichern

column2: $COUNTRY$ is in a state of collective shock, as news broke today of a foul murder committed in one of our states. A young girl working as a prostitute in the state was found brutally battered by a client, and rumor has it that the police are covering up the identity of the murderer, who, it has been claimed, belongs to a rich banking family of some local renown. Police, however, maintain that they are still investigating the matter, but that no perpetrator has yet been located. The affair is on everyone's lips, and the debate has even reached parliament, where liberal MPs demand answers from the government regarding the matter.
column4: $COUNTRY$ ist schockiert, seit heute über einen schändlichen Mord in einem unserer Staaten berichtet wurde. Eine junge Prostituierte ist von einem Freier übel zugerichtet worden. Außerdem gibt es Gerüchte, dass die Polizei versucht, die Identität des Mörders zu vertuschen, der angeblich zu einer einflussreichen Bankiersfamilie gehört. Die Polizei dagegen behauptet, dass sie den Fall weiterhin untersucht, aber noch keinen Täter ermitteln konnte. Jedermann spricht über die Angelegenheit und selbst im Parlament ist sie nun Diskussionsgegenstand: Liberale Abgeordnete verlangen von der Regierungen Antworten.

column2: Demand that police produce a perpetrator
column3: Exiger que la police trouve un responsable
column4: Verlangen, dass die Polizei einen Täter präsentiert.

column2: Let us not throw allegations wildly about.
column3: Veillons à ne pas nous laisser aller à des allégations hasardeuses.
column4: Lasst uns hier nicht wild mit Anschuldigungen um uns schmeißen.

column2: Up and down the roads they march, in single narrow defile, carrying with them, wherever they go, the iron chains of unfree men. These people are not slaves, but convicts, and they have been sentenced by courts and magistrates of justice and peace, to work and spill their sweat under the burning sun. They are a common sight in $COUNTRY$, for there are many men like them. Forced labor is, and has long been, one of the most common forms of punishment available to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ courts. Hard work, it has been said, will improve the moral understanding of these cretins, and, therefore, work they do.
column4: Sie marschieren die Straßen in langen Einzelreihen auf und ab, und tragen die Eisenfesseln unfreier Männer mit sich. Die Männer sind keine Sklaven, sondern verurteilte Straftäter, die dazu verurteilt wurden, unter der glühenden Sonne Strafarbeit zu verrichten. In $COUNTRY$ sind sie bei weitem kein seltener Anblick. Zwangsarbeit ist schon lange einer der üblichsten Strafen, die $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Gerichte aussprechen. Harte Arbeit, sagt man sich, wird das moralische Verständnis dieser Schwachköpfe verbessern, und deshalb schwingen sie Spitzhacke und Schaufel.

column2: We need to consider more humane forms of punishment
column3: Il nous faut envisager des châtiments plus humains.
column4: Wir müssen humanere Bestrafungen in Betracht ziehen.

column2: A state-wide manhunt has been called in one of our states, as police report that a convicted murderer has escaped from a local prison facility. While unsettling in itself, the news has also brought our nation's prison system to the public spot-light, fueling a national debate on the issues of crime & punishment. Liberals argue that the escape merely serves as further indictment of the delapidated and tragic state of our nation's prison system, while conservatives point to the natural constraints on the national budget, and argue that we should not spend the better part of our money on what is arguably the worst part of our citizenry.
column4: In einem unserer Staaten wurde eine landesweite Verbrecherjagd gestartet, nachdem die Polizei den Ausbruch eines verurteilten Mörders aus einem lokalen Gefängnis gemeldet hat. Während die Nachricht an sich schon beunruhigend ist, so hat sie auch das Gefängnissystem unserer Nation ins Rampenlicht gebracht und eine nationale Debatte über die Themen Verbrechen & Bestrafung ausgelöst. Liberale argumentieren, der Ausbruch sei lediglich ein weiterer Beweis für den maroden und tragischen Zustand des Gefängnissystems unserer Nation, während Konservative auf den eingeschränkten Staatshaushalt hinweisen und davon abraten, einen bedeutenden Teil unseres Geldes für den Bodensatz unserer Gesellschaft ausgeben.

column2: And then we have this little fellow. Started out with the proverbial pins and needles and pretty soon he was on to robbing banks. He'll be spending the rest of his life here, so we keep him in chains most of the time. I suspect it will drive him insane in a few years, if it hasn't already.'\n\nImprisonment for life, without the possibilit of parole, is not an uncommon punishment in $COUNTRY$, however, in certain liberal circles there have been arguments on the nature of crime and punishment lately, with the opinion being advanced that a human being in chains is incapable of being swayed by the angels of his better nature, while kept under miserable conditions. There is a growing movement for a liberalization of the prison laws.
column4: Und dann haben wir diesen kleinen Kerl hier. Kaum hatte er mit Kleindiebstählen angefangen, war er auch schon auf den Geschmack von Banküberfällen gekommen. Er wird den Rest seines Lebens hier verbringen, die meiste Zeit davon in Ketten. Ich vermute, das dürfte ihn in wenigen Jahren verrückt machen, falls er es nicht längst ist.'\n\nLebenslänglich ohne Aussicht auf Bewährung ist in $COUNTRY$ kein seltenes Strafmaß. Liberale Kreise aber haben kürzlich argumentiert, dass ein leidender Mensch in Ketten nicht von den Engeln seines besseren Wesen berührt werden könne. Die Bewegung zur Reform des Strafgesetzes bekommt immer mehr Zulauf.

column3: Il pourrait être bon d'y réfléchir
column4: Dies können wir sicherlich in Betracht ziehen.

column2: I say we stick with the old ways
column3: Nous nous en tenons aux bonnes vieilles méthodes
column4: Lasst uns bei den alten Gepflogenheiten bleiben.

column2: As the 19th century dawned on Europe, the practice of jailing people who defaulted on their debts was still norm. In England, infamous examples of such institutions - Debtor's Prisons - include London's Fleet Prison. In these institutions debtors where not seldom expected to pay for both board and room, and sometimes even special 'Jailor's Fees', to effectively pay their jailors for their upkeep. Often times, these practices only served to further complicate the debtor's financial situation, as it for natural reasons is hard to earn money from inside a prison wall. The system was gradually abandoned in most European countries throughout the 19th century, and London's Fleet Prison was torn down in 1846. A wrongly jailed $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aristocrat is now drawing public attention to these institutions, calling for their abolishment.
column4: Noch wenige Jahrzehnte vor dem neunzehnten Jahrhundert war es noch gängige Praxis, zahlungsunfähige Menschen zu inhaftieren. Das Londoner Fleet-Gefängnis in England war ein berüchtigtes Beispiel für eine derartige Einrichtung. In diesen Gefängnissen wurde es von den Schuldnern nicht selten verlangt, für Kost und Logis selbst aufzukommen. Manchmal mussten sie sogar zusätzliche 'Jailor's Fees' entrichten, um den Unterhalt der Gefängnisse, in den sie einsaßen, zu sichern. Oftmals wurde die finanzielle Situation eines inhaftierten Schuldners dadurch nur noch verschlimmert, da das Geldverdienen hinter Gefängnismauern selbstverständlich sehr mühsam war. Im Verlauf des neunzehnten Jahrhunderts wurde das System in den meisten europäischen Ländern allmählich abgeschafft. Das Londoner Fleet-Gefängnis wurde im Jahr 1846 abrissen. Ein zu Unrecht inhaftierter $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Aristokrat zieht nun die öffentliche Aufmerksamkeit auf diese Einrichtung und verlangt deren Abschaffung.

column3: Cette question mérite d'être prise en compte

column2: I am not convinced. People need to learn lessons in life
column3: Je n'en suis pas convaincu. Dans la vie, il convient de tirer des leçons de ses agissements.
column4: Ich bin nicht überzeugt. Die Leute müssen ihre Lektionen lernen.

column2: A debate in the $CAPITAL$ Reform Club tonight, regarding the death penalty, has seen new arguments advanced from the opponents of the punishment. Focusing in on the irrevocability of the punishment, in tandem with the ever present risk of wrongful sentencing, liberals have joined together to form a Citizen's committe to abolish the sentence. The debate has been caused by the much publicized recent execution of an elderly gentleman convicted of murdering his wife, despite the fact that the man was clearly in the advanced stages of age related dementia. The newly founded committee calls upon members of parliament to speak out against what they consider to be the most horrendous of injustices, and have sought an audience with the cabinet to explain their position.
column4: Eine Debatte im $CAPITAL$-Reformverein über die Todesstrafe hat heute Nacht neue Argumente gegen die Todesstrafe geliefert. Wichtigste Punkte dabei waren die Unwiderruflichkeit des Todesurteils und das allgegenwärtige Risiko einer ungerechten Verurteilung. Liberale machen jetzt mit einem Bürgerkomitee zur Abschaffung der Todesstrafe gemeinsame Sache. Die Debatte wurde durch die stark publizierte, vor kurzem vollzogene Hinrichtung eines betagten Ehrenmannes für den Mord an seiner Frau ausgelöst, obwohl der Mann ganz eindeutig bereits stark dement war. Das neugegründete Komitee ruft Parlamentsmitglieder auf, sich gegen diese in ihren Augen entsetzliche Ungerechtigkeit auszusprechen, und haben beim Parlament um eine Audienz gebeten, um ihren Standpunkt darzulegen.

column2: I shall certainly be happy to meet with them
column3: Je serai ravi de rencontrer les membres de ce comité.
column4: Ich werde mich gewiss gerne mit ihnen treffen.

column2: I do not have time for the foppish drivel of bleeding-heart liberals!
column3: Je n'ai pas de temps à consacrer à ces libéraux affectés !
column4: Für das geckenhafte Gefasel dieser sentimentalen Liberalen habe ich keine Zeit!

column2: Dangerous ideas are afloat in $COUNTRY$, with the first stirrings of resistance against our nation's ruler being reported. Such talk is kept quiet, if there is truth to it at all.
It shall not amount to much.

A recent demonstration in $PROVINCENAME$ has brought attention to the plight of natives in $STATENAME$, namely to their oppression by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government and their demands for independence. If something isn't done soon we may be facing intervention by foreign powers.
Work with these people to solve their issues.

A recent riot in $PROVINCENAME$ has brought a great deal of attention to $STATENAME$-- the kind that would normally prompt the great powers to consider intervention. It seems, however, that the demands for independence by 'uncivilized' peoples has largely fallen on deaf ears. News of the trouble has faded away as quickly as it began.
Good. We need no interference in $STATENAME$.

While recent trouble in $STATENAME$ has raised the spectre of foreign intervention once again, there are many who remember the last crisis over $STATENAME$'s people as if it were yesterday. Try as they might, the world is simply not ready to listen to them again-- yet.

A demonstration by $PROVINCECULTURE$ citizens in $PROVINCENAME$ quickly got out of hand as $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers shot into the crowd to disperse it. A riot ensued, and several protestors were slain. Throughout $STATENAME$, the reaction has been one of outrage-- and there is an effort by some $PROVINCECULTURE$ malcontents to draw the attention of the world, just one more example of $COUNTRY$'s disregard for peace and civilized behavior-- or so they'll say.
Let the world think what it likes.

The ongoing Ottoman Civil war present us with an interesting choice right now. We have asserted our independence from the Empire recently and we have become a beacon of hope for the Slav populations living under the Muslim yoke. A proposition was made recently to enter a war against the Empire to free Serbia before Hungary or another vulture takes the territory for itself. Or we could just wait for the Empire to be in an even worse situation and take the territory for ourselves .
We will free Serbia from the Ottomans !
It is not the right time ...
The Sultan has conceded us the vilayet of Serbia. We will now look carefully the actions of our Slavic brothers...
Our brothers need to be protected
The end of the Personal Union

Serbia has been ruled by our king since its liberation near the end of the Ottoman Civil War but has enjoyed a relative autonomy in its internal affairs. The young king Tomislav II who was crowned recently has decided to bring this matter to its end and has reclaimed the unification of the crown of Tomislav and Stefan.
The Illyrian king has issued a declaration in which he asks for a closer union of the Croats and the Serb. But can we really trust him ?
The Union of the Croats and the Serbs
Serbia is now an integral part of our nation and its people is supporting our rule !
Belgrade and the entire Serbian provinces have revolted and want to dethrone Tomislav II and put a Serb noble on the throne !

Before the Civil War, Montenegro was divided in various principalites. The Metropolitan finally achieved unification around him and went on expelling the powerful Simic family which ruled Kotor. The heir to the war hero Peter Simic, Joseph Simic is an idealistic panslavist and he has many times confessed that his father wanted Montenegro to join the Illyian kingdom. We could let him act and enter Montenegro with followers to see if we could not force the Metropolitan to bow before us.

The Illyrian have allowed the claimant to the dukedom of Montenegro, Jospeh Simic to sneak into Kotor where he actually tries to convince people to join our heretic neighbour. Should we take action against him, it is likely the Croat will advance into our country so we must try to find someone to back our independence.
The Metropolitan will step down and accept the claim of Simic ...
Contact Venice we need help to defend ourselves ...
Contact Aragon we need help to defend ourselves ...
Contact Italy we need help to defend ourselves ...
Our agent, the duke of Kotor has taken power in Montenegro and has asked to join our kingdom !
That was a good idea to send him
The Illyrians threaten the rule of the Metropolitan who has asked us to protect him. How should we react ?
It is not in our interest
The Metropolitan has been swift to act against Simic. He expelled him and has found an ally to protect him in case we decide to invade his country ...
We will let them alone ... for now
We will take Montenegro by force then. Nothing stops the Yugoslavs !

The Metropolitan tried to find someone to protect him after the expulsion of Simic but $FROMCOUNTRY$ refused to protect him. We can now easily override their defences and annex Montenegro into our glorious kingdom !
We will take Montenegro by force then. Nothing stops the Yugoslavs !

During the Ottoman Civil War, Hungary attacked the Empire and took Belgrade while we were liberating Serbia. It has been a long time since their campaign of "protection" of the Serbs and we have a duty to ask them to give Belgrade to the crown of Stefan

The Illyian King has issued a declaration in which he demands us to relinquish the Serbian lands we captured during the Civil War. The Serbs have been restless around their old capital and holding unto them will harm relations with our allies.
Like we would give up Belgrade
Hungary has refused to give back Belgrade to Serbia. It is our duty to fight and free Serbia from the horrid Magyar !
We have no other choices then !

To ensure the peace between our nations, Dahomey has been paying us tribute ever since the 18th century. It has become tradition at this point, but Dahomey has just rejected it. The tribute was the only thing keeping us from attacking them, now we let's show them why they paid it in the first place!
We have managed to keep our independence and are no longer obligated to pay tribute to the Oyo Empire. This is a great day for our nation. Let the flag of the elephant fly in the winds!
It is a dark day for our nation, we tried to break free and we failed. This was not the day of the flag of the elephant...

The Dahomey Amazons were originally established as a group of female elephant hunters in the 17th century by King Houegbadja, in the early 18th century his son, King Agaja, made them into the bodyguards of the king, armed with muskets. According to tradition, Agaja also developed them into a militia that helped win a war against the Kingdom of Savi. What their job in the army always has been is just to hold banners to make the army seem bigger than it actually is, however some suggest that we might make even better use of them if they were turned into an actual female corp that'd fight.
Summon the daughters of every family for military training!
Keep them ceremonial and let them help the economy when we're at peace

The idea of an absolute monarch being able to rule better than a feudal one is spreading throughout the kingdom, although not widespread it continues to be more and more popular. They are taking the European states and some of our neighbors as proof of absolutism being better, seeing as many of them seem to be more successful. Maybe we can capitalize on this and abolish the stubborn tribes of our Kingdom?
We must implement these ideas immediately
We can't break this age old tradition

The market for slavery is doing worse and worse everyday, people don't want to buy new ones and instead try to sell their old ones. Some of the reasons for this are that slaves have demanded more and more rights under the years and you now have the responsibility of taking care of your slaves well being as well as many slave revolts in the Kingdom resulting in several owners killed. The advisers are trying to come up with ideas with how we can fix this problem, but so far the only options we seem to have are either loosening the restrictions on owning a slave and encouraging slavery amongst the farms or just completely abolish slavery as many consider it unethical as well as it not being very beneficial for the economy.
I suppose it's a bit outdated

The culture in Dahomey has always been very distinct from elsewhere in Africa. Much of the arts are subsidized by the royal family and the artists aren't of any specific class, but instead can be created by anyone from a lord to a peasant. One of the many things that make our country so great is the Royal Palaces of Abomey which are several palaces spread over a large complex, every palace contains stone carvings depicting the many accomplishments of the king and every king had his own palace. There are two unique aspects of art in Dahomey, firstly it's the assembling of different components, using many different materials, and secondly it's the borrowing of culture from neighboring people. Some say our focus should lie in developing our own culture, but many are also intrigued by the cultures of the outside world. We could either focus on and subsidize our own local culture and develop it or we could embrace some of the western ideas in hopes of becoming more like them or we could embrace some of our Islamic neighbors' traditions and learn from them instead.
Embrace our own great and beautiful culture
Embrace some of the western beliefs
Integrate some of the Islamic culture into our society

While there's no doubt that our country is great and beautiful it is no lie that we are behind many other countries in the region, especially the European nations on the coast. We must combat this by developing our own country into something it couldn't even imagine a few generations ago. One of the biggest reasons the Europeans, and some of our neighbors, are so ahead is their academia, theirs are much larger than ours. To be able to transform into a developed country we must increase it, however we're not completely sure of what the best way of doing do would be. Some say educating the people is the best way, just look at the literacy rate in Europe, while some say that we should just further educate what we have and refine it into an elite.
We must educate our people, it is a human right!
We should focus on further educating our already intelligent

Recently we've received several reports of of raidings from the Ewe chiefs, and all of them are claiming that the raiders are Akans. They are telling us that the raiders are coming on a weekly basis, stealing food and loot. Confronting some of the leaders of the Akan people they told us that they were former soldiers who pillaged for food and then claimed that they couldn't do anything about it.
Helping A Home or A Helping Hand?

Our nation has developed into something so magnificent, all of Africa adores it. Our great handling of diplomacy, economy and military has led us to this beautiful moment. The only question left is, where do we go now? People in the capital have talked about a great metropolis that might as well be the capital of Africa, others have mentioned that we should help the other peoples of Africa reach the same greatness as us by embracing them into our society.
Our capital will be the envy of Africa!
We should embrace and help our minorities.
The lands of the Yoruba people are under our control and administration. The benevolent rulers we are we shall grant them full minority rights and embrace their fascinating culture.
The lands of the Ibo people are under our control and administration. The benevolent rulers we are we shall grant them full minority rights and embrace their fascinating culture.
The lands of the Ibibio people are under our control and administration. The benevolent rulers we are we shall grant them full minority rights and embrace their fascinating culture.
The lands of the Kru people are under our control and administration. The benevolent rulers we are we shall grant them full minority rights and embrace their fascinating culture.
The lands of the Mossi people are under our control and administration. The benevolent rulers we are we shall grant them full minority rights and embrace their fascinating culture.
Dangerous ideas are afloat in $COUNTRY$, with the first stirrings of resistance against our nation's ruler being reported. Such talk is kept quiet, if there is truth to it at all.
It shall not amount to much.

These are the headlines in the revolutionary newspaper being secretly printed in $PROVINCENAME$. Nobody seems to know who is behind it, and so far inquiries have turned up nothing. It seems the agitators are better organized than we thought.
Find those responsible and shut down this tripe!
Thousands of people flooded into $CAPITAL$'s central square today, demanding a democratic constitution and universal suffrage. Breaking up the crowd will lead to violence, with more to surely come.
Our secret police have reported evidence of armed revolutionaries organizing in $COUNTRYNAME$. Should we make an investigation?
Chasing them will only rouse more anger.
Yes! Increase efforts to track them down.
Our secret police have found the revolutionaries' hideout and arrested all activists.

An unknown assailant made an assassination attempt on $COUNTRY$'s president, but, thanks to his bodyguards, the president remained unharmed. Unfortunately, the attacker was slain and could not be questioned for information. Police have redoubled their search for the conspirators responsible.

Today is a grim day for $COUNTRY$. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ president has been shot dead this night in $CAPITAL$. He was the victim of an ambush plotted by radical liberals. The country has been thrown into mourning, though even now there is word that factions in $COUNTRY$ are maneuvering to either find a successor to take the president's place or overthrow the dictatorship once and for all.

With the death of $COUNTRY$'s president, the dictatorship has come to an end. Pro-democracy forces have succeeded in taking control of $CAPITAL$, and are already promising widespread reforms as well as a new constitution.

The death of the president has not succeeded in causing $COUNTRY$'s dictatorship to crumble. His new successor greeted a crowd in $CAPITAL$, waving from the balcony of the presidential palace. Already the new president's supporters are searching out revolutionary hideouts, determined to prevent the same fate from befalling $COUNTRY$'s new leader.
All shall be right in $COUNTRY$ once more.
After years of dictatorship $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens finally enjoy freedom.

One of the most common killers in the 19th century was tuberculosis, an infectious disease in humans that usually targets the lungs. Known today to be caused by various strains of mycobacteria, the historical explanations for tuberculosis range from vampirism to imbalances in the 'cardinal fluids'. Known since ancient times, and first described as a contagious disease by Avicenna in 1020, typical symptoms of the disease include chronic cough, fever, and the expulsion of blood-tinged phlegm. In the 19th century, the disease was sometimes romanticized, as several famous authors and poets of the era were known sufferers.
column4: Einer der größten Geißeln der Menschheit im neunzehnten Jahrhundert war die Tuberkulose, eine ansteckende Krankheit, die meistens die Lungen befällt. Heute weiß man, dass sie durch verschiedene Mykobakterien-Stämme ausgelöst wird. Historische Erklärungen der Tuberkulose reichen von Vampirismus bis zum Ungleichgewicht der 'Kardinalflüssigkeiten'. Diese Krankheit ist seit dem Altertum bekannt und wurde erstmals von Avicenna im Jahr 1020 als ansteckende Krankheit beschrieben. Typische Symptome sind chronischer Husten, Fiber und die Ausscheidung blutversetzten Schleims. Im neunzehnten Jahrhundert wurde die Krankheit manchmal im romantischen Licht gesehen, da mehrere berühmte Autoren und Dichter dieser Ära unter ihr litten.

column2: Despite economic and technological advances in the Western World, one of the oldest killers known to man, hunger, was still claiming victims in Europe and the Americas well into the 20th century. Primarily so, of course, among the already poor. Famine has struck one of our states, and we need to react.
column4: Während Epidemien und weitreichende Hungersnöte in der westlichen Welt durch die Entwicklung moderner, kapitalistischer Freihandelssysteme und der extensiven Unterteilung der Arbeiterschaft sowie neue Fortschritte auf agrarkulturellem Gebiet fast gänzlich verschwanden, forderte der Hunger, eine der größten Geißeln der Menschheit überhaupt, in Europa und den beiden Amerikas bis weit ins zwanzigste Jahrhundert etliche Opfer. Davon waren natürlich hauptsächlich jene betroffen, die bereits arm waren. In einem unserer Staaten ist eine Hungersnot ausgebrochen, und wir müssen darauf reagieren!

column3: Nous devons aider ceux qui ont faim !

column2: Sorry, I gave at the office.
column3: Désolé, je laisse aux autres le soin de s'en occuper.
column4: Sorry, ich hab im Büro schon was gegeben.

column2: Most commonly transmitted through the ingestion of contaminated food or water, exasparated by combinations of poor hygiene, cramped living and lacklustre public sanitation, Typhoid fever was one of the major killers of the 19th century. In Chicago alone, 174 deaths per 100,000 was, in 1891, caused by typhoid fever. The disease, which generally starts of as a mild fever, will over the course of a few weeks manifest itself in internal bleedings and delirium, potentially causing death. While improvements in sanitary conditions eventually came to more or less eradicate the disease in the developed world, at least one $COUNTRY_ADJ$ state was nevertheless hit hard in $YEAR$.
column4: Typhus, der üblicherweise durch die Aufnahme verseuchten Wassers oder Essens übertragen wird, war eine Folge schlechter Hygiene, beengter Lebensbedingungen sowie ineffizienter Abwasser- und Abfallentsorgung. Diese Krankheit gehörte im neunzehnten Jahrhundert zu den tödlichsten Krankheiten überhaupt. Alleine in Chicago starben im Jahr 1891 von 100000 Menschen 174 an Typhus. Diese Krankheit beginnt normalerweise mit leichtem Fieber und führt im Laufe einiger Wochen zu internen Blutungen, Delirium und kann tödlich enden. Obwohl Verbesserungen bei der Abwasser- und Abfallentsorgung die Krankheit in der entwickelten Welt mehr oder weniger auslöschen konnte, wurde im Jahr $YEAR$ trotzdem ein $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Staat hart von ihr getroffen.

column2: The 'Spanish' Flu was an influenza pandemic that killed somewhere between 50-100 million people worldwide between the years 1918 to 1920. Due to increased trade, colonial contacts, commerce and other myriads of global connections that had all increasingly made the world a smaller place throughout the 19th century, the Spanish flu was able to spread quickly across the world in a mere few years. Further aggrevated by the on-going first world war, and the cramped living conditions in the trenches, the Spanish flu is one of the first and most terrifying examples of a truly global pandemic. And... come to think of it... haven't you been feeling a bit feverish, lately?
column4: Die 'Spanische Grippe' war eine Grippepandemie, der zwischen 1918 und 1920 weltweit zwischen 50 und 100 Millionen Menschen zum Opfer fielen. Verstärkte internationale Handelsbeziehungen, Kontakte mit Menschen aus Kolonien und anderweitige globale Verbindungen hatte die Welt im neunzehnten Jahrhundert zu einem kleineren Ort gemacht. Aus diesem Grund konnte sich die spanische Grippe innerhalb weniger Jahre auf der ganzen Welt verbreiten. Zusätzlich verschlimmert wurde sie durch die Kämpfe des ersten Weltkriegs und die beengten Lebensbedingungen in den Schützengräben. Die spanische Gruppe ist eine der ersten und fürchterlichsten Beispiele für eine echte globale Pandemie. Und ... wo wir gerade dabei sind ... haben Sie in letzter Zeit nicht auch ein bisschen Fieber gehabt?

column2: Fight the disease with every avaliable means
column3: Combattez cette maladie coûte que coûte
column4: Die Krankheit mit allen zur Verfügung stehenden Mitteln bekämpfen.

column2: Smallpox, a highly contagious disease caused by the Variola virus, killed approximately 400,000 Europeans per year at the end of the 18th century. Successful vaccination programs undertaken in the 19th and 20th centuries would eventually lead to the disease being classified as eradicated by the WHO in 1979, but that might be a small comfort to the people in that state of yours who, in $YEAR$, suffered hard from an outbreak of, exactly that: Smallpox.
column4: Die vom Variola-Virus hervorgerufene, höchst ansteckende Pockenkrankheit, tötete Ende des achtzehnten Jahrhunderts ungefähr 400000 Europäer. Erfolgreiche Impfungsprogramme des neunzehnten und zwanzigsten Jahrhundert führten letztendlich dazu, dass die Krankheit im Jahr 1979 von der WHO als ausgelöscht eingestuft wurde. Dies ist aber für die Bevölkerung Ihres Staats, wo im $YEAR$ eine Pockenepidemie ausgebrochen ist, wohl nur ein geringer Trost.

column2: Do whatever we can. Every life is precious!
column3: Faire notre possible. Chaque vie est précieuse !
column4: Alles Menschenmögliche unternehmen. Jedes Leben ist kostbar!

column2: Weak and unable to resist, you say?
column3: Faibles et incapables de résister, vous dites ?

column2: For a long time we have coveted the Alpine passes held by the Duke of Savoy. The Dual-Monarchy faces open rebellion and is thus less inclined to protect the Duke.
Burgundy asks us to relinquish our Alpine lands to integrate them into 'the Duchy of Geneva'. With the Dual-Monarchy facing harsh unrest we should not count too much on their protection
We will not risk a war against Burgundy ...
We will not surrender our ancestral lands !
The duke of Savoy has refused, meaning that only war will resolve the problem of the Alpes.

Given the linguistic and cultural composition of our heartland, experts from the Académie de Langues, the main entity concerning language in our realm, consisting of experts of both English and French, know that the Dual Monarchy of England and France has remained aloof for years regarding matters of official language across the nation. Strong regionalism exists to this day, with regions which practically entirely use French, and some that do the same with the English language. However, there's also the ever-growing Anglois movement, which expanded across the most important areas of our realm, leaving the French and English languages in zealous use in the farthest areas of England and France, where the Anglois are met with extreme prejudice. It is know that denying an official policy towards language will only continue to alienate the two main groups of our great realm, so a decision must be made by the Académie. However, should they not decide on time, the King shall intervene, for he always knows what is best for the nation.
A decision will have to be made.

Ever since the Treaty of Rome in 1498, the Dual Monarchy has had to walk a fine line in not favouring one of its ethnic groups, or it would face extreme prejudice from the others. Recent censi have shown that the English and French represent around one-fifth of the population, with very rigid regionalism in the farthest parts of our constituent nations.. What is more threatening to either group is not the other but rather a growing group calling themselves Anglois. The Anglois have created what some call a schism in our state, since it shifts away our priorities which were once centered around either the French, or the English. The Académie de Langues has to set a final vote regarding the language that will be officially sponsored in matters of the realm.
Say, those Anglois do make some solid points...

After being completely alienated in favor of a metropolitan minority, obtaining peace between the angry French and English mobs will not be an easy task. Our wise monarch. Henri X, knows it very well. The French and English despise each other, but the only thing bigger than their hate against each other is their hate for Paris, and especially the Anglois, who for them, are a complete abomination. So if both of them were to rally against the new Anglois order, it would be disastrous. Trying times are head, our government must tread extremely carefully, for a full blown revolution by either of majority groups, would be completely disastrous for our nation and would most certainly spell our undoing
The Death of King Henri X

Tragedy has struck the Dual Monarchy as His Majesty King Henri X has passed with no heir. Due to traditional laws within the Dual Monarchy, the Estates-General has been called to select their choice for the next ruler of the Kingdom. The Estates have narrowed the selection between Elisabeth, Duchess of Anjou, Edouard, the Duke of York, and Henri, the Duke of Gascony.
Who will succeed on the throne ?

Despite some opposition votes the Estates-General has declared that Elisabeth will be the next Queen of the Dual Monarchy. Being the daughter of the King's brother gave her the strongest claim to the throne but her pro-Anglois ties has led to some opposition from those in France and England. Both Edouard and Henri have respected the Estates decision and pledged their support to Elisabeth in the future of the Dual Monarchy

It took the Estates-General some rounds of voting but they have settled on Edouard, the Duke of York, as the next King of the Dual Monarchy. England has received the news with great joy while France is worried of potential retribution by the new king for past injustices. Elisabeth and Henri have renounced the throne but Henri vows that he will participate in the Parliament of Lords in preventing bias legislation by the King from being passed.

To the shock of many Henri, the Duke of Gascony, has been elected the next King of the Dual Monarchy. His election as King has been received with joy in the southern regions of the country but outrage has broken out in England. Elisabeth and Edouard has both renounced the throne but Edouard expressed his great displeasure with the results.
England is now free but what form of government shall it take?
We will crown a noble king of England

The Anglois will surely not let us go so easily and we are at a disadvantage. We need to contact a Great Power to counter the threat from Paris : Scandinavia has a good navy and shares a border in Scotland
column3: Burgundy will surely dominate on the Continent, Aragon can easily pierce through Occitania.

column2: The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have revolted against the Dual-Monarchy and are asking to protect them from the Anglois. Such a move will lead to war against Paris but it is a golden opportunity to weaken the Plantagenets!
It is not in our interest ...
The English will face our might !
The English will be taught the true power of the Dual-Monarchy !

After the questions of the last years, the monarchy has affirmed its French character. Rooted in Paris, the monarchy has gained the support of the French population and of its leaders. This French orientation has allowed them to suppress any rebellion in the South but in the same time has alienated them a great part of the English population...

The radicalization of the English society has increased over the past few months. The French turnout of Henri X has alienated him many Englishmen, who were eager to support the monarchy have turned to the liberal hydra. Yesterday the repression of a student manifestation in Cambridge has launched a spiral of violence all over England. It has culminated in the creation of the English Republic which is decided to push the French out of England. Apart from some loyalists bastion in Wales and Londres, the revolutionaries are already in control of most the island.

The king of the Dual-Monarchy has organised a great ceremony throughout the cities of France to honour his ancestor Louis XI king of France later sanctified as Saint Louis. He has put the accent on the treaty of Paris who settled peace between the Plantagenets and the Capetians. In a speech pronounced in the capital by Henri X affirming the French character of the monarchy who always has never forgotten its French roots. While praised on the continent, the speech has been criticized by many in England.

To further enhance his presence, Henri X decided to travel amongst France. He first visited Normandie where he praised his ancestor Guillaume who embarked to conquer England. He then turned to Brittany, a land attached to the Plantegenian monarchs. His travel led him then to La Rochelle. There he met several of the Young French leaders who spontaneously rallied to him and praised his signs in favour of France. He then travelled south passing through Gascony, Toulouse. He then made a stop in Vichy to remember the last great battle against the Valois before returning to the capital. Many people are acclaiming the king for this action that has strengthened the hold of the monarchy in France.
Les Plantagenets sont veritablement les rois des Français !

Lately a wave of contests have emerged in England towards the French turn-around of Henri X. The English people have been indeed absent from the speeches of Henri and many are looking to alternatives. A certain John Tolsmith, professor in Cambridge, lately published a monumental history of England before the Norman Conquest. His book has become incredibly popular amongst the English students who have created an association to valorise their English inheritance called the sons of Harold, in reference to Harold Godwinson, the last Anglo-Saxon king. While this may only be a cultural association, many of its members are prone to radical ideas and it is said that the slogan of Freiheit, Gleicheit, Brüderlichkeit are murmured in these circles
Spread of the Sons of Harold
The sons of Harold have implemented themselves in this province and are already spreading their ideas ...

A dispute has emerged in the Sorbonne between two scholars to determine if English can be considered as a true language worthy of being spoken in the high spheres such as the government. While it can be seen as just a philological debate, we could influence the result in one way or the other.
Some noises made by peasants aren't a language !
English is as good as French
Do not take part in philological debates

Sadly our prime minister has died in office. It falls upon the monarch to choose a new prime minister. Three candidates have the favour of the Parliament : the duke of Richelieu, known for his inclination for the Young French, the duke of Rohan, the Breton moderate and lastly the duke of Devonshire, well-known in the island.

The English have organised a festival in Stratford upon Avon to honour a play-writer called William Shakespeare. Rediscovered by the sons of Harold, this unknown author has written many tragicomedies in English, which criticize heavily the Parisian Monarchy while praising English historical figures like his life of Alfred the Great in 4 plays. This festival could become a centre of protestation especially if they represent Henry VI
Let them have their festival, what could possibly happen ?
Watch it and place it under heavy guard
The death of the Prince of Wales

While visiting England, the Prince of Wales and his entourage were attacked by radicals in the city of Liverpool. It resulted in the death of Henry, the heir of the Dual-Monarchy, his pregnant wife and his son. The attack made with an artisanal weaponry, that many call "the Infernal Machine", was imagined by students affiliated to the Sons of Harold. While Tolsmith and his associates denied any implication in the organisation of the attack and vigorously condemned it, the King and the Parisian government are persuaded of the contrary and are determined in their grief to shut down the organisation.

Despite the troubles of the past years the monarchy has asserted its English roots. With London and Paris weighing the same in political matters the monarchy has gained the support of the English population!

The English backlash of Henry X has alienated the Southern French lands. The local Occitans have always been more rebellious because of their protestant roots and also because of their support for the Valois kings. The Revolt launched in Toulouse by the Sons of St-Louis has gained the control of most Occitania! Now their provisional government will decide upon whether to host the Valois King as their rightful King or declare the Republic.
The Occitan state must now choose what form of government it shall be : will they welcome the Valois pretender or proclaim a free Republic ?
We welcome the true kings of France !
The rebellious Occitan have acknowledged the Valois as the true Kings of France and pledged their loyalty to the reconquest of the throne.
The usurpers will be driven out !
Provence has taken control of our rebellious provinces and has pledged to not stop until Paris! We can't let them do this and must put an end to the War for the French Throne!
It is the last time the Valois deny our rights !
Occitania has affirmed as an independent Republic! We can't let them do such a thing!
It is the last time the Occitan rebel !
Creation of the Sons of St-Louis

A French nationalist organisation has been created yesterday in La Rochelle by a certain Jean Marie Brossart, a university historian. The aim of this association is to strengthen the conscience of the French and Provencal people and make them aware of their distinctness from the British. The name has been taken from Louis XI, a King who was later canonized and who he is seen as a fatherly figure of French history. It is particularly popular amongst the French students and many fear they might be spreading revolutionary ideals...
Spread of the Sons of St-Louis
The sons of St-Louis have implemented themselves in this province and are already spreading their ideas ...

To further enhance his presence, Henri X decided to travel amongst England. He first landed near Hastings where he praised his ancestor Guillaume who there managed to win the English crown. He then went to Londres where he visited the locals of the East Indian Company on the boards of the Tamise. His travel led him then to Cambridge and Ofxord. There he met several of the Young English leaders who spontaneously rallied to him and praised his signs in favour of England. He then travelled west and north passing through Wales and Livreport. He then made a stop in York to praise Richard Plantagenet, duke of York, one of the heroes of the early Dual-Monarchy. Many people are acclaiming the king for this action that has strengthened the hold of the monarchy in England.
The Plantegenets are truly the Kings of England !

A new school has appeared in arts. The Romanticists defy the laws established by the classical school of Paris and coming back to the roots of Baroque. It is especially successful in England. Tolsmith and Lord Buckingham (as he prefers to be known rather than his actual title of Bouquinquan) are publishing poems taking their roots in the old Saxon mythology, Scery is writing plays who are inspired by Shakespeare... This school has however little success amongst the literary critics of the capital who accuse them of recklessly crossing laws that were fixed by wise Elders.
Missing localisation. Please report to Divergences' developer.
English will be taught how to behave !
Despite the peril we managed to win against the revolutionaries, a fact that has strengthened our hold on all our territories
The English nationalists have secured their independence. We can't succeed in our current policy with them being independent
It is but a flesh wound !
The Southern parts of our kingdom have been secured ! Despite the rebellion we can continue our policy of accepting both French and English !
The South has escaped from our power. With our mainland territories threatened we can't surely make our rule accepted in both England and France.
It is but a flesh wound !
Missing localisation. Please report to Divergences' developer.

Tensions have been growing for decades in the Dual-Monarchy which could hardly handle the demands of both continentals and islanders. Now, Revolters have swarmed the streets of the great cities of the Dual-Monarchy in a scale not seen since the First German Revolution ! The nationalist rebels are decided to end the monarchy in blood if necessary and with it the very idea of the Anglois dream.

The Plantagenet throne has endured ! Despite the threat of radicals, nationalists and foreign power, all its people stands ready to serve their country ! The coming decades will surely be Anglois for who can stand against the combined force of the Dual-Monarchy of France and England ?

The King has to choose an historical figure to honor in the coming months. Several proposals have emerged : Alfred the Great, the old Saxon king is admired by many across the Channel, Louis XI the Holy is seen as a benevolent figure here on the continent, Edouard IV was the first Plantagenet born in Paris and thus is seen as both a rallying figure for the Anglois but also a usurper for the French and a traitor for the English. No matter who the King chooses to honour it will not please everyone.
St-Louis is worthy of our recognition
Alfred the Great is worthy of our recognition
Edouard IV is worthy of our recognition

Liberals and Nationalists from both sides of the Channel have formed societies aimed at spreading their ideas. If we allow them, the Sons of Harold and Saint Louis will surely provoke problems in our territories but banishing them will provoke an even bigger reaction ...
These organisations must be watched closely
'Histoire de la France depuis ses origines'

The historian Jean Marie Brossart has published a new book upon the history of France. The book has received a warm response from French scholars for its exhaustivity. But its portrayal of English and early Plantagenets is quite troublesome and his idea of "a distinct spirit existing since the Gauls' War" only amuses the French nationalists
And he calls his book historic ?

An anthology of English poetry has been published in Cambridge by the Sons of Harold. Regrouping old and new poets alike, this book has become widely applaused in England but many scholars from Paris consider it a complete waste of time ...
A truly wonderful piece of art !
As I said before, English is not fit for poetry ...
Henry X is becoming unfit to travel outside of Paris. He now has to delegate this duty to his son Henry, Dauphin of France and Prince of Wales
It has been a long time since a Royal went in North of England ...
The Anglois heartlands are more safe

Paris is bursting with cultural recreation. Theatres attract the crowds with three great historical pieces having a huge success. First the adaptation of Alfred the Great, the main work of the English author Shakespeare which combines epic and comic, in a way that pleases the Romanticists. Another troup is playing 'Le Malade Imaginaire' of Jean le Tellier, a French comic author of the XVIIth century that travelled the roads of Southern France. Eventually the troup of the Royal Theatre has played 'Joan the Mad', the tragedy of Bougainville which is still very loved by the court. If one of the Royals would attend one of these spectacles it would surely be seen as a symbol.
I heard that Shakespeare author was quite entertaining ...
The Would-Be Invalid will be best in these trying times!
'Joan the Mad' from Bougainville will make us remember our glorious history.

The Rotal Academy was founded in the XVIIth century to host the greatest literary minds of the whole kingdom and it has since evolved to also codify the official language from the monarchy. One of the Immortals' siege has been liberated and we have to nominate someone. Tolsmith despite being a Saxon is recognized as one of the greatest philologists from the kingdom. In Occitania the poet Jasmin has achieved in seducing the minds of the court. But the grammarian Morel could be nominated to show our will of uniformisation
I guess Tolsmith could give us another perspective ...
The Occitan poet Jasmin will remind us from the sunny Midi !
Nominate the proud Anglois grammarian Morel

Radicals in the Kingdom are preparing for the 55th anniversary of the First German Revolution. Some advisors have talked about allowing them to do so to better control them but if we do so then it will cost us our relations with the Bohemian court... Forbidding them to commemorate and organizing great ceremonies remembering the prowess of our armies during the ensuing wars would certainly be a good symbol of unity.
If it can please these liberals ...
We won't associate with these monsters !
The ongoing 'Springtime of Nations' threaten our efforts of integration !
The Revolution will not anihilate our efforts !
Rebellions have stopped in the kingdom, showing our resilience !
We won't be stopped by this !
For 20 years the monarchy has encouraged the unity of the peoples on each side of the Channel. It seems that slowly the idea is winning the hearts of the crowds
For 25 years the monarchy has encouraged the unity of the peoples on each side of the Channel. It seems that slowly the idea is winning the hearts of the crowds
The little Provencal state is no more. Our armies have taken control of what was the biggest thorn on our borders. With the Valois gone, the Anglois state prevails !
The Hundred Years war is over !

Under French law, the duchy of Bourgogne was given as an apanage to a cadet of the Valois family, and was supposed to come back to the Crown when the direct male line of the Valois-Bourgogne died out in 1551 with the reign of Anne I. Edward VI managed to take the territory following the 9 Years War (1731-1740) until the treaty of Paris (1771) when Burgundy took advantage of the War of Succession to regain the duchy. Controlling the duchy will be hard but it only makes our position among the French nationalists stronger!

Calais has been retaken by our brave forces ! The city was made an important base for the English monarchy during the War for the French Throne but was lost during the Wars of Religion when the locals joined the Kingdom of Burgundy which controlled the neighbouring territories. Calais and its Pale were briefly retaken in the 9 Years War (1731-1740) only to be lost 30 years later following the Anglo-French War of Succession. But we now control the closest coast from Britain and proposals of building a link between the continent be it by bridge or tunnel flourish and show our unity !
One day maybe both of our lands will be linked !

During the reign of Edward VI 'the Great', Scotland was liberated from Scandinavia under a Catholic monarch and had his sons not fought over the throne of the Dual-Monarchy, the Kingdom of Scotland would have been integrated in a Personal Union because of the marriage of Caroline of Scotland with Henri IX. The claim to the Scottish throne is now too weak to be effectively pressed but with Scotland closely placed in our Sphere of Influence, we can now control more efficiently the English that try to upset our control in the area !
We must reestablish the normal situation as soon as possible !
With separatists having taken control of some of our core territories, the Anglois dream is fading !
We must reestablish the normal situation as soon as possible !
Our Northern Border allows the worse English elements to find support, weapons or shelter in Scotland. Unless we take control of Scotland, directly or indirectly, the situation could worsen.
Scotland should be in our sphere to avoid further problems!
With separatists having taken control of some of our core territories, the Anglois dream is fading !
We must reestablish the normal situation as soon as possible !
We must reestablish the normal situation as soon as possible !

Tolon is a nest of problems for our state. The kings in-France publish propaganda serving them and give them to agents who easily cross the border. Ending the Provencal state seems the only way to stop this state of affairs.
We must put an end to the Valois problem...
For 30 years the monarchy has encouraged the unity of the peoples on each side of the Channel. It seems that slowly the idea is winning the hearts of the crowds
For 30 years the monarchy has encouraged the unity of the peoples on each side of the Channel. It seems that slowly the idea is winning the hearts of the crowds

Yesterday the Dauphin was killed by French nationalists while visiting the city of Orleans ! The explosion also took the lives of his wife, his son and 70 other people. Full of grief the King has enacted several decrees restraining liberties with the assent of the Parliament. The line of succession that was clear is now disputed and the folly of Henry X due to his loss does not ease the situation...
A sad day for the dual-kingdoms...

Yesterday the Dauphin was killed by English nationalists while visiting the city of Livreport ! The explosion also took the lives of his wife, his son and 63 other people. Full of grief the King has enacted several decrees restraining liberties with the assent of the Parliament. The line of succession that was clear is now disputed and the folly of Henry X due to his loss does not ease the situation...
A sad day for the dual-kingdoms...
Who will succeed on the throne ?

Henri X has died yesterday in Paris at the venerable age of 76. The man who pushed for more centralization of the various demesnes of the Monarchy had reigned for nearly 30 years. He is succeeded by his only son, the Dauphin Henri of Wales who will continue the efforts of his father in uniting closer both England and France.

The Great Revolt is over, and the Anglois empire has been cast down. Where the Plantagenets once ruled, new nations have arisen, and old ones returned after centuries of disappearance from the maps of Europe. After the Head of State was beheaded by a Damocline in the center of Paris, his family and their trusted officials escaped to the New World. Overseas territories have been seized by other colonial powers, while the so-called "sister republics" of the former Plantagenet realm have pledged to defend each other against the threat of the counter-revolution. The Anglois dream of multiculturalism beneath allegiance to the Crown is dead and it seems that nationalism may threaten the old European order.

The endurance of the rebel English government has thrown our claim to rule both England and France into doubt. We had clung on to the isle through our remaining loyalists but it seems we were worrying about the wrong half of our nation all along. Our sore lack of legitimacy has inspired French nationalists to rail against the decadent corpse-empire. Now the sword of Damocles has fallen at last. This morning during the public funeral of General Jean-Jacques Clemenceau, notorious for his outspoken republicanism, a group of nationalists belonging to the secret "Society of the Rights of Man" seized the cortege and redirected it to the University of Paris, a hotbed of liberalism. A proclamation was read out by radical author Benoit Chalons calling for French independence and an end to the kingdom! Soon riots spread across Paris, and with strikes and revolts flaring in other cities throughout the north, it would appear that the heartland of our empire - and with it, our whole realm - has slipped from our grasp.
There is a life about to start when tomorrow comes!
The End of the Dual Monarchy

In $YEAR$, England has completely removed itself from the authority of Paris. As the English cherish their independence, the continental Plantagenet possession mourn the loss of the other economic and cultural half of the empire. But, as on days like this, the Anglois have to reinvent themselves, not as a union of vastly different crowns, but as a union of people who share the Catholic faith, a common history, and a Romance tongue, a true nation-state to rival its neighbours. Thus, today in Paris, the former Dual Monarchy is abolished by a provisional cabinet of a newly proclaimed Kingdom of France which will try to realise the Anglois Destiny in the ancestral homelands of the Plantagenet Dynasty.
La Double Monarchie est morte, vive la France!
The End of the Dual Monarchy

By $YEAR$, England had completely removed itself from the authority of Paris. The continental Plantagenets had, after mourning the northern half of their economic and cultural empire, planned to declare a French kingdom with themselves at the helm  but the people of France had other ideas. The oppression of the Plantagenet regime and its aristocracy had finally pushed the commoners too far, and French nationalism erupted like a volcano, carrying the monarchy away in its lava flows. The Plantagenet royal family fled with angry mobs hot on their heels, departing for a distant New World exile. Now the new French regime, backed by the overwhelmingly French-speaking army, has cut Ireland loose and turned to the dismantlement of the Anglois idea, scorning such monarchist fantasies in lieu of a France built by and for the French people.

Without Paris, the Dual Monarchy has lost much of its modern history as a union of two crowns which knew no equal on land or sea. Agitators against the Anglois hegemony abolished the cherished union and have exiled the crown to its ancestral land of England, although, luckily, most important figures of the old days have managed to escape the continental possessions, and a distinct Anglois identity still lives on in the lands surrounding Londres, the new capital. This loss should therefore be seen only as a temporary setback, and a time of introspection and planning will occur before Londres can reunite the kingdom, if it has gathered the ambition and strength to do so. But no diplomat can deny that carrying on the title of a United Kingdom of England and France does not represent the current geopolitical situation and might develop to a stain that may tarnish the Anglois international reputation. Thus, the new provisional cabinet in Londres declared that the Anglois destiny shall be realized in Britannie and that advances towards a reclamation of Paris shall cease, at least for now.
It has to be this way.

For generations, we have mocked the Valois-Medicis for being the Kings in France, confined to Provence. Fate, it seems, is not without a sense of humor, and a cruel one at that. We have been entirely driven out of France, and our centuries-old rivals have forced us to surrender all our continental possessions to them. The island from which we launched our war for the French throne in the fourteenth century is now once again our sole refuge, as the Valois-Medicis reign over France. All attempts to consolidate our national identity around the Anglois idea have come to a screeching halt, as we find ourselves desperately cultivating as many loyalists across the restive British Isles as possible. Our sovereign has been crowned King of Britannie, a title invented to avoid tipping our hand to the English nationalists, but this is not a permanent solution. The House of Plantagenet has never been in a more dangerous situation
And worst of all, the foreigners now call us the King in England.

We had tried to maintain the fiction that the Anglois ideal could retain supremacy despite the loss of England  some more optimistic ministers suggested we establish some sort of union of France and Ireland. Alas, the notion of preserving it without an England to bind to us did not appeal to the increasing number of French nationalists throughout our domain. As protests began to break out in city after city, the ruling elite saw the writing on the wall and fled just in time to avoid being seized and executed by revolutionaries. A council of French civil and military leaders, let by a popular war hero, has now taken power and declared the establishment of the French Republic, a nation built by and for the French people. Ireland has been cut loose and the new regime has now turned to the subordination of all French dialects, including Anglois, beneath the true French language.

A major crash on the $CAPITAL$ stock market has devolved into something much worse entirely, following massive bank runs triggered by plummeting saver's confidence in the banking sector. As people scramble to secure their life savings, more and more banks and credit institutions fail, triggering domino effects affecting the entire $COUNTRY_ADJ$ financial sector. The ripples from the crash soon spread to other sectors of private industry, as loans are defaulted and savings vanish seemingly into thin air. Widespread unemployment, caused by entire sectors of industry failing almost overnight, soon follow. With the intertwining of the economies of the western world, the crisis quickly spreads to other countries, and the effects of the crash now reverberate around the world, in what will be known to posterity as: The $YEAR$ Great Depression.
column3: Un important krach de la bourse de $CAPITAL$ a dégénéré à la suite d'un affolement des banques déclenché par une perte de confiance des épargnants dans le secteur bancaire. Alors que chacun s'efforce de préserver ses économies, de plus en plus de banques et d'organismes financiers font faillite entraînant un effet de domino qui affecte tout le secteur financier de $COUNTRY_ADJ$. Les effets de ce krach n'ont pas tardé à se propager à tous les secteurs de l'industrie privée, les prêts étant suspendus et les économies se volatilisant. Une vague de chômage, causée par la faillite de secteurs entiers de l'industrie du jour au lendemain, n'a pas tardé à suivre. Compte tenu de l'imbrication des économies du monde occidental, la crise a rapidement gagné les autres pays et les effets du krach se font désormais sentir partout dans le monde au cours de cette période qui entrera dans l'histoire sous le nom de la Grande Dépression de $YEAR$.
column4: Ein großer Crash an der Börse von $CAPITAL$ hat sich zu etwas viel Schlimmerem entwickelt: Das Vertrauen der Sparer in das Bankensystem ist erschüttert, es kommt zu massenhaften Abhebungen. Während die Bevölkerung versucht, ihre Ersparnisse zu retten, brechen immer mehr Banken und Kreditinstitute zusammen. Dies erzeugt Dominoeffekte, die den gesamten $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Finanzsektor betreffen. Die Auswirkungen des Börsencrashs weiten sich schon bald auf andere Sektoren der Privatwirtschaft aus, da Darlehen nicht mehr zurückgezahlt werden können und Ersparnisse sich förmlich in Luft auflösen. Fast über Nacht folgt weit verbreitete Arbeitslosigkeit, verursacht durch den Zusammenbruch ganzer Industriezweige. Aufgrund der Verflechtung der Wirtschaften der westlichen Welt breitet sich die Krise schnell auf andere Länder aus, und die Effekte des Börsencrashs sind nun auf der ganzen Welt zu spüren. Dies wird der Nachwelt bekannt als: Die Große Depression des Jahres $YEAR$.

column2: $COUNTRY$ has suffered through the Great Depssreion, but this year there are signs the country may be recovering at last. While the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ stock markets are still in flux, with investors terrified and banks barely able to remain solvent, conditions overall appear to be improving.

As there are no laws prohibiting or regulating private banking practices in $COUNTRY$, several private institutions are issuing their own currencies. While some argue that the hard earned savings of the common man are far too important to be left to the private sector, the case is rather the opposite in one of our states, where the plethora of banking institutions available allows people the freedom of choice to save their money in banks, and thus currencies, which they actually know and trust.
column3: En l'absence de lois interdisant ou régulant les pratiques bancaires privées de $COUNTRY$, plusieurs organismes privés ont émis leurs propres devises. Alors que certains soulignent que les économies durement gagnées du commun des mortels sont bien trop importantes pour être confiées au secteur privé, c'est plutôt le contraire dans l'un de nos États, où la pléthore d'institutions bancaires disponibles offrent aux clients la liberté de choisir d'épargner leur argent dans les banques, et donc dans des devises qu'ils connaissent et en qui ils ont confiance.
column4: Da es in $COUNTRY$ keine Gesetze gibt, die Privatbankpraktiken verbieten oder regulieren würden, haben mehrere Privatinstitutionen damit begonnen, eigene Währungen herauszugeben. Während manche damit argumentieren, das hart verdiente Geld des einfachen Mannes sei zu wichtig, um es dem privaten Sektor zu überlassen, ist in einem unserer Staaten eher das Gegenteil der Fall: Die Fülle an Banken ermöglicht der Bevölkerung, ihr Geld bei Banken und in Währungen anzulegen, denen sie vertrauen.

column2: There is always the chance that these systems will fail, and then what?
column3: Mais il est toujours possible que ces systèmes s'écroulent, et alors ?
column4: Aber diese Systeme könnten natürlich scheitern ... und was dann?

column2: As long as they are happy, I have no objections.
column3: Si cela leur convient, je n'y vois aucune objection.
column4: So lange sie glücklich sind, habe ich nichts dagegen.

column3: Actions des chemins de fer locaux

column2: A newly formed railway company in one of our states has issued shares in the company to help finance the burgeoning firm, and are now seeking buyers and investors in the state. The CEO of the company has approached local politicians, asking them if they could, perhaps, lend a bit of a hand in the marketing of these shares to the general public, arguing that an extension of the railway networks in the state can only be beneficial and should be promoted. Some feel that this might infringe on the principles of official neutrality with regards to private ventures, while other see only opportunities.
column3: Une nouvelle compagnie de chemin de fer de l'un de nos États a émis des actions afin de financer son développement naissant et recherche des acheteurs et investisseurs dans l'État. Le directeur de la compagnie a contacté des politiciens locaux pour leur demander s'ils pouvaient l'aider à commercialiser ces actions, soulignant le fait que le développement du réseau ferroviaire de l'État ne pouvait être que bénéfique et devait être favorisé. Selon certains, cela va à l'encontre des principes de neutralité relatifs aux entreprises prisées, alors que d'autres y voient de belles opportunités.
column4: Eine neue Eisenbahnfirma hat in einem unserer Staaten Firmenaktien zum Verkauf angeboten, um die Finanzierung der aufstrebenden Firma zu unterstützen. Nun suchen sie in dem Staat nach Käufern und Investoren. Der Geschäftsführer der Firma hat sich an lokale Politiker gewandt und sie gebeten, bei der Vermarktung der Aktien an die allgemeine Öffentlichkeit zu helfen. Er argumentierte damit, der Ausbau des Schienennetzes in dem Staat könne nur positive Folgen haben und solle demnach gefördert werden. Manche meine, dies könnte die Prinzipien der staatlichen Neutralität in Bezug auf Privatunternehmungen verletzen, andere sehen hier nur günstige Gelegenheiten.

column2: Of course we must aid and help promote this beautiful private initiative
column3: Bien sûr, nous devons aider et promouvoir cette remarquable initiative privée.
column4: Natürlich müssen wir ihnen helfen und diese wunderbare Privatinitiative unterstützen.

column2: I think that the government that governs the least governs the best
column3: Je crois que le gouvernement qui gouverne le moins gouverne le mieux.
column4: Meiner Meinung nach regiert die Regierung am besten, die am wenigsten eingreift.

column2: Selling Greenwood & Burns at 9.76, buying at 9.5! Atman & Sons 8.12, selling, selling!'\n\nLocal businessmen in one of our provinces have formed a joint venture company to establish a local stock exchange primarily aimed at the commodities trade. The venture will doubtlessly increase local productive efforts!
column3: Vente de Greenwood & Burns à 9,76, achat à 9,5 ! Vente d'Atman & Sons à 8,12 !'\n\nDes hommes d'affaires locaux d'une de nos provinces ont créé une entreprise en participation pour établir une bourse locale principalement destinée au commerce des produits de base. Cette entreprise contribuera à coup sûr à renforcer les efforts de production locaux !
column4: Verkaufe Greenwood & Burns bei 9.76, kaufe bei 9.5! Atman & Sons 8.12, Verkauf, Verkauf!'\n\nLokale Geschäftsmänner in einer unserer Provinzen haben ein Joint Venture-Unternehmen gegründet, um eine lokale Börse zu etablieren, die vorwiegend auf den Handel mit Verbrauchsgütern ausgerichtet ist.
