Our hardworking First minister was found dead at his desk this morning.
After he declared Thursdays to be Compulsory Pie-wearing day, our First minister has been 'retired'...
Our hardworking Great Leader was found dead at his chateaux this morning, by the six young ladies who were in his care...
Truly, he loved his people too much. Literally, in this case.
Our population appear to have lost interest in raising families.
Our population seem to be breeding less.
Our population is no longer increasing.
Our population appears to be stablizing.
Our population appears to be increasing.
Our population appears to be increasing rapidly.
Our population appears to be breeding like rabbits!
Must be something in the water.
With the spread of the rebellion inside our realm, some of the more isolated possessions denounce our controlship over them.
With our reconquest of some of the rebellion centers, the situation starts to calm down.
The Curonian government has approched us to buy the island of St-Andrew.
We now own the island of St-Andrew!
It seems that our offer was not sufficient
The Curonian government has approched us to purchase our possessions in the little Antilles
We now own the Spanish Lesser Antilles!
The Curonians want to buy the island of Sant Jordi.
We now own the island of Sant Jordi!
The Curonians want to buy the island of Martinique
We now own the island of Martinique!
The Curonians want to buy the islands of the Little Antilles we own.
The Curonians want to buy the island of Montserrat
The Curonians want to buy the island of Cristóbal y Nieves.
We own the island of Cristobal y Nieves!
The Curonians want to buy the Virgin Islands
We now own the Virgin Islands.

Reactionary elements have taken over the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, and their influence is felt both here and abroad. Their leadership has already begun to institute widespread changes in the government, while crowds cheer from the central square in $CAPITAL$.

Fascist elements have taken over the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, and their influence is felt both here and abroad. Their leadership has already begun to institute widespread changes in the government, while crowds cheer from the central square in $CAPITAL$.

Communists have taken over the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, and their influence is felt both here and abroad. Their leadership has already begun to institute widespread changes in the government, while crowds cheer from the central square in $CAPITAL$.

Liberal extremists have taken over the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, dedicated to political reforms but opposed to social reform of any kind. They have already instituted a large number of changes within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, while crowds cheer from the central square in $CAPITAL$.

Cheering crowds in $CAPITAL$ are celebrating the toppling of the old $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, now replaced by a new and liberal order dedicated to political reform within all levels of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government. Despite their recent ascent to power, they have already begun to institute changes in $COUNTRY$ that are being felt here and abroad.

Paternal elements inside our military have taken over the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, and their influence is felt both here and abroad. Their leadership has already begun to institute widespread changes in the government, while crowds cheer from the central square in $CAPITAL$.

Cheering crowds in $CAPITAL$ are celebrating the toppling of the old $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, now replaced by a new and conservative order dedicated to the preservation of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ traditions, but within a democratic regime. The new government has already begun to institute changes in $COUNTRY$ that are being felt here and abroad.

Cheering crowds in $CAPITAL$ are celebrating the toppling of the old $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, now replaced by a new and socialist order dedicated to social reform within all levels of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government. Despite their recent ascent to power, they have already begun to institute changes in $COUNTRY$ that are being felt here and abroad.

The old $COUNTRY_ADJ$ regime leftover from our days as a colony are now over-- $COUNTRY$ is once more an African nation, truly belonging to the people who have lived here since long before the Europeans arrived.

The Indian subcontinent has been overwhelmed by the Sepoy rebels. Our garrisons are in retreat, and our colonial governors have already fled for safer ports. We have no choice but to give into their demands, many of which involve removing $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence from any of the nations we have subjugated over the years of our rule.
We have no choice but to comply.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ presence in South Asia has come to an end, thanks to the spread of the Sepoy Rebellion. With $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ governors fleeing the subcontinent in droves, our nation suddenly has a chance to regain lost lands and obtain our freedom ...whether we wish it or not.

After a swarm of violence and looting that engulfed the entire nation, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rioters have stormed the capital. The government has been forced to make numerous concessions, in a desperate bid to calm the people. So far it seems to have worked, and has spared many leaders from being executed by angry mobs, but it remains to be seen whether these concessions will only cause more problems in the end than they solved.
We have no choice but to comply.

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ patriots have risen up in $FROMCOUNTRY$, and have gained control of the capital. They send word they wish to bring all our lost provinces back to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ control. Agreeing would mean risking war, but refusing would mean angering our people.

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ patriots have risen up in a neighboring country, and have gained sufficient control that they have sent word they wish to bring the province back to $COUNTRY$. Agreeing would mean risking war, but refusing would mean angering our people.
With the patriot rebellion now over, our provinces have now been brought under control and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ governors are once again in command.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has been overthrown, and the rebel government has declared themselves free from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Many are calling for a restoration of order, while others are saying that $FROMCOUNTRY$ is too much trouble. If they want to be free, let them go.
We will salvage what influence we can.
We will restore order in our vassal!

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has been toppled, and the rebels blame $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence as one of the primary causes of the old regime's corruption. We have lost our influence in $FROMCOUNTRY$ as a result, and the only question that remains is whether we wish to press our claim by force.

$CAPITAL$ has been taken by the enemy, and a great deal of $COUNTRY$ is lost to our control. Many are saying that we only continue the war because our foreign masters insist that we do so, and that the time has come for us to let go of these ties-- no matter the consequences. Perhaps they are right, though it seems the situation is dire for $COUNTRY$'s future no matter what we do.
The rebels are gaining too much ground! We must call for help from our protectors!

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government is besieged by rebels, and threatens to fall if they do not receive assistance from $COUNTRY$. They warn us that if the rebels are successful, it's very likely that $FROMCOUNTRY$ would cease to be in $COUNTRY$'s sphere of influence.
We will do what we can.
They must stand on their own.
The danger of imminent overthrow has passed.

Now that $COUNTRY$ is free, native $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens are beginning to protest against the colonial regime that still remains. Foreigners still hold the highest positions in the government, and have a privileged status in comparison to those they once ruled over as a colony. In $PROVINCENAME$, the recent arrest of a native for trespassing on the estate of a foreigner has led to riots-- and dissension has spread throughout all of $STATENAME$.

We have been contacted by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ patriots, currently living under the dominion of a neighboring country. They suggest that there is an opportunity to stir up sentiment among those living there so that they may rise up and rejoin the mother country. There is, of course, a risk that our efforts could be discovered and bring war down upon us. Should we help them?
We have received reports that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has been inciting dissent among minorities in $COUNTRY$. This is an act of aggression that deserves a swift response.
Our efforts to incite $COUNTRY_ADJ$ patriots in $FROMCOUNTRY$ have been discovered. The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government is threatening war over this breach of their sovereignty.

The rebellion in $STATENAME$ has been going on for far too long, and we are in danger of losing control of the colony entirely. Local militants in $PROVINCENAME$ have gone so far as to declare their nation's independence... and while that isn't yet true, as $STATENAME$'s state of chaos is still far too widespread, it's an embarrassment to $COUNTRY$ and,  given enough time, the militants might gain enough control to earn the colony's independence.

Rebels in a neighboring colony have destabilized it enough that the people there are calling out for $COUNTRY$ to restore order. This is our land, and it seems that the western powers have all but abandoned it to chaos. So why shouldn't we intervene? Still, there are some who say this will only damage our relationship with a power... one we cannot afford to anger.
We have lost control of the situation in $STATENAME$. The rebels have gained sufficient control that they have ejected the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ governors and declared their independence... for now.
We have restored order to our colony in $STATENAME$... at least for the moment.

If communism is to make strides in the modern era, the ruling proletariat of every nation must work together towards a common goal. Towards that end, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leaders have called on the government to hold talks with a fellow communist nation to bring us closer together.

An envoy has arrived from $FROMCOUNTRY$, offering to improve relations between our country and theirs. The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ leadership believes that nations so closely aligned in ideology should become closer in truth. Refusing their overtures could be seen as an insult.

If communism is to make strides in the modern era, the ruling proletariat of every nation must work together towards a common goal. Towards that end, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leaders have called on the government to hold talks with a fellow communist nation to bring us closer together.

If fascism is to make strides in the modern era, the rulers of every fascist nation must work together towards a common goal. Towards that end, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leaders have called on the government to hold talks with a fellow nation to bring us closer together.

If fascism is to make strides in the modern era, the rulers of every fascist nation must work together towards a common goal. Towards that end, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leaders have called on the government to hold talks with a fellow nation to bring us closer together.

If anarcho-liberalism is to make strides in the modern era, the rulers of every enlightened nation must work together towards a common goal. Towards that end, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leaders have called on the government to hold talks with a fellow anarcho-liberal nation to bring us closer together.

If anarcho-liberalism is to make strides in the modern era, the rulers of every enlightened nation must work together towards a common goal. Towards that end, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leaders have called on the government to hold talks with a fellow anarcho-liberal nation to bring us closer together.

The threats to the modern world are many: communism, fascism, tyranny in all forms. If the free and democratic nations of the world are to survive, they must stand together. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leaders are calling on the government to initiate closer ties with a fellow democratic nation.

The threats to the modern world are many: communism, fascism, tyranny in all forms. If the free and democratic nations of the world are to survive, they must stand together. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leaders are calling on the government to initiate closer ties with a fellow democratic nation.

The time has come for the great communist powers of the world to stand together. A summit has been proposed in $CAPITAL$ that would bring our nations closer, though it also has the chance of going badly and driving us further apart. Do we dare make the attempt?

An envoy has arrived from $FROMCOUNTRY$, offering to hold a summit in their capital to bring our two great powers closer together. Refusing their overtures could be seen as an insult, but it's also possible the summit could go poorly and make our relations worse rather than better.
We are eager to attend the summit.
We will go, but we promise nothing.
The summit in $CAPITAL$ was a smashing success! $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats left pleased with the progress, and our relations have improved significantly.

The summit in $CAPITAL$ unfortunately failed to make any significant progress. Talks with $FROMCOUNTRY$ stalled, and even with our common ideological ground there are just too many issues remaining between our nations to improve relations more than marginally.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent a polite refusal to our summit request, saying now is not a good time for a summit.

The time has come for the great fascist powers of the world to stand together. A summit has been proposed in $CAPITAL$ that would bring our nations closer, though it also has the chance of going badly and driving us further apart. Do we dare make the attempt?

The time has come for the great anarcho-liberal powers of the world to stand together. A summit has been proposed in $CAPITAL$ that would bring our nations closer, though it also has the chance of going badly and driving us further apart. Do we dare make the attempt?

The time has come for the great democratic powers of the world to stand together. A summit has been proposed in $CAPITAL$ that would bring our nations closer, though it also has the chance of going badly and driving us further apart. Do we dare make the attempt?

A violent incident has occurred at one of the foreign embassies in $CAPITAL$, spurred on by resentment towards their nation and its ideological hostility towards our communist regime. We will need to decide now whether we are conciliatory in our response, potentially losing prestige for the socialist movement, or whether we imply that their nation's policies are what led to this unfortunate event.
They have only themselves to blame.

A violent incident has occurred at one of the foreign embassies in $CAPITAL$, spurred on by resentment towards their nation and its ideological hostility towards our fascist regime. We will need to decide now whether we are conciliatory in our response, potentially losing prestige for our nationalist movement, or whether we imply that their nation's policies are what led to this unfortunate event.
They have only themselves to blame.

A violent incident has occurred at one of the foreign embassies in $CAPITAL$, spurred on by resentment towards their nation and its ideological hostility towards our anarcho-liberal regime. We will need to decide now whether we are conciliatory in our response, potentially losing prestige for our liberal movement, or whether we imply that their nation's policies are what led to this unfortunate event.
They have only themselves to blame.

A violent incident has occurred at one of the foreign embassies in $CAPITAL$, spurred on by resentment towards their nation and its ideological extremism. We will need to decide now whether we are conciliatory in our response, potentially losing prestige for our nation and the cause of democracy in the world, or whether we imply that their nation's policies are what led to this unfortunate event.
They have only themselves to blame.

A violent incident has occurred at one of the foreign embassies in $CAPITAL$, spurred on by $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ resentment towards $COUNTRY$ and our ideology. Their response to the unfortunate event has thankfully been conciliatory, and our government has received an official apology.

A violent incident has occurred at our embassy in $FROMCOUNTRY$, spurred on by $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ resentment towards $COUNTRY$ and our ideology. Their response has been insulting, publicly blaming our policies even though their own careless disregard for the safety of our diplomats and their political upheaval is clearly at fault.

Despite our apology, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has declared it is enraged by the incident and that our lack of control over our citizens is to blame. While they are seen as being unreasonably aggressive, war is even a possibility.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has accepted our apology for the incident, and while our relations have been damaged the incident has mostly blown over.
$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ leaders have declared our actions outrageous, and that the incident was no doubt secretly supported by our government. They claim this provides them ample grounds for war.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ has backed down from escalating the incident into a war. The entire business has harmed relations between our nations.
Several foreigners were attacked in $CAPITAL$, an incident spurred on by differences between their country and our government's communist policies. It has severely harmed our relations.
Several foreigners were attacked in $CAPITAL$, an incident spurred on by differences between their country and our government's fascist policies. It has severely harmed our relations.
Several foreigners were attacked in $CAPITAL$, an incident spurred on by differences between their country and our government's anarcho-liberal policies. It has severely harmed our relations.
Several foreigners were attacked in $CAPITAL$, an incident spurred on by differences between their country's radical ideology and our government's policies. It has severely harmed our relations.

Several of our country's citizens have been attacked in the capital of $FROMCOUNTRY$, an incident spurred on by the severe differences between our country's ideology and their's. The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ has been extremely reluctant to admit any involvement in the affair, and our relations have been hurt as a result.

An opportunity has arisen to fund the spread of communism in a neighboring state. If discovered, this could start a diplomatic incident and gain us infamy... but if we do not act, the workers around the world will continue to slave under bourgeois oppression. The proletariats in $CAPITAL$ are calling on us to aid the cause!

An opportunity has arisen to fund the spread of fascism in a neighboring state. If discovered, this could start a diplomatic incident and gain us infamy... but if we do not act, we will be seen as shirking our duty to the fascist cause. The government elite in $CAPITAL$ are calling on us to aid the cause!

An opportunity has arisen to fund the spread of anarcho-liberalism in a neighboring state. If discovered, this could start a diplomatic incident and gain us infamy... but if we do not act, we will be admitting that we cannot aid the spread of the bourgeois revolution. The liberal elite in $CAPITAL$ are calling on us to aid the cause!

An opportunity has arisen to fund the spread of democracy in a neighboring state. If discovered, this could start a diplomatic incident and gain us infamy... but if we do not act, we will be seen as abandoning those who live under the rule of tyrants. Liberals in $CAPITAL$ are calling on us to aid the cause of world freedom!

Several of our agents in $FROMCOUNTRY$ were discovered and interrogated, and word of our efforts have spread. This will have an impact on our infamy, and the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ may choose to take the issue as cause for war against us.
We shall see if this leads to anything.

We have reports of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ propaganda being spread in one of our border provinces. Clearly the $FROMCOUNTRY$ government does not respect our sovereignty. Word of the event has leaked out, and members of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are calling for immediate action!

Reports from $PROVINCENAME$ report that the primary mine in the region has become tapped. Already the mining companies have started to move, and local miners are facing the prospect of either turning to farming or trying to find work elsewhere.
We have reports from $PROVINCENAME$ that a new vein of coal has been discovered, and considering the unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$ this might prove to be a boon indeed.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.
We have reports from $PROVINCENAME$ that a new vein of copper has been discovered, and considering the unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$ this might prove to be a boon indeed.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.
We have reports from $PROVINCENAME$ that a new vein of iron has been discovered, and considering the unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$ this might prove to be a boon indeed.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.
We have reports from $PROVINCENAME$ that a new vein of lead has been discovered, and considering the unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$ this might prove to be a boon indeed.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.
We have reports from $PROVINCENAME$ that a new vein of sulphur has been discovered, and considering the unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$ this might prove to be a boon indeed.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Considering the levels of unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$, local landowners have begun a movement to switch to the production of cash crops-- in this case cotton, which appears to suited to the local terrain. Whether such a plan would help $PROVINCENAME$ in the long run is unknown, but the landowners are asking for the government's assistance in promoting cotton production.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Considering the levels of unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$, local landowners have begun a movement to switch to the production of cash crops-- in this case tea, which appears to suited to the local terrain. Whether such a plan would help $PROVINCENAME$ in the long run is unknown, but the landowners are asking for the government's assistance in promoting tea production.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Considering the levels of unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$, local landowners have begun a movement to switch to the production of cash crops-- in this case spices, which appears to suited to the local terrain. Whether such a plan would help $PROVINCENAME$ in the long run is unknown, but the landowners are asking for the government's assistance in promoting spice production.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Considering the levels of unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$, local landowners have begun a movement to switch to the production of cash crops-- in this case sheep and wool, which appears to suited to the local terrain. Whether such a plan would help $PROVINCENAME$ in the long run is unknown, but the landowners are asking for the government's assistance in promoting wool production.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

They should get to work immediately.

Whether such a plan would help $PROVINCENAME$ in the long run is unknown, but the landowners are asking for the government's assistance in promoting tobacco production.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Whether such a plan would help $PROVINCENAME$ in the long run is unknown, but the landowners are asking for the government's assistance in promoting coffee production.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Considering the levels of unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$, local landowners have begun a movement to switch to the production of cash crops-- in this case silk, which appears to suited to the local terrain. Whether such a plan would help $PROVINCENAME$ in the long run is unknown, but the landowners are asking for the government's assistance in promoting silk production.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Considering the levels of unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$, local landowners have begun a movement to switch to the production of cash crops-- in this case sugar, which appears to suited to the local terrain. Whether such a plan would help $PROVINCENAME$ in the long run is unknown, but the landowners are asking for the government's assistance in promoting sugar production.
They should get to work immediately.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.
Unemployment among workers in $PROVINCENAME$ is high, and many have begun turning to the sea to eke out a living. Local officials are suggesting that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ support them.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Unemployment among workers in $PROVINCENAME$ is high, but a possible bright spot is the emergence of several lumberyards. Local officials are suggesting that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ support the lumberyards and allow them to become $PROVINCENAME$'s new major industry.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Unemployment among workers in $PROVINCENAME$ is high, but a possible bright spot is the emergence of several tropical lumberyards. Local officials are suggesting that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ support the lumberyards and allow them to become $PROVINCENAME$'s new major industry.
We will encourage the tropical lumberyards.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Unemployment among workers in $PROVINCENAME$ is high, but a possible bright spot is the emergence of several cattle ranches. Local officials are suggesting that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ support the ranches and allow them to become $PROVINCENAME$'s new major industry.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

Unemployment among workers in $PROVINCENAME$ is high, but a possible bright spot is the emergence of several new grain farms. Local officials are suggesting that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ support the farms and allow them to become $PROVINCENAME$'s new major industry.
We will encourage the grain farms.
No-- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ landowners in $PROVINCENAME$ have expressed interest in switching the local farms over to more profitable plantations, and away from the traditional farming of the locals-- which they say is far less efficient than the farms back home in $COUNTRY$ anyhow. This would be better for our colony in the long run.

Landowners throughout $STATENAME$ have begun a program of intensive farming, attempting to maximize production of the land. There are those who criticize these attempts, however, claiming that this could lead to exhaustion of the soil and disaster for the locals. They are asking the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to intervene.
Allow the intensive farming to proceed.
The intensive farming in $PROVINCENAME$ has resulted in exhausted soil and falling yields throughout the province.

Mother, mother! Old man Johnson has bought a new machine! It can plough, pull, tear, move, and you can ride on it! He says it's called a 'tractor'!'\n\nThe advent of the tractor in $PROVINCENAME$ has led to a revolution in local agriculture, with farm output increasing on a scale unfathomable a mere generation ago. Truly, the boons of industry are good unto $COUNTRY$.
column4: Mutter, oh Mutter! Der alte Johnson hat eine neue Maschine gekauft! Sie kann pflügen, ziehen, anreißen und fahren - und man kann sogar darauf sitzen! Er sagt, die Maschine sei ein 'Traktor'!'\n\nDie Einführung von Traktoren in $PROVINCENAME$ hat zu einer Revolution der lokalen Landwirtschaft geführt und die landwirtschaftliche Leistung auf ein Niveau gehievt, von dem man vor nur einer Generation nur träumen konnte. Wahrlich, die Götter der Industrie sind $COUNTRY$ gnädig.

column2: Mother, Mother! Have you seen the lights on Main Street? They're putting new lights in the lamp posts! They say that they're powered by 'electricity'!'\n\nElectricity, in the form of street lights, have arrived in $PROVINCENAME$. This new type of lighting illuminates our cities in ways that have hereto only been dreamt of, increasing the efficiency and productivity of local industry, as well as the local quality of life.
column4: Mutter, oh Mutter! Hast du die Lichter auf der Hauptstraße gesehen? Sie bringen neue Lampen in den Laternenpfählen an! Man sagt, diese würden von 'Elektrizität' betrieben!'\n\nDie Elektrizität hat in Form von Straßenbeleuchtungen in $PROVINCENAME$ Einzug gehalten. Diese neue Beleuchtungsart erleuchtet unsere Städte auf eine Art und Weise, von der wir vorher nur träumen konnten. Dies erhöht die Effizienz und die Produktivität der lokalen Industrie und die Lebensqualität der lokalen Bevölkerung.

column2: Mother, Mother! Have you heard the sounds and booms echoing from the mine? They say it's a new type of explosive!'\n\nThe introduction of nitroglycerin, and with it the ability to dig deeper into the mine shafts than ever before, in $PROVINCENAME$ means that the local mining industry has increased its output several times over.
column4: Mutter, oh Mutter! Hast du das Donnern und Wummern aus der Mine gehört? Sie sagen, das sei eine neue Sprengstoffart!'\n\nDie Einführung von Nitroglyzerin und die damit einhergehende Möglichkeit, Minenschächte tiefer als je zuvor in den Boden zu treiben, hat der lokalen Bergbauindustrie in $PROVINCENAME$ ermöglicht, ihre Leistung um ein Vielfaches zu steigern.

column2: Mother! Mother! They've opened a new store in town!'\n\nThe nineteenth century saw the development of vastly improved channels for the distribution of goods to broader groups of customers. The opening of new, specialized and industrialized retailers was essential in bringing new industrial goods, produced in factories, to consumers. The new store in $PROVINCENAME$ will increase the efficiency of the local farms, as farmers have to spend less time in travel to and from markets.
column4: Mutter! Mutter! In der Stadt haben sie einen neuen Laden aufgemacht!'\n\nIm neunzehnten Jahrhundert wurden die Vertriebskanäle zur Güterverteilung an breitere Konsumentengruppen stark verbessert. Die Eröffnung neuer, spezialisierter und industrialisierter Einzelhandelsgeschäfte war unerlässlich dafür, neue, in Fabriken hergestellte Industriegüter zum Konsumenten zu bringen. Der neue Laden in $PROVINCENAME$ wird die Effizienz der lokalen Bauernhöfe steigern, da die Bauern nun weniger Zeit für Fahrten zu den Märkten aufwenden müssen.

column2: Mother! Mother! Father says that they've got new tools in the mine!'\n\nWith the invention of machine tools, mines are slowly being fitted with new and efficient tools to aid the excavation of the slumbering riches below the surface. Mine efficiency and size has been increased in $PROVINCENAME$ on account of this.
column4: Mutter! Mutter! Vater sagt, dass sie jetzt in der Mine neue Werkzeuge haben!'\n\nDurch die Erfindung von Maschinenwerkzeugen werden die Minen allmählich mit neuen und effizienten Werkzeugen ausgestattet, die beim Abbau der Reichtümer unterhalb der Erdoberfläche helfen. Aus diesem Grund hat sich die Bergbaueffizienz und der Bergbauumfang in $PROVINCENAME$ erhöht.

column2: Deep shaft mining has been adopted throughout $STATENAME$.
Pit mining has been adopted throughout $STATENAME$.
Strip mining has been adopted throughout $STATENAME$.
Crop rotation has been adopted throughout $STATENAME$.
Phosphate fertilizers have been adopted throughout $STATENAME$.
Nitrate fertilizers have been adopted throughout $STATENAME$.

The obstacles standing against the unification of the Russian people were too high. But it is no longer true - one of the Russian countries gathered enough power to demand the creation of the Empire of Rus'!
Novgorod and Muscovy have at last united and shall never be separated again!
The banks of the Southern Rivers have been secured and are no longer Tatar

The Khanate of Sibir was the last true remnant of the Golden Horde. It had survived thanks to a miracle - the constant warfare between the Grand Duchy (and later Tsardom) of Moscow and its neighbours led to the certain commitment of Muscovite armies. And the Republic of Novgorod? Their interests lied much elsewhere. And the army was needed to protect them. But now the territories of the Khanate lies before us and with them the claim to the Siberian Wastelands.
The control of the lands behind the Ural is very shaky one. Losing the key fortresses like Glasov or those in the Perm area would lead to losing the control of the whole East.
Novgorod and Muscovy always waged diplomatic and military conflicts for the control of the Borderlands. With United Russia these problems come to an end.

The Curonian Ducal Colonial Trading Company is an institution that lasted 250 years and we have managed to maintain our own triangle trade and gain a few colonies around the globe. Thanks to the protection of the Scandinavian Empire we have successfully expanded. But with the final intention of the foreign rivals, we no longer can administrate our colonies.
With the downfall of the Curonian Motherland, the lands of CDCTC were confiscated by our forces.
I can't even find the place on the map
With the downfall of the Curonian Motherland, the lands of CDCTC were confiscated by our forces.
I can't even find the place on the map

$COUNTRY$ is a nation hovering between two powers that could crush us without thought. Now one of them has made their move. A diplomat from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has arrived in $CAPITAL$, offering us protection in return for our fealty. Considering that the alternative is possible invasion by the Chinese, some think that we should consider it.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has foolishly refused kind offer of protection.

Now that we've united the Russian people, there is some debate about how to handle the various states on our western border. As we see it, there are two major options. First, we could attempt to project sea power by seizing ports and territory along either the Baltic or Black seas, both of which would ease diplomacy and military coordination with the states of Western Europe. Expanding to the north gives us opportunities to weaken our enemies, while a southern strategy would be easier to implement due to the decline of the steppe khanates. Alternatively, we could focus on liberating the Ruthenian people to our west. Since they are so culturally similar to us, it would be easier to incorporate them into our state.
Focus on gaining access to the Baltic Sea.
Subjugate the steppes and expand towards the Black Sea.
Why bother with foreigners? We must embrace Pan-slavism!

The colonial powers of the world have gathered in $CAPITAL$ to discuss the regulation of colonization and trade in Africa. The outcome has become known as the 'General Act of the $CAPITAL$ Conference', formalizing the scramble for the African continent. After this point, any civilized country will largely be seen as justified in aggression towards uncivilized African nations.
We must civilize all of Africa

Word has reached $COUNTRY$ of a great meeting of colonial powers in Europe, wherein it was decided that African nations would be divided up amongst them-- as if our people were little more than children's toys discarded and left waiting to be picked up. This has caused a great deal of concern among those of our people with the knowledge to understand what this means. For others it has brought little more than resentment, as well as vows to fight for our independence when the day comes.

'We have seen the outsiders. They come, with guns and riches we have never seen before. What they also bring is death, and we must always be wary what lies behind their smiles.'\n\n$COUNTRY$ stands on good terms with much of the western world, but our leaders are all too aware how quickly that could change. The Europeans believe we are not civilized, and the tone of our contact with them is slowly changing from friendly interest in trade to a strange paternalism coupled with cultural superiority. For now, $COUNTRY$ survives... but we must watch for the moment when the civilized nations decide our enslavement is the only way we can be 'saved'.
$COUNTRY_ADJ$ muslims are calling for the Jihad to continue: all Islamic states of the Sahel, united under one flag!

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence is felt throughout Africa, and some members of the government are suggesting we should press for more direct control over native African governments. Without $COUNTRY_ADJ$ protection, it's very likely that these people would fall under the sway of a competing colonial power, and is it not our moral imperative to extend the benefits that true civilization can offer?
We have no choice but to submit.

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ influence is felt everywhere in $COUNTRY$. They come to us, saying they will bring education and civilization. We know what they really want: all the wealth of $COUNTRY$ in their coffers. But what can we do? Now they wish to govern us more directly-- for our 'protection' from other ambitious foreign powers. If we agree, our way of life is over. If we refuse, they will make war upon us.
We will not force ourselves upon $FROMCOUNTRY$.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ people have made a foolhardy decision: they have refused our offer of protection and have gone so far as to eject our representatives from the country. There are even reports of several deaths. It seems we are left with no choice but to march into $FROMCOUNTRY$ and force them to see the proper path.
We will not force ourselves upon $FROMCOUNTRY$.

A $COUNTRY_ADJ$ shipping company has come into the ownership of the Red Sea port of Assab, sold to them by a local Afar sultan. The port would make for an excellent coaling station, and perhaps even provide a base for $COUNTRY$ to expand our influence in the area. Pushing for more direct control, however, could cause tensions with Assab's owner-- who might feel they have greater right to the port than the sultan.
We have no interest in Assab.

The Red Sea port of Assab has been sold to $FROMCOUNTRY$ by the local Afar sultan. They have begun to use the port as a coaling station, and fears within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are that they will use this base to expand their influence within $COUNTRY$.
We must take our place among the colonial powers of Africa.
The Zemene Mesafint-- the 'Age of Princes'-- has come to $COUNTRY$ once more. $FROMCOUNTRY$ has declared war!
Now that Imperial rule has been restored, we must endeavour to spread control over lands that neighbour our own but which are rightfully part of our Empire.

The execution of Joan of Arc would come to mark the beginning of the end for the French Wars of Succession (1337-1498), as the Armagnac Party would never again rise to what it once was. The Valois and their allies would fight on for another seventy years, but with the victory of Edward the Red Prince at Vichy the future of a Dual Monarchy of France and England was secured, only being confirmed with the 1498 Treaty of Rome. The threat of encirclement with the Marriage of Anne of Brittany with Jean III of Burgundy, led to the breakdown of the Anglo-Burgundian alliance in 1490 when, unable to challenge the marriage, invaded Brittany during the Anglo-Franco-Breton War (1490-1492). Burgundy, unable to provide support against France due to rebellion fermented by the House of Lorraine, forced Brittany's surrender. While it was too late to annul the marriage, with Jean having consummated it, the Treaty of Le Verger effectively saw Brittany annexed into the French crown.

The Reformation presented new challenges to the unity of the thrones. The deep involvement of the Valois in aiding Zwingli's escape from Papal and Imperial imprisonment was too good a pretext to end any alternate succession, causing the Languedoc War (1532), and ending with the conquest of Languedoc & Auvergne, leaving only a rump Provencal state in the Azure Coast and in Rhone. In addition to the affairs of Provence, it also engaged in what became known as the Great Game with the Kingdom of Burgundy and the Crown of Aragon. The subject of these wars of influence came about with Navarre (which saw the conquest of the County of Foix & Bearn in 1516), the Italian Peninsula (which ended largely as a victory for the Aragonese, as most of the Peninsula, save Savoy, Genoa, Milan, and the Emilian Dukedoms fell under their influence, compared to only Savoy for the Dual Monarchy), and even the County of Provence (which easily fell into the Aragonese camp to save them from being destroyed by the Plantagenets.)

While aggressively fighting heresy abroad the Kings of Both Thrones were initially tolerant of Protestants. King Francois I was torn between dynastic links to the firmly Catholic Jagiellons of Bohemia and a large portion of his populace firm in their new faith. Further strife in England and in Aquitaine combined with the growing threat of Burgundy (long the champion of the Protestant cause) tipped the balance leading first to the Anglo-French Wars of Religion (1598-1614) both within the Kingdom and among its neighbors, and later after the defeat of the Protestants, the Exodus of the Protestant Huguenots to Burgundy, Scandinavia and Colonial New Burgundy (now the Seven Republics) and the Anglican Father Pilgrim and their followers to what they would call New England (now Beornia).

While England was briefly a viceroyalty under the Dukes of Gloucester, the throne would be forever undivided following the dissolution of the English Parliament by Henry VII in 1537, and its merging into the Estates General. The nobility with the exception of some distant provinces converged increasingly to Paris as French, became the official language throughout both kingdoms. This led to the gradual Francification of England as once English names were increasingly replaced by French. By the turn of the 19th century, French has become the primary common language in the Southern parts of England. The concept of a centralized Parliamentary body was revolutionary for its time, and, almost ironically, would influence the future legislative bodies of the Burgundian Estates-General, the Savoyard Subalpine Senate, the Aragonese Cortes and the Scandinavian Riksdag, among other European states.

The Anglo-French history in Ireland was also something of a peculiar moment. During the French Wars of Succession, English, and later Anglo-French control of the Island was left in the hands of the House of Fitzgerald, the Earls of Kildare as much time was spent in building a new administrative apparatus for both England and France. Because of this, the Kildares, along with the House of Desmond, both began to rule Ireland as if it was their own Kingdom. The issues, which had been building up during the twilight years of the reign of Henri VIII culminated in the three Irish Wars (1573-1579, 1583-1594 and the Nine Years War, 1598-1607). Which gradually saw Ireland pacified, the rebel Irish Lords killed and the King of England and France reaffirmed as Lord of Ireland.

With the unexpected ascension of James IV of Scotland to the Throne of the North in 1500 the Plantagenêts faced the threat of encirclement by the alliance of Burgundy and the former. The exodus of the early 17th century was compounded by wars against Burgundy and Scandinavia pushing emigration to the colonies of Plantagenia and Amazonie. However the pushing towards these colonies were not without strife there as well, as conflicts were rife between Colonial Vinland and New Burgundy, as well as against the Cherokee and Creek, among other First Nation Tribes.

Eventually, the Dual Monarchy secured its position as the unquestioned power in Western Europe amid the gradual decline of Spain. A period of relative peace in Europe allowed the Dual Monarchy to expand its influences abroad. The Dual Monarchy established trading posts along the coast of Sierra Lionne, allowed them to trade European goods for slaves to be sent to the New World. A series of wars with the Kingdom of Kandy (1696-1703, 1705-1715, 1716-1717) saw the entirety of Ceylon becoming an Anglo-French crown colony, allowing access to the Indian Ocean Trade through good relations with the Nasirid Sultans of Bengal. At the same time there was a great degree of expansion in the Anglo-French colonies in the New World, as colonial conflicts with Scandinavia, Burgundy and Spain, reinforced its mother countrys position. This period of colonial expansion was broken with the War of the Anglo-French Succession, leading to the independence of Plantagenia under a cadet branch of the House of Plantagenêt.

Remaining largely aloof during the opening stages of the Great German Wars allowed the industrial revolution to take hold and the Dual Monarchy seemed set to dominate this new realm as well. But the battles of the later war quickly demonstrated that the old rival Burgundy was again on the rise as even beaten and battered it remained victorious, losing only its other colony Amazonie to independence. The Dual Monarchy enters the middle of the 19th century as the ultimate global power, but for the first time in over a century its position does not appear unassailable in Anvers and courts beyond.

Following the Congress of Arras, Philip of Burgundy swore fealty to Henry VI but extracted a high price. While still obligated to come to his liege's aid in time of war Philip secured for himself and his heirs full exemption from taxation and full command of his own vassals and levies. Hence began Burgundy's rise to true independence. English actions over the following decades continued to jeopardize the relationship as Burgundy felt it bore a disproportionate cost in the war, while the English took its aid for granted.

With the death of Philip, his son Charles would pursue an aggressive and independent policy greatly expanding his realm earning him the epithet "the Bold". Through campaigns across southern France and up and down the Rhine, by his death he would secure the addition of the entirety of the Low Countries, Alsace, Lorraine, and the northern Rhine including Cologne, Trier, Mainz, and the Palatinate, as well as the crown and title Rex Burgundicum. While much of the realm remained officially in the Empire or in fief to France, never again would a Burgundian bow to Paris or Prague. To secure this new throne the Burgundians began to quietly back their distant relatives the Valois against their former lieges the Plantagenets.

Zwingli proved popular in much of the realm and the kingdom welcomed a stream of refugees as the Dual Monarchy dismantled much of the Valois remnants in the Languedoc War (1532). The burning of Zwingli at the stake in 1527 sent Burgundy firmly down the path of Protestantism as it confronted its newly confirmed enemies the Jagiellons and Plantagenets. The accession of Philippe IV to the Burgundian throne in 1528 saw ties to the former Duchy are cut as he moved the capital from Dijon to Anvers in the Low Countries. The new King also began pursuing a policy of aggressive defense of Protestantism in the Empire, becoming its champion with support from the Stuarts of Scandinavia. Explicitly ignoring the Treaty of Pamplona, Burgundian settlements are established in both Ameriga and Arcadia.

The Wars of Religion begin to kick off in earnest amid Burgundy's new policy of supporting any Protestant monarch in defense of his throne (often interpreted where convenient to include lesser claimants). While maintaining a level of civility with the Dual Monarchy, Burgundy pursues a series of proxy wars in northwestern Italy which, although lost, serve to further confirm Burgundian supremacy in arms if not local politics. Open warfare against the Emperors in Central Germany made Burgundy the recognized leader of the central German Protestants while her close ally Scandinavia dominated in the north. Caught between the Turks and Protestants, Bohemia and her allies slowly lost ground on both fronts in a series of wars through the 16th and early 17th century, much to Burgundy's benefit. Burgundy's armies exhausted by decades of constant fighting began to give way, and despite the inability to dominate Germany, they were able to secure religious freedom and thus, they hoped, a long peace.

The enrichment of the Dutch and Flemish merchant houses through loans to the government and monopolies on Atlantic trade brought great benefits. It financed unparalleled technological development at home and led to the first trade ventures east securing the first Burgundian footholds in the Indian Ocean. With several decades of peace Burgundy looked inward for the most part though trade ventures secured footholds on the Cape and in Southeast Asia. Increasingly overshadowed by her neighbor the Dual Monarchy, Burgundy sought to shore up her support in the Empire.

The unexpected events of the Revolution in Frankfurt forced Burgundy into the unusual position of backing the Emperor in his crackdown as the rebels turned on the aristocracy at large. But as the Catholic League showed its intent to abuse the support to secure its position, Burgundy started the defining war of the time, the Great German War (1796-1820). As armies marched across the Empire new states rose and fell through the decades as the unprecedented bloodshed continued and all Europe was drawn in. Nationalism's dread rise threatened the integrity of Burgundy as a state, but ultimately it emerged victorious above the other European powers with its territory intact at the head of a new alliance of western Imperial states set to march proudly into the 19th century.?

Spanish Colonization of the Americas did not begin in earnest until the accession of Alfonso XII, when the first outpost would be established in 1496 in the Island of Cuba, named Santiago after the Mythological Saint James the Moor-slayer. By the end of the first quarter of the 16th century, the Spanish had already established a series of colonial holdings in Cuba. The first expedition into the mainland of the New World came in 1517, when Cuban governor Diego Velázquez commissioned a small Spanish fleet to explore the Yucatan Peninsula (the future Captaincy General of Mayapan), led by Hernández de Cordóba. There they would meet the local natives of the Mayan city of Cape Catoche.

The Spaniards read to them the Requirement of 1513 to them, which offered the natives the protection under the King of Spain should they submit to them. However they were refused and caused a great incident to occur, which saw many a Spaniard killed or forced to flee. Two years later a second attempt to explore the mainland came in 1519, this time it was a larger force that landed in Central Mexico. This force would find themselves allied with various natives, in what the latter saw was a great opportunity to overthrow the oppressive and brutal Aztec Triple Alliance. The Spanish Conquistador force, led by Hernan Cortes, would join with various Mesoamerican tribes such as the Tarascans and the Tlaxcalans in battle, defeating the Aztecs in Otumba and sacking the Aztec capital of Tenochtitlan, razing it to the ground and building a new capital, Mexico City, which would become the seat of the Viceroyalty of New Spain.

From the conquest and subjugation of the Aztecs followed further conquests, first of former allies in Mesoamerica, then of the Mayans, who of which resisted for much of the 16th century, despite being largely under Spanish control by the late 1520s, and even down into what would be Granada. Ultimately, they would be stopped by two formidable forces. To the south was the Empire of Tawantinsuyu, whom, despite having to deal with a Civil War, was able to repulse and humiliate the Spaniards, a feat further strained due to official support from the Dong Guo City-States as well as the Dual Monarchy of England-France. Attempts at expansion northwards was also met with dismal failure, first by the Dong-Guo City States, who humiliated the Spanish at the Battle of Yongle in 1544, and was further reined in by the Anglo-French encroachment deeper into the Arcadian continent as the Viceroyalty of Plantagenia.

Colonial life saw Gran Colombian society divided into a series of castes. At the top were the Peninsulares, the peoples born in Spain.. Under them were the Criollos, citizens born in the colonies to full Peninsularies and Creole families. Between the two were the colonial government dominated by, with respect to the King of Spain. Below them are the Mestizos and Mulattos, who are citizens of mixed Spanish and Native American/African ancestry, and finally at the bottom are the Native peoples and African slaves.

The Viceroyalty was originally established with control over the entire territory from Lusitania to Cusco. This would change with the Beja Reforms instituted in the late 18th century during the reign of King Manuel and King Jose. These reforms saw an attempt to centralize the Spanish Empire to the person of the Absolutist King of Spain. This included partitioning the Viceroyalty of New Spain into four, Lusitania in the North, San Salvador in Mesoamerica, Granada in Ameriga, and a rump Viceroyalty of New Spain in control of Mexico and Cuba. The government would be ruled exclusively by peninsulaires, who in theory would be disinterested, these peninsulaires being military men who had long records of military service. Clergymen, audencia judges and governor-generals were also staffed by peninsulaires.

This disenfranchisement by the King, coupled with economic forms working against the colonials, among other issues led to ideas of independence and self-government to spread. The tip off was the renegade priest Miguel Hidalgos Cry of Dolores speech, which would kick off what would eventually become the Spanish American Wars of Independence or the Spanish-Colombian War (1815, 1818- ) The conflict brought many peoples together in attempting to remove the Spanish, culminating in the founding of the Colombian Alliance in 1819 under Mexican General Vicente Guerrero. Over the course of the three year campaign, the revolutionaries were able to successfully liberate Mexico (the Second Mexican Republic, the First having been crushed immediately after its founding in 1815), and Lusitania (The Lusitanian Republic) before being decisively defeated in the Battle of San Salvador on 16 September 1822, ultimately leading to the first armistice, signed in Veracruz at the end of the month.

Meanwhile in Ameriga, a group of revolutionaries seized control of the New Granadan Viceregal capital of Cartagena, and declared the creation of the Republic of Granada (the precursor to Herreria). Led by José de Herrera, the new Republic began its own waves of conquest, incorporated the Governor-Generalate of Quito and Arequipa in the Andes. This coupled with the restarting of the Mexican advance into Guatemala, saw the rebirth of the Colombian Alliance, now with the Amerigan Republics added to this group. By the end of 1828, the Spanish were now reduced to their holdings in Cuba, Nueva Castilla & Essequibo.

Desperate, the colonial governor of Granada called upon the support of the Inca under their leader, Huayna Capac IV. This Inca Intervention (1829-1832), initially tipped the battle in Spains favor, as Peru was coming under siege. But they were decisively defeated as Lima, seeing the death of José de Herrera as a result. The Inca continued their conflict under the new Colombian Supreme Leader, and Herreras protege, Francisco de Paula Santander, but the latters death upon the removal of the Inca from Peru saw the Alliance become centralized and dominated by Granadan general Anastasio Vicente. However, to reassure the peoples of Mexico, Lusitania and Mesoamerica, Vicente established a Tetrarchy, bringing in Simon de Márquez to represent Mesoamerica, Agustin Santander to represent Mexico and Deodoro Peixoto to represent Lusitania, however Santander would still hold the most power out of the four members.

Under the coalition of Vicente and Simon in 1832, Gran Colombia launched a full-scale assault on Castilla and Essequibo, successfully removing Spanish presence there by 1834. Vicente, now determined to remove the Spanish completely from the Americas, began construction of a Navy, utilized all the naval shipyards the alliance had to offer. This hastily assembled fleet was to carry their army to conquer Cuba, but this move was intercepted by a Large Spanish fleet that had recently arrived at port in Havana. The Battle of Havana, fought on 21 April 1835, was the decisive battle that saw the Colombian Navy smashed and half its men going down with their ships.

The battle would be followed up by summer with a massive invasion against the Colombian rebels, seeing Lusitania, the Yucatan and Granada being invaded by the Spanish in a determined effort to end the Colombian independence movement. Vicente, either to better coordinate the alliance, or out of strengthening his power, abolished the republics and united them into a Federal Republic centralized in Mexico City.Despite being corrupted by a power-hungry general, the dream of Independence for the Spanish-speaking peoples of the New World still lingers for those who wish to fight for it. But do the people wish to fight for their freedom, or would they wish to once again be forced under the yoke of Spanish domination??

The Origin of Qingqiu (Chinese for Clear Autumn) can be traced back to the voyages of Zheng He that was sponsored by the Yongle (1404-1424) and Hongxi (1424-1435) Emperors of Ming China, all of which highlighted the power of the Scholar-Bureaucratic Faction over the Eunuchs. Zheng He would be tasked by the Xuande Emperor to launch an expedition to explore further east after the successful fifth expedition leading to the discovery of Zhourao (OTL Australia). As such in 1430, the expedition would set sail. The journey, which took roughly eight months to achieve, would come to an end when they landed in what would later become known as Sanbao Bay.After leaving some of the peoples there behind, Zheng He would make a return trip to China to report his findings, leaving Lei Shoushan and several troops behind to settle and live in this new world. A second voyage would occur in 1433-1434, bringing more soldiers, but also farmers and miners to Qingqiu.

During the trek there, Zheng He decided that something dramatic needed to be done to appease the unhappy passengers to avoid some kind of disaster. He arranged for the fleet to stop and allow people to visit ships other than their own, in an attempt to abate their cabin fever. These became regular events, almost celebrations
column3: typically, the same ships would cluster together each time, forming communities that sustained people through the ordeal of being stuck in ships for months. As a result, when the Chinese made landfall in Sanbao Bay, and with plans for a large expansion inland, it was decided the communities that were formed by the ship clusters would be sent across the coast, forming new cities such as Yongle (named after the Emperor who supported the treasure fleets), Xiazhou & Julinyutan, with the original site of their first departure being named Sanbao, after Zheng He, who would die shortly after the second voyage.

column2: About two years after the Second Landing, more ships arrived from China. They carried no passengers, however  in fact, they carried barely any soldiers. They had come to deliver a message: the Hongxi Emperor had died and his son now ruled as the Xuande Emperor. The new emperor was uninterested in continuing to devote so many financial and military resources to such a distant colony, and ordered the troops to return. His Majesty had disavowed any interest in Qingqiu, and declared that anyone who remained there would no longer be under his protection.

This caused an uproar in Sanbao, and Lei Shoushan, now leader of the city, sent messages to the other Dong Guo City States, instead of discussing the order of returning to China, instead to demand they swear fealty to him, as the new Emperor of Dong Guo. But neither the other cities, nor even Sanbao, wanted an Emperor, and before any ceremony took place, a coup occurred in Sanbao, killing Lei and forcing the Ming messenger to leave, the latter convinced that their time living in the wilderness had driven them into lunacy. The city-states would come under the administration of the military governors until the 1470s and 1480s, when wealthy and influential men took the reigns in power, forming City Councils, with a representative from each city forming what would ultimately become the Council of Twenty.

During the late 15th century, Dongese explorers sailed south beyond the lands of Mexico and discovered Twanitsuyu. These explorers would meet with and establish a long-standing trade network with the Incan people, bringing untold wealth to the city-states (most especially the southern-most city Yongle) in exchange for weaponry and arms to the Inca. These proved instrumental in the Inca Civil War (1529-1532) and the subsequent Spanish-Incan War (1532-1537), where the Incans, supported by the Dongese, defeated the Spanish. Spanish attempts to subjugate the city-states directly led to the formers defeat at the Battle of Yongle, forcing Spain to accept the borders between the city states and New Spain.

Although Qingqiu was safe from any invasion by the sheer expanse of the continent, the powers of Europe viewed the city-states as weak and quizzically outdated. The relationship quickly shifted from trading partners to one of a more exploitative nature. Wealthy businessmen from the colonies were able to buy considerable influence in the courts of individual cities. The period from 1709 to 1762 (often called the Bloody Age) saw Qingqiu mired in conflict as cities were convinced to go to war with each other to benefit easterners thousands of miles away. A company in New Burgundy might convince one city to blockade another favored by Scandinavian merchants, leading the two to go to war while the company profited from the fallout. A Plantegenian aristocrat might arrange for one city state to raid another and pay for laborers taken from the captives.

By the latter half of the 18th century, the people of Qingqiu were exhausted. The endless, pointless wars had taken their toll and many simply refused the call to arms. Sanbao, and especially Yongle, had been strong enough to resist most outside influence. In 1760 a coalition of European corporations attempted to rally the northern city states to force their interests on the two southern strong-holds. Sanbao and Yongle formed an alliance, defeating several of their neighbors in battle and encouraging rebellions in the farther cities. In the end, the corrupted leaders were deposed, and the city-states signed the treaty of the Brothers Peace
column3: never again would the people of Qingqiu take arms against one another at the behest of a foreign power.

column2: It is often said that this marks the beginning of a unified Qingqiu. However, conservative elements in the victorious cities wanted to preserve the city-state system. Thus, the settlements remained independent, though in the wake of the Bloody Age the populace began to see a common identity linking them to their neighbors.During the Great German War (1795-1820) and the various Wars of Independence fought across the Western Hemisphere, the Qingquiren people were shocked at the developments of which the nations were becoming independent, even more disconcerting when their direct neighbor to the south, Mexico declared its independence from Spain. Lan Weisheng, a Qingquiren educated in the Western way saw these movements as a reason for the Dongese city states to unite into one united state.

While the move was supported by Sanbao (at the time ruled by Weishengs father, Lan Biao), Yongle and other city states in the south, it was hotly opposed by the Council of Twenty and the Northern city states, thus leading to what would lead to a brief, bloodless conflict (1811-1812) which ultimately saw the Northern City-States frightened into union due to the increasing encroachment of Vinlandic settlers westward, and the Council of Twenty dissolved in favor of a Federalized government loyal to Sanbao.As the Dongese Cities, now centralized into the Qingqiu Federation, marches forward into the 19th century, one must come to wonder what the future would hold for them. But for those brave sons of Zheng Hes legacy, they hope that they will march for and lead in this brave new world...?
I have seen stranger things in history!

The end of the Hussite Wars (1419-1434) left Bohemia in ruins. Albert von Habsburg died a year after his coronation in 1438 and the kingdom was inherited by his son Ladislas Postumus. One of the Hussite Bohemian nobles George von Podiebrad gathered an army and took the capital by power and declared himself the Lord Regent. Catholic nobles rose against him and a civil war broke out but George swiftly won. Ladislas was elected in 1453 but died four years after. George was elected as the king. After a long series of negotiating he reached an agreement with the Pope and Bohemia returned back to the Catholic Church. After 14 years, in 1471, George died but before his death he had elected Ladislas II of the Jagiellonian dynasty as a new king.

In 1480 the Duke of Burgundy, Charles the Bold started his campaign against the Empire. Frederick III von Habsburg was defeated and the Empire turned to Ladislas. He entered the war with the forces of the Kingdom united with those of the Empire. After a Pyrrhic victory in Bohemia's favor at Nieder-Olm in 1483, the peace is signed. Even though the Empire lost the war, Ladislas was seen as a savior of the Germans, and in the Imperial Election of 1486 he decisively defeated Maximilian of Austria. At that moment the Jagiellonian Dynasty ruled in Germany, Poland, Lithuania, Bohemia and Hungary.

In 1516 he was succeeded in all his domains by his son Louis. Eight years passed and Suleiman the Magnificent, Emperor of the House of Osman invaded the Middle Europe in a grand campaign. Louis sent a portion of his army to face the Ottoman threat but he underestimated the enemy and in 1526 the combined Bohemian and Hungarian forces were defeated in the Battle of Mohacs and Hungary fell under direct Ottoman control. The aggression turned to a huge threat to the Christendom and Louis rallied a Holy League of Germany, Bohemia, Austria and Poland-Lithuania. They managed to lift the Siege of Brno and reconquer small piece of Royal Hungary. With both sides exhausted the peace is signed in 1530 and the Ottoman hegemony over Hungary would last almost 300 years. Sigismund, second son of Louis, is given the title of the Margrave of Nitra.

Meanwhile in Zurich Zwingli proposed his 95 theses and Louis tried to arrest him at the Diet of Worms but Zwingli managed to escape with the help of the Burgundians. The Protestant started to spread through the Empire as a disease. Louis in response declared himself the Most Catholic King and started to root out the heresy in massive acts of Re-Catholicism and counter-reformation. In 1547 Louis was succeeded as the King of Bohemian Lands and the Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire by his son Ottokar III who, thanks to his marriage to Elizabeth of Brandenburg - the only heiress of Joachim von Hohenzollern, inherited the Margraviate in 1550. As a true Catholic he began to fought the Protestantism there by supporting Jesuits and the Inquisition. The religious conflicts inside the Empire reached its climax in 1605 when an angry crowd executed the Bohemian-appointed governor of Berlin and declared Brandenburg free. Ottokar IV quickly responded by sending his army to reconquer the Margraviate and restore order.

But the events had already begun to move. An alliance of North German Protestant lords declared themselves the Protestant League. They sought support in both Scandinavia and Burgundy - two major Protestant powers. Scandinavia responded with attack on Pomerania. As a reaction the Catholic league of Bohemia, Austria, Bavaria and Poland was formed. In 1615 in the battle of Neubrandenburg are the Bohemian armies almost annihilated and Scandinavians started their advance to the south. The war seemed lost. But thanks to successful negotiations with then King of the Dual Monarchy, Francis I, England-France entered the war in 1616. The Burgundians sued for peace. Nordic forces were decisively defeated in 1619 in the Battle of Melnik. But the northern naval blockade of the Empire was crippling the trade and so in 1621 the peace was signed in Hamburg

Scandinavia annexed Pomerania and abolished the Hansa and Bohemia regained control of Brandenburg and added the Duchy of Saxony to its possessions. The freedom of religion was declared in the Empire. Thanks to the laws accepted in Frankfurt in 1484 the Lands of the Bohemian Crown were excluded from this treaty. Relative stability was reached and the Jagiellonians ruled peacefully for another 150 years. Their dominance in the Empire is threatened only by Burgundy.

In 1790 the German revolution began but the revolutionaries are defeated by the Imperial Army 5 years after. Wenceslas VIII felt that his position was strong enough to centralize the Empire and achieve the Middle European hegemony. The Scandinavians and Burgundians responded with the declaration of war and starting the Great German War. Military success on the part of Wenceslas VIII, dubbed the "Lion of the North," saw many military victories over the Burgundians and Scandinavians. However, after three decades, Wenceslas VIII was forced to realize that he was unable to achieve Central European hegemony and sued for peace, signed in Frankfurt. The Reichstag was reduced and the Imperial Electorates were dissolved but Bohemian Kings would continue to call themselves the Emperors of the German Nation, and retain hegemony over the remaining Eastern German states. Wenceslas would be murdered the following year and would be succeeded by his son, Sigismund V.

Burgundian exploration in the New World began as an enterprise to circumvent both the Anglo-French, whose alliance was terminated with their conquest of Brittany in 1492, as well as the Spanish, who had already begun establishing outposts in Cuba. Through contacts and royal support of Dutch and Flemish mercantile and banking clans, beginning with Jean III, and continuing with Philippe IV, there were several exploration projects, discovering the territories around the Northeast Arcadia and Northeast Ameriga. Arcadia in particular would not see settlement by Burgundian and Flemish colonists until the founding of Philippa in 1529. This would be followed with the founding of Nouvelle Bruges and Port Valois in 1535 and 1547, respectively.

The first trial of the colonization of New Burgundy came with the Italian Religious Wars (1567-1584), a series of direct and indirect conflicts between the Dual Monarchy (who had already established its colonial holdings and centralized them as the Viceroyalty of New France.) Although most of the fighting was restricted to Northwest Italy and Provence, there were a number of engagements at sea, where both Burgundian and Neo Burgundian ships fought to keep the Anglo-French from capturing the nascent Burgundian colonies, which would only be confirmed in the Treaty of Saint-Denis in 1584.

The Treaty of Hamburg that ended the Imperial Wars of Religion (1605-1621), saw Scandinavia ultimately dismantle the Hanseatic League, which was already in decline due to the Scandinavian policy of Dominium Maris Baltici. The result of this saw a number of German merchant clans immigrating to Burgundy, and some even to the colonies of New Burgundy and Vinland. These Germano-Septimans would utilize this opportunity, transforming the Burgundian West India Compny into the Neuwelt Hansa (Hanse du Nouveau-Monde in French) in 1669. This move would become the precursor to the federalized nature that would become the Seven Republics.

During the Great German War (1795-1820), the Burgundians saw fit to raise taxes and tariffs in their colonies (a matter that was also done by ally Scandinavia and Spain.) Discontent over taxation without being formally represented in the Burgundian Estates-General led initially to a revolt for greater rights, which ultimately became a conflict over the right to become its own nation. The Neo-Burgundian War of Independence (1802-1805) was decisive, primarily because of Burgundy being trapped in conflict with Bohemia, as colonials quickly swept away Loyalist garrisons. The Treaty of Ghent confirmed this fait accompli, and thus New Burgundy gained independence as the Seven Republics of New Burgundy.

The new nation differed from most other nations. Taking the model of the New Hanseatic League, the state of New Burgundy was divided into seven confederal Republics as per the name, each ruled by a Grand Pensionary, who would serve as its governor, and serves a subsidiary role to the Stadtholder (Stathouder in French), who would be responsible for the policies affecting all states as well as New Burgundys foreign policies. Debates ensued to decide of the name of the new state. The hero of the Independence War and first Stadhoudter coined the term of Belgian Confederacy, taking the name after the antic area from where a lot of the colonists came.

Originally ruled under the National Liberals (Parti National Libéral), power shifted to the more jingoistic Moderate Party (Parti Modéré). It was Stadtholder Damien Collet who gave rise to the popular idea of Arcadianism, the idea that all of Arcadia should be united under one government Par la Raison ou la Force! (By Reason or By Force!). These jingoistic attitudes led to Vinalnd (who gained independence in 1808) and Plantagenia (who gained independence in 1771) to declare war on the Confederacy.The War of the Double Alliance (1819-1821) was a long and drawn out conflict, that would see war heroes like Jacques Lahure (nicknamed the Hannibal of the West) and Willem Le Cocq fight glorious battles against their Vinlandic and Plantagenian rivals.

Septiman military dominance, confirmed by the industrialization of New Burgundy over its rivals to the North and south, ensured that the Treaty of Erikshavn was in their favor, securing Basse-Leonie and various border provinces along the Plantagenian and Vinlandic borders would be in their hands.  However it also brought about a completely new vice, the concept of Slavery, which, despite being restricted to its southernmost Republics, began the debate over the legality of slavery, especially through its claims into slaveholding Plantagenia. The Seven Republics emerged as the most industrialized power in Arcadia, and with it the ideals of Arcadianism could very well be within their grasp...?
I knew Belgium wasn't a real country!

The Legacy of the Nordic Crowns stem from the personal union of Margaret, Queen and Regent of Denmark and through her son Olaf (who passed in 1387) and victory over the Swedish Magnates, ruler of Norway and Sweden. Thus she became known as the Mother of Scandinavia, beloved by her people. Such successes however would not be shared by her immediate successors. Eric of Pomerania continuously incited conflicts against Schleswig, Holstein, Mecklenburg, and even against various Pomeranian Principalities in his attempt to unite all these lands. This sentiment was not shared by the Swedes, who often traded with these various duchies. In addition, Danish centralization was something not supported by the Swedish Riksdag, including the imposition of the Sound Dues to increase income at the expense of the Hanseatic League, which led to the Danish-Hanseatic War (1426-1435). However he was also credited with the foundation of Copenhagen as the capital for Denmark, and ultimately of the Kalmar Union itself.

It was not to last however, revolts across Scandinavia broke out, in Sweden by the farmers, and later the nobility against his practices, forcing him to yield to Holstein and the Hansa, in Norway a peasant revolt broke out and successfully took Oslo, finally, in Denmark, the Danish magnates refusal to crown Bogislaw IX, the Duke of Pomerania as Erics heir caused the King to retreat to Visborg in Gotland, which would later lead to his abdication by all three kingdoms. He would be succeeded by his nephew, Christopher of Bavaria, who put down many of the rebellions in Denmark. Unfortunately he proved to be an ineffective ruler, unable to challenge Eric of Pomeranias piracy, as well as gain acceptance in Sweden, so much so, and also out of a desire to regain independence, chose its own King, Charles VIII rather than go with Christian I upon Christopher IIIs death in 1448.

Christian I and Charles VIII initiated a rivalry over the Norwegian throne, ultimately leading to a war which later historians would call the Scandinavian Civil War (1451-1465). Charles VIII successfully resisted all forces sent to depose him, led by the Oxenstierna and Vasa families, and ruled with power shared by the Riksdag until his death in 1470. But Christians troubles did not subside upon becoming King of Sweden, having to deal with various parts of his realm trying to govern themselves locally. Christian was credited with the founding of the University of Copenhagen in 1478. Another credit was the peace made between the Kalmar Union and Scotland, with the betrothal and later marriage of Margaret of Denmark, the daughter of Christopher of Bavaria to James III of Scotland.

His successor, John I, was the first monarch to balance the interests of the powers involved, attempting to weaken the power of Swedish magnate Sten Sturre and of the Hansa through the support of Novgorod, something which was arranged to best protect them against the forces of the Muscovites under Ivan III. (The Novgorod-Muscovite War of 1496, 1496-1499). The first permanent Danish, later Scandinavian Navy would be founded under his rule, while a brief war with the Swedes (1497) led to Sturre being forced to surrender to John I, and the subsequent creation of the title, Kings of the North. Unfortunately, in an attempt to conquer Dithmarshen in the Battle of Hemmingstedt (17 February 1500), the Dithmarsians trapped John, his son and crown prince Christian, and the mercenaries in a flooded dyke, drowning all involved, opening Scandinavia to the reality of being torn asunder.

It would be later that year that Danish magnates, as well as various Norwegian magnates came to bring a relative of John I, his nephew, King James IV of Scotland to become King of the North, a title he would assume as Jacob I. Jacob was the typical renaissance prince, sponsoring Scandinavias first printing press, establishing gun foundries in Copenhagen as well as his old home in Edinburgh, and brought renaissance art and science to the Scandinavian nation. He was also responsible for finally subjugating the Swedish rebels under Gustav Vasa (who attempted to crown himself Gustav I).
