In true renaissance fashion, James IV being the polygot that he was, carried out a reform of the Danish language, utilizing rules and stipulations from the nascent Norwegian and Swedish languages in order to streamline administration throughout Scandinavia.

Military reforms were also carried out as well, establishing a united Kalmar Army, which would be put to use in supporting Novgorod in conflicts with Muscovy, as well as bringing Pskov into the fold when anti-Kalmari Novgoroders gained power in the Merchant republic, bringing about the Livonian War (1558-1585) as Scandinavia fought Novgorod & Poland-Lithuania for control over the remnant Livonian Order (later secularized into the Duchy of Courland-Semigalia.His son, James II, and his successor, James III, would be responsible for the establishment of Protestantism in Scandinavia, James II, upon his coronation charter on 7 August 1523, he was made the protector of the Catholic Church of Denmark, Norway and Sweden, and in that role he took an opprotunistic approach in weakening the power of Catholic nobles and clergy. But James III was more overt in his views of Protestantism, having been one of the royals to attend the Diet of Worms and was influenced by the doctrines of Huldrych Zwingli.

On 30 October 1536, he formally established the Scandinavian Zwinglian Church as the national church of Scandinavia, following the example of the Burgundian monarchs. A brief war with the Holy Roman Empire (1542-1544) prevented the restoration of Catholicism in Scandinavia in support of James IIIs brother, Matthew.John III would later be credited with the sponsoring of the first explorations of Scandinavia into the New World, shortly after Burgundy did the same some years earlier. Through his expeditions he would see about the creation of Colonial Vinland, though it would be his son and successor, Eric VIII who would continue and expand such funding, establishing more cities along the Vinlandic coast and even made expeditions into the Caribbean, successfully snatching away the Anglo-French colony of Galatia in what would eventually become Sudurhafeyjar.

His successors would also be responsible for its colonial policies in East Asia, gaining access, along with Burgundy, over the Malaccan spice trade, carving out a niche of outposts and colonies in India, the Tondolese Kingdom (later renamed Christiania after Christian II, who was monarch at the time of the colonial acquisition of the Christianian Islands). In addition, outposts and colonies were established in Africa as well, holding control over Mocambike between Zanzibar and Burgundian South Africa, overall, Scandinavia became the second largest colonial power in the Eastern Hemisphere, behind that of the Burgundians.

Eric VIII would also be responsible for the restarting of the Scandinavian-Bohemian rivalry over the religious affairs of Germany, as well as the Scandinavian desire for Dominium Maris Baltici (Baltic Sea Dominion), the desire for all of the Baltic Sea to eventually become a Scandinavian lake. Despite Erics failure for a dominant role in Northern Germany he was able to acquire Pomerania, and directly threaten Jagiellon Poland-Lithuania, the final key to true dominance in the Baltic. However such plans would be laid to waste over the following decades, as Pomerania and Prussia became a battleground, all the while keeping Russia divided in order to ensure its ascendency.

This became crucial in the Great German War where Holy Roman Emperor Wenceslaus V, directly threatened the interests of Scandinavia and its ally Burgundy by threatening to unite and centralize the Holy Roman Empire. Despite the martial nature of Scandinavia, the Lion of Europe scored key victories, even retaking Pomerania from the Scandinavians, and even directly threatening to bring Denmark into the fold. But the various Protestant Princes, not wanting to be destroyed by the major Catholic power brought their resources to bear, and under the leadership of Burgundy and Scandinavia, was able to force Wenceslaus to the negotiating table.

Following the French Wars of Succession, the Kingdom of England emerged as the greatest power in Europe during the early modern era. But that did not mean that the English citizens became members of the ruling class. With the majority of the post-Norman English nobility being Francophone, it was not long before further alienation of the upper class from the ordinary Englishmen and the moving of the court of the Dual Thrones to the mainland with England becoming once again just a province of a Romance realm.While portions of the English population, especially in the more populated cities in the South, embraced the French supremacy willingly, abandoning their Germanic roots in the process, the inhabitants of northern England did not give up so easily. As it usually happens in large heterogeneous realms, those on the outskirts felt neglected and discriminated.

As such, the North developed quite a grudge against the Plantagenet monarchy, fuelled by Scandinavians who became united with the Scottish Crown in the early 16th century. Hoping to sow a seed of discontent in the Anglo-French dominion, Scandinavians spread the idea of a Church free from Rome and, by extension, from Paris. The notion of Protestantism was seen by local political elites as a powerful means to gain a degree of autonomy and was wholeheartedly accepted by the common folk who felt detached from the incomprehensible world of Latin liturgy. And thus, the Reformed Anglican Church was born.The Dual Monarchy was initially tolerant to the various branches of Protestantism spreading throughout her realm. Fearing a possible rebellion in England which would most definitely prove costly and difficult for the Court in Paris while having his eyes firmly set on the affairs on the mainland, Édouard V issued the Edict of Cantorbéry in 1553, legalising the Reformed Church.

This document also granted the English nobility a large degree of freedom in their local matters - together with the Irish autonomy, the beginning of the second half of the 16th century saw a major decline of Plantagenet control over the Isles, even though the English Parliament was officially abolished by Édouard's father in 1537. This changed quickly, though. The Irish independence was systematically destroyed during the three Irish Wars and at the dawn of the 17th century the line of appeasement kings ended with François I who aggressively challenged the breakup of the religious unity and stood firm against Burgundy, the champion of the Protestant faith. The Catholic forces eventually emerged victorious in the Anglo-French Wars of Religion, both externally and internally.

Securing the outer border, François decided to finish the 'Insular Problem' once and for all and while he deployed forces in the Nine Years' War against the Irish, he also abolished the Edict of Canterbéry and began a massive re-catholisation of the English lands. While the nobles, often fearing the loss of their holdings mostly surrendered to the Catholic king, the lower classes did not share the same sentiment. With the lands of Ameriga being gradually discovered by Anglo-French and Burgundian navigators, the desperate Anglicans saw them as the new Promised Land where they shall be granted freedom and independence. And so, similarly to the French Huguenots, large groups of Englishmen refusing to accept the Catholic faith fled to the harbours in the Lowlands from which they set sail towards the New World.

Seeking escape from the French domination, the Father Pilgrims (as they will be later named) arrived after facing the difficulties of the Trans-Atlantic voyage at the coast of Neo Anglia, a land even deeper in the south than the Burgundian colony of Nouvelle Amsterdam. Neo Anglia was unofficially claimed by England-France which even established several settlements there, especially near the Riviere de lArgent. But the Dual Monarchy's zones of interest were wide and so the Court of Paris had to abandon some of its endeavours every now and then. Seeing that Neo Anglia was subject of the influx of Anglican settlers supported by the Burgundians, the Plantagenet administration quickly decided to abandon this potential powder keg which would most probably simply drain the valuable resources of the realm and relocated its focus elsewhere. And so the Kingdom of England-in-exile slowly started to emerge, first independent settler state in the New World.

The Anglicans, obviously carrying much hatred against Romance languages in general, swiftly started changing remaining Anglo-French names to more suitable ones. Being a mixture of English patriots and fierce Anglicans, the land was designated accordingly - hence you can now visit Seaxburgh and New Jerusalem, Eoferwic and Æthelwulf, all in one country. So in the 1630s, the English settlements started quickly developing with more and more people arriving from Albion, hearing news about the Eden on Earth. A desire for unity began to grow and in 1657 the representatives of important communes arrived at the place where it all began, at the isthmus of the Silver River, eager to build a united country. Fierciely believing in the concept of royal majesty and overall bound by the 17th century mentality, they decided to establish a Kingdom, maintaining the English Crown in exile in South Ameriga.

With almost no important nobles being among them, John Cavendish, being a renegade son of the Duke of Newcastle and one of the ship captains who led the first Father Pilgrims in the 1620s was chosen to be the new realm's leader. Cavendish, being industrious and having already scouted the land before during his services as a Burgundian privateer saw the opportunity of carving a power base for himself in the New World and settled soon in the lands of Avalon (the formerly occupied Neo Anglia) and further sponsored the efforts of Anglicans to bring more fellow countrymen to Ameriga. As such, he became a well-known and respected member of the society during the first half of the 17th century. And so John Cavendish, being well in his sixties, became the first King of the new Kingdom in 1658, stylising himself as Edward I. The nation's capital was founded at the Silver River which proved to be an important source of wealth for the Anglicans.

In tradition of mixing Anglo-Saxon, Anglican and Briton heritage, the city was named Nazareth and the Kingdom changed from England-in-exile to Beornicia honouring old Anglo-Saxon settlers with the name soon corrupted to Beornia by popular use. John Cavendish, now Edward I, thus founded the House of Beornia, essentially claiming the Crown of England. But truth be told, no one really cared. Beornia was distant and sparselypopulated and after the initial Anglican influx, the flow of immigrants almost stopped. Devout to Puritanism, with a weird language and even weirder customs, New England quickly isolated itself from the outside world, only dealing with the Burgundian governors from time to time. But even despite that the Kingdom grew. Expanding as far as the Lake Ginosar and even beyond, the Beornian colonists soon came to contact with the Incas in the late 17th century. The massives of Andes proved to be a solid border and no real conflict with the Empire emerged.

The 18th century was quite peaceful throughout the Beornian lands, aside of some petty feudal squabbles and battles with natives. The only event worth mentioning was the short-lived war of succession when Henry, the Duke of Godwinson, rose against his infant cousin Harold and the appointed regent Sir Peter Bryne in 1757, seizing Nazareth in 1758 only to be ousted by loyalists during the same year, defeated in 1760 and executed the same year. His estates were then appropriated by Sir Bryne who became the new Duke of Godwinson. Eventually, the 19th century and the modern era creeped in, even in Ameriga. The citizens of European colonies started to doubt the oversea governance and one after another started anti-European actions. In 1805, the Burgundian colony of Lotharingia began her own quest for independence and Beornians were quite keen on helping.

Arthur III of Beornia, being one of the more enlightened Kings who had his children educated in Europe, believed in the ideals of freedom and hoped that the Lotharians would become another free New World country. He even attended the ceremony in Charlemagne officially celebrating the birth of the Lotharian Republic. Talks over the end of the firm feudal regime and birth of a Beornian constitution ended abruptly, though, in 1817 when Edward IV became King, returning from Europe enchanted by the notion of Bohemian absolutism. Nazareth's alliance with Lotharingia held, despite that, more specifically the alliance with the authoritarian elements, especially the would-be dictator De Aigle. With Beornian help, De Aigle was in spite of several major setbacks able to restore order in the newborn republic which was in the middle of a downward spiral. He was a person to Edward's liking, even marrying his niece in 1827, the King dreaming to spread the true English nobility throughout the new post-colonial states.

The Crown of Aragons genesis came from the personal union of Queen Petronilla, Queen of Aragon and one of the last of the Jimena Dynasty, to the Count of Barcelona, Raymond Berengar IV in 1162. Since then, the Aragonese crown grew under successive monarchs, all while maintaining the composite monarchical structure with the incorporation of Valencia, Majorca, Sardinia and finally Sicily, achieved with the death of King Martin of Sicily, son of King Martin I of Aragon in 1409. However such victory was short lived with the formers death the following year, throwing the Aragonese monarchy into chaos for the next two years.

Ferrans son and successor, Alfons V oversaw the reunification, if only temporary, of the full Kingdom of Sicily, in 1442 in the Neapolitan War of Succession (1432-1442), and successfully vassalized the Principality of Albania as it was fighting a war with the Ottoman Empire. Alfons believed himself the inheritor of the destiny of Charles dAnjou, to re-create the Latin Empire of Constantinople, a Maritime Empire stretching from Aragon to Greece. Alfons dream, as it became known by successive Aragonese Kings, would be passed down through each monarch since him. After Alfons death, the thrones were split, Aragon going to his younger brother John II, while Naples passed to Alfons illegitimate son Ferrante.

John II, who also served as de facto King of Navarre, spent his reign trying to incorporate Navarre into the Aragonese domain, a conflict that would dominate Aragonese foreign policy during the reigns of his successors Ferdinand II and John III. The Navarrese who opposed him, led first by his eldest son Charles IV, Prince of Viana, and later his daughter Blanche II, led to a sharp rebuke, even among the Aragonese, whos support for the Prince of Viana ultimately led to the Catalonian Civil War (1462-1472), which saw various claimants, first Charles IV, then later to Enrique IV of Castile, and later Pedro, Constable of Portugal and Rene, Duke of Anjou and Count of Provence. All times John rose to the occassion, and although he lost influence over Navarre, John was able to secure his monarchy for himself and his chosen heir Ferdinand II.

Under Ferdinand II, Aragon continued in its battle for the Navarrese, first by supporting the Agramont-backed candidate John de Foix or the throne (even going as far as marrying Johns youngest sister Leonor de Foix), then later after Johns death, utilizing Leonors claim to try and bring Navarre into the crown. However this action provoked the newly established Dual Monarchy, provoking the First Navarrese War (1512-1516). This conflict, which saw the Navarrese Kingdom divided between two halves saw the Anglo-French annexation of the Counties of Foix & Bearn on the Northern half of the Pyrenees, while Navarre became a satellite state of the Aragonese Crown.

Another achievement made by Ferdinand II was his actions towards the Barbary Pirates. During his reign, Ferdinand expanded the Naval Shipyards at Valencia and Barcelona and built fleets of ships to counter the Barbary Pirates, but he did more than this, after Barbary raids at Palma in the Balearic Islands and in Sardinia, Ferdinand decided to move against one of the Barbary bases, namely Oran and Algiers, held by the Zayyanid Kingdom of Tlemcen. The Aragonese-Algierian War (1500-1512) was the first major conflict Aragon launched against an African power, and the first major conflict since the end of the Reconquista in 1492 (the Spanish conquest of Melilla in 1497 notwithstanding) The twelve year long conflict saw the entirety of the Algerian Coast gained for Aragon, the single largest takeover of Muslim land since Ferdinand IIIs conquest of much of Spain. The final expansion of Aragonese North Africa would not be made complete until the Conquest of Tunis, now Carthage, by John III in 1535.

John III, known as the Constable was known for instituting major reforms to his new domains. Among his reforms, he Chartered Merchant Companies, aimed towards breaking the power of the many Italian Trading families, and reducing internal competition. Workhouses were built for orphans of fallen soldiers, allowing them greater access to careers towards the state and military. But one of the greatest reforms was the centralization of the varying disparate Cortes, bringing together the Parliamentary bodies of Aragon (Zaragoza), Catalonia (Barcelona), Valencia (Valencia), Sardinia (Cagliari) & Sicily (Palermo) into one united Cortes General. Naples would be added to this domain in 1550 with the death of Ferrante III of Naples, thus restoring the patrimony of Alfons V.

John III was no slouch in the affairs of diplomacy and war either, as evidenced in the War of the League of Naples (1519-1526). The conflict, pitting the Valois Coalition of Provence, Genoa, Tuscany & Ferrara against the Aragonese-led League of Naples (Aragon, Naples, Papal States, Milan & Modena) saw back and force conflict up and down the peninsula. Ultimately culminating in a Neapolitan League Victory at Bologna in 1525, thus removing all Valois Influence from Italy. Much of Aragons succeeding monarchs spent their time dealing with the Threat of the Ottoman Empire, who backed the surviving Barbary Pirates from their bases in the Hafsid Kingdom (or at times against the Ottoman Navy itself from the Balkans) or dealing with tensions against the Trastamaras of Spain or the Plantagenets of Anglo-France. In addition, the Aragonese, especially after the gaining of Naples, cultivated their influence in Italy and Venice in preparation of their Imperial Ambitions.

Thus it was all the more surprising when the Tuscans killed the Provencal Viceroy in Florence and declared the Etrurian Republic. The threat of a revolutionary republic in Italy was too great for Aragon, especially when it spread its influence across the peninsula by warfare (1807-1814), even directly taking control of much of Naples and threatening their other Italian possessions before finally being overturned. Disaster continued to plague Aragon, as a weakening economy, further support in its foreign policy goals (supporting the Venetian reconquest of the Peloponnese and Attica, and supporting and even supplying an illegitimate son of John IV to the Macedonian throne) and a King who was unable to sire an heir led to a crisis over succession. Enter Josep Serna.

Serna was another illegitimate child of the womanizing King John IV, and like his half-brother, the King of Macedon, was legitimized according to the Kings will when John died in 1799. Josep had a storied career as a military officer who took part in many battles against the Djezairid Sultanate of Algeria and during the Italian Revolutionary War. When Alfons VI died in September 1835, the Aragonese Succession Crisis began. The original heir, Ferran VI was crowned later that month, but died within 44 days of his reign, with the throne left to his daughter, Maria. Maria was known for her luxury taste, frivolous spending and a notorious streak of having many lovers. Josep, with the support of the people across the realm went to Barcelona with his fellow soldiers. The Aragonese Parliament, not wanting to go against the will of the people, summoned Josep to the Parliament where he was crowned as King.

Thus the House of Serna was born as a Royal Family, to continue the legacy of Alfons V. For the Aragonese desire to create a Mediterranean Lake, a dream shared by the Romans and the Latin Empire of which they claim descent. With the rapidly declining Ottomans and with Italy in their pocket, their dream of such an empire may very well come soon.?
Aragon will make into Gonder this time maybe?

The Origins of the Empire of Tawantinsuyu (Quecha for the Four Regions), known among Europeans as the Inca Empire, started with the rise of the Kingdom of Cusco. Pachacuti, transformed his Kingdom to an Empire with the conquest of the Chanca, and the incorporation of various Andean Kingdoms into this new Empire. Unlike the other preeminent power of the New World, the Aztec Triple Alliance, the Inca would achieve its expansion through diplomacy and intrigue, scouting out prospective kingdoms in terms of political organization, military strength and wealth, and sending messengers convincing leaders the benefits of joining the Empire. Once these Kingdoms were peacefully integrated, the rulers children would be sent to Cusco to be taught in Quecha and in Incan administrative systems. Inter-marriages between the Cuscan elite and these children helped further integrate these Kingdoms into the Empire.

The only serious military campaigns prior to contact with the Chinese, were against their chief rival, the Kingdom of Chimor (also known as Chimu) and against the Mapuche (1470-1493). The former would be subjugated in 1470, while the latter would prove resilient to Inca invasion.During the late 15th century, the Inca would be greeted by traders hailing from Dong Guo City-State of Yongle. This first contact proved very beneficial for the Incans, as it introduced to them horses, gunpoweder weaponry and more importantly, advisors that helped to reform the Incan administrative system, derived from a combination of Incan and Chinese models. This centralized structure helped the Incans in the trials ahead.

The death of Huayna Capac I and his son and heir Ninan Cuyochi in 1527 would leave the Inca in turmoil as his two youngest sons, Huáscar and Atahualpa would come to blows against each other in the Inca Civil War (1529-1532) after the former arrested and killed the latters supporters. Huáscar would take the reigns, supported by the aristocracy and the religious authorities. However his control was restricted to the southern parts of the Empire, while Atahualpa was well supported by the Northern Aristocrats for his more liberal views of thinking. However he was also supported by the Yongle traders, and with his large reserve of gold and silver, he was able to buy the services of some 500 Dongese soldiers to serve him. Despite being few in number, their weaponry, professionalism and thick armor proved to be one of the deciding factors.

The other factor was disease, spread by the recent Spanish colonization and exploration of Mesoamerica, these diseases were ravaging the Incan Empire, this was recognized by Atahualpa, who through the Dongese merchants, procured of the knowledge of variolation, a preventative measure used in China for several centuries. These combined factors, and Atahualpas ability to reform and solve these problems, helped to change the tide, defeating and killing Huáscar, and winning the war. The Dongese soldiers that served him would go on to become the Chinu Guard, Chinu being the Quecha word for Chinese).

Atahualpa set off for Cusco to be crowned as Sapa Inca, however along the way his party was ambushed by the Spanish expedition led by Francisco Pizarro. Many of the Incan troops were killed, and the survivors - several Yongle soldiers among them - were taken hostage. Atahualpa arranged to pay the Spaniards an exorbitant amount of gold and silver for his release. However, when the payment was made, the Spanish simply took it and kept their prisoners. They intended to depose of Atahualpa and Francisco would be proclaimed the new Sapa Inca. News of the deception spread, enraging Atahualpas generals as well as the Chinu Guard. Quizquiz, an Incan general, gathered the remains of the Incan army, and together with new soldiers hired from the Dongese City-States, marched to expel the Spanish and free their emperor.

The Spanish, whose original expedition was quite small (just 168 men, 27 horses, and a single cannon), had nonetheless gathered an army from various populations that wanted to see an end to Incan rule. They expected to crush the savages easily. Although the Chinese technology was not at the same level as the European military, it was enough to rout the indigenous army loyal to the conquistador, and the elite Spanish troops were overwhelmed by numbers. Pizarro planned to threaten to kill Atahualpa to force Quizquiz to surrender
column3: however, he was betrayed and killed by his associate, Diego de Almagro. Almagro organized the Spanish surrender. The captive Emperor and his guard were released, in exchange for allowing the remaining Spaniards to leave. After their defeat in Tawantinsuyu, Spain sent more troops to reinforce their holdings in the New World. They made reparations to the newly crowned Sapa Inca and negotiated a treaty that would allow Spanish settlers into the northern areas of the Empire.

column2: Historians argue over why Atahualpa accepted the treaty. Some believe that due to mistranslation, or even deliberate deception on the part of the Spanish, that the emperor thought the Spanish were actually submitting to him and asking to join his empire. Others say that Atahualpa knew he could not defeat the true Spanish army, and that he made concessions to prevent the conquest of his empire. The latter would prove true when the Spanish launched a second invasion in 1572 (lasting to 1576), shortly after the accession of Paullu as Sapa Inca, which saw the Incan court moved from Cusco to Chuquisaca, which would serve as the Court of the Inca to the modern day. It would not be until the end of the century that the Inca would find another protector, the Dual Monarchy of England and France. Although the Plantagenets failed in converting the Quecha people to Catholicism, they were able to gain a tributary state, exchanging gold and silver from the mines of Potosi for the continued foreign protection from Spain.

The beginning of the Westernization of the Incan Empire began mid-way into the reign of Túpac Amaru II, utilizing traders and support from not only their traditional friends, the Dongese City States (later the Qingqiu Federation) but also from their protectors the Dual Monarchy of England and France. The progress would be slow, as attempts at reform met with sharp reaction by the conservative elite. The utilization of foreign-born officers, weapons and schooling had been some of the steps implemented by during the years of Túpac Amaru prior to his death. These reforms would be slowed down during the reign of his successors Huáscar III and Huayna Capac IV, yet continued in an attempt to keep their independence possible. The Incan Administration began to be reformed under the European (specifically Anglo-French model), while Financal reform saw the tradition Incan currency being replaced with paper currency, the Liwru (a Quechua term for Livre).

During the Spanish-American Wars of Independence, Spain, desperate to put an end to the rebellious Columbian Alliance, asked for an alliance with the Inca in 1828, offering them the Captaincy-Generals of Aqequipa & Quito in exchange for military support. Seeing this as an opportunity to test the combat capability of the new westernized Incan Army, Huayna Capac IV accepted. The Incan Intervention (1828-1832) saw the Incans achieve military success during the early parts of the conflict, reconquering their former capital, Cusco and bringing the Catholicized Quecha to the fold throughout the Central Andes, proceeding to advance towards the titular capital of the Captaincy-General of Quito. This would culminate in the Battle of Lima in July 1830. The Battle was was one that could have gone either way, as it saw the Colombian leader José de Herrera killed in the battle. However, it was the Columbians who won the field.

and after two years of little successes and great drawbacks, Huayna Capac IV sued for peace, paying reparations, and relinquishing their hold on Arequipa & Quito. The defeat inflicted upon the Inca convinced the Sapa Inca and many in the leadership that further reforms would be needed, but with Huayna Capac growing old and soon to be dying, the task would soon fall to his son, the Prince-Apparent, Usco. Usco, who wishes to become as great as the great founder of Tawantinsuyu, Pachacuti, wishes to take on the mantle of dragging the Empire into the 19th century, but can he succeed, with hostile Europeans surrounding this great nation?
Time for us to get back the Andes I guess ?

The French Wars of Succession was nothing short of a disaster for the Valois dynasty. The combination of unlucky factors, such as the death of Jeanne dArc in 1431, the Burgundians remaining with the Plantagenets with the Treaty of Arras in 1435 and the disastrous defeat at Vichy in 1471 helped contribute to the total annihilation of the Armagnac party. Reduced to its holdings in Languedoc, Auvergne (ruled by the powerful House of La Tour dAuvergne since 1437) and Provence (inherited from Charles III upon the latter's death in 1481), Charles VIII was forced to sign the Treaty of Rome in 1498, confirming his current domains and the title of King in France and Duke of Provence (as Charles IV) in exchange for recognizing the Plantagenets as Kings of France.

The next significant development in the history the Valois was their Italian policy, which began in 1494 with the marriage of Charles IV to Contessina Beatrice de Medici, a daughter of the last Gonfaloniere and first Duke of Florence, Lorenzo I de Medici. Over the course of the reign of Charles IV and his successor François I, they would conduct an effective marriage policy featuring members of the extended Valois family to notable Italian families. Their connections helping to spread the Renaissance culture and style to Provence, as well as helping to contribute Italian words,mixed with the French and local Occitan to what would become the Provençal Language.

Unfortunately, this marriage policy would only garner an enemy in the form of the pro-Papal Guleph faction, the pro-Imperial Ghibelline faction, and the Aragonese, who had their own designs of controlling Italy. This would ultimately culminate in the War of the League of Naples (1519-1526) fought between the Valois Coalition (Provence, Genoa, Tuscany & Ferrara) and the titular League of Naples (Aragon, the Papal States, Milan, Modena and Naples). The war culminated in the Leagues decisive victory in the Battle of Bologna in 1525, which saw the capture of François I, and the signing of the Treaty of Barcelona, which saw Provences Italian holdings (predominantly that of Reggio and Ferrara, with which was held in Personal Union) lost to the various members of the League and the expulsion of Provençal notables from the Peninsula in exchange for his release.

Provences luck further deteriorated when François, supporting in hiding Huldrych Zwingli in Aix-en-Provence led to the First Provençal War (1522-1525) which saw the Anglo-French annexation of Auvergne (after the mysterious death of the last Duchess of Auvergne, Anne de La Tour dAuvergne). Open support for Protestantism, as well as François continued interference in Italy had led to his excommunication by Pope Adrian VI and a call for Crusade against them. It would be the Avignon Massacre, the slaughter of all clergymen during François conquest of that Papal holding that brought both Bohemia and the Dual Monarchy to invade in the Languedoc War of 1532, the second wanting to ensure his title of King of France went undisputed. Burgundian & Aragonese support against the two helped to bring together the Treaty of Nice. François was removed from the Provençal throne, and would be replaced by his nephew, Philip II/VIII. At the same time, the Dual Monarchy would annex the Languedoc region.

Protestantism would rear its head again during the War of the Provençal Succession (1568-1576) which pitted the Catholic and pro-Anglo-French Duke Charles V/IX against his cousin, the pro-Burgundian and Protestant Louis, Count of Venaissin (styled Louis V/XI). It was around during the war that Aix-en-Provence, the traditional seat of the Dukes of Provence were captured by Protestant forces in 1572, on the Feast Day of Saint Bartholomew. As a result, Charles was forced to move his court to Toulon which would become the Provençal capital to this day. Ultimately, the Count of Venaissin was captured and exiled to Burgundy, and Charles would be confirmed as Duke of Provence. Though it would not be until the Treaty of Saint Denis in 1584 that officially ended formal support for Provençal Protestants.

Philip III/IX, his successor would prove the ultimate irony however in proclaiming the Edict of Avignon in 1616, which solved the issue of religion by making Catholicism and Protestantism legal throughout the Duchy, the first such nation in Europe that provided freedom of religion for Christians.

The events of the second half of the 16th century and the beginning of the 17th century would see Provence falling into the influence of Aragon. On the other hand, the newly found religious tolerance combined with the Aragonese desire to eliminate all remaining Imperial and Anglo-French influence on the Apennine Peninsula allowed Provençal rulers to normalise their relations with the Italian rulers and consequently to resurrect their Italian ambitions, though now mostly under the baton of Barcelona. The Valois diplomatic efforts would finally come to fruition in 1708, when Louis V/XI of France would marry his only child, Anne, to Giovanni Battista Gastone de Medici, the heir to the Grand Duchy of Tuscany. When Louis died in 1710, Giovanni ascended to the Tuscan throne as Jean I/III of Valois-Medici. His inheriting of the Grand Duchy in 1723 would mark the true beginning of the Tuscan-Provençal personal union and an age of prosperity for the realm.

During the Great German War (1795-1820), Provence would be one of the major combatants in the conflict against the revolutionary Republic of Etruria, who through revolution terminated the personal union in favor of a republic. Although they were successful in helping to contain the Republic to Tuscany, they were unable to restore the personal union. With the dawn of the post-Wenceslausian era, the Valois of Provence are now divided on their intentions. Do they continue the fight against the Plantagenets to reclaim their birthright? Or do they go against their masters and seek to unite the Italian Peninsula as successors to the legacy of Charles dAnjou and Lorenzo de Medici. For Provence, despite a long string of bad luck, perhaps they may still rise again.?
Pour le vrai Roy de France!

Anglo-French colonization of the New World began shortly after its discovery and the founding of Fort St. Francis in 1490 in what is now the Province of Leonie. The Treaty of Pamplona, signed three years later would confirm that lands North of the Cape Verde Islands would belong to them, a fact that was flagrantly violated by not only the Spanish, but also the Burgundians and Scandinavians. Despite this, fact, the colonization of the Southeastern Arcadian mainland proceeded smoothly, with the founding of other outposts, including Talahasi in modern Alibamon province (a French corruption of the original Seminole name, Talahassee) in 1538, and the founding of Nouvelle Orléans in modern Nouvelle France Province. (named after then Duke of Orléans, Francis de Plantagenêt) in 1545.

Unlike the Spaniards, who incorporated the Aztec and other tribal ruling classes into the colonial elite, the Anglo-French elite were predominantly those who immigrated from the mainland. Many of the Native Arcadian populace, such as the Seminole, Creek, Chickasaw and Shawnee tribes. Only the Cherokee remained largely resistant to Assimilation, fiercely maintaining their culture, despite being incorporated into colonial rule in the mid 18th century.(the Cherokee language would not see significant reform until 1821 under Sequoyah.)

The Anglo-French colonist also saw significant challenges from rival colonial powers. Despite the traditional Anglo-Franco-Spanish alliance, there were border incidents between the Crown Colony of Plantagenia (as their Arcadian colony was known) and the Viceroyalty of New Spain (and later Viceroyalty of Lusitania) that put a strain on their relationship. This also showed in the hostile relationships with New Burgundy and Vinland, and the various wars fought in the mainland reverberated in the colonies as well.

The road to Plantagenias independence from the Dual Monarchy was in a sense, unintentional. It began with the death of King Édouard VI and the subsequent self-exile of Prince Charles to Nouvelle Orléans, where he would serve as the de facto Viceroy of the colony. During his stay there, he reformed the colonial army, transforming it from a series of separate militias into a professional fighting force. It was these reforms that made Charles secure enough to proclaim himself the rightful King of England and France, triggering the Anglo-French War of Succession (1767-1771)

The Plantagenian Army challenged the Dual Monarchy to battle, and because of their superior knowledge in terrain, the use of militia to serve as skirmishers, the support of Scandinavia to supply arms and ships, and the half-hearted support of the Conservatives in power, saw the systematic conquest of Plantagenia for Charles by 1770. However, despite a successful landing in Brittany, the Army of King Charles was decisively defeated in the Battle of Rennes, subsequent battles saw any possibility of maintaining their hold in Brittany unfeasible, and because of the Dual Monarchys inability to regain their former colony, both sides agreed to peace. The Treaty of Brest confirmed Henri IX as King of England and France, and Prince Charles as King of Plantagenia as King Charles I, with both sides relinquishing claims on the others throne.

Plantagenia enjoyed a great period of peace since independence, maintaining its culture and its rights (slavery still being legal and widespread throughout all parts of the Kingdom), however the threat of Arcadianism espoused by the Seven Republics of New Burgundy was both a curse, in form of its disastrous defeat by their hand in the War of the Double Alliance, and a blessing, as these ideas gave rise to the concept of Plantagenia, not the Seven Republics, being the one to lead a united Arcadia to a brighter future. And so, Plantagenia, convinced of its new destiny, marches forth in the name of enlightenment and King.?
An Arcadian Empire seems like a good idea...

Scandinavian tradition of colonization can be traced back as early as the Viking Age. Norwegian settlers for the most part sailed West, discovering Faroe Islands and colonizing them. Then it was the turn of Iceland from where Erik the Red, whose father was exiled from Norway and who himself was banned from Iceland, sailed to Greenland. His son Leif would then become the first European to reach Arcadia, calling the land where he landed Vinland, land of the grapes for savage grapes were found in this place. The Norse settlement was however abandoned after encroachments with the Skraelings, the name given to the indigenous population. For 5 centuries, Vinland was abandoned and forgotten while Greenland soon became isolated from Iceland and thus Europe.

However, to avoid losing in the course for the colonies, the Stuart monarchy became suddenly interested in sailing West in the end of the 16th century. After the foundation of what would become Plantagenia and the Seven Republics, Hans III, the King of the North desired his share of the cake. The Icelandic explorer Christian Eriksson was hired and went on exploring the coasts of what is now Vinland. Referring to the old sagas, he identified several regions as the ones of the sagas and popularized the use of Vinland as a name for the region upon his return in Copenhagen. His numerous expeditions would lead him to fund several towns, the most famous being Erikshavn (1570), Erik's port named after the heir to the Kalmar Union, which would become over the years the most important city of the Nordic colony.

Vinland was the last European colony to be founded in the New-World and the low Scandinavian population made it also the less populated of the continent. The colony was based on the trade of furs, mainly beavers which were highly wanted in 17th century Europe and many settlers were only interested in this trade, making money and coming back to the homeland where they enjoyed a new position. The Religious Conflicts and the first border conflicts with New Burgundy led the Scandinavians to soon take measures to encourage immigration in the area. The end of the Imperial War of Religion would see an important emigration of Germans from Pomerania to Vinland where they would soon form an important part of the population. The seizure of Galatia (Sudurhafeyjar) in the same war would however divert many potential colonists to the rich waters of the Caribbean.

With a low population whose main concern was trade, Vinland experimented a very different relation with the natives than New-Burgundy or Plantagenia. Diplomatic relations were soon established between Scandinavia and the Iroquois, the Inuit and the Cree nations. The subsequent treaties which were signed guaranteed the land of the tribes (after some rectifications by the Vinlandic settlers) in exchange of the submission to the Nordic throne and a commercial monopoly for Scandinavia. This would lead to a rise of the trade of furs and also influence of Scandinavia which soon ruled over all the Great Lakes. The Nordic explorers would also often embark on travels inland which would lead to the mapping of most of North Arcadia by 1750 and the emergence of the Rohnst people.

However the rise of the settler population provoked a clash between the Crown and her colony. Reclaiming more lands and more rights the settlers would often ask for renegotiating the treaties with the Skraelings, a move the crown was not keen to do because of the influence she exerted over Arcadia because of the same treaties. The situation would tense over the years, the final blow being the new taxes for financing the German Wars leading to the Vinlandic War of Independence in 1808. The Loyalists were soon crushed and the tribes were forced to negotiate new treaties in favour of the settlers.

However the Iroquois Confederation would ask for the protection of the newly independent Belgium, giving the Septimen an access to the Great Lakes. This would mark the first step of hostilities between Vinland and the Seven Republics. Initially, a Treaty signed in neutral Talahasi in 1809 would see the Iroquois Confederate boundary split, with two-thirds going to Vinland and the remainder staying with the Seven Republics. But tensions continued as the rise of the concept of Arcadianism grew stronger. Finally, the threat of the Seven Republics grew too big to simply deal with by diplomacy. Securing an alliance with the Kingdom of Plantagenia, they declared war on the Seven Republics, triggering the War of the Double Alliance (1819-1821). The War was seen as nothing short of a disaster. The lack of population from Vinland proved to be the crucial factor in its defeat and loss of territory stipulated by the Treaty of Erikshavn.

Now Vinland stands at a crossroad. It is the biggest nation in Arcadia but also the less populated and both Plantagonian and Septimen are interested to get their share of the Great Lakes. The debate on the Natives situation has grown stronger over the years, stimulated by the opening of the colonization of the inner and northern parts of Arcadia and it may be time for Vinland to eventually choose the fate of the Skraelings. Adding to this situation, the emigration of Iroquois from Septimen territory preferring Vinlandic rule than Septiman exploitation. Moreover Arcadianism has spread to the ideological spheres of Vinland and some are already advocating the idea of Vinland spreading from one ocean to the other and becoming the sole great power of Arcadia.?

Amazonie was first explored by Spanish explorers during the expeditions of Amerigo Vespucci and was amongst the lands reserved for the Spanish with the treaty of Pamplona. However the violations of the treaty by the Spanish, made the Anglo-French feel not bind by it. The first colony founded was St-George in what was called France Equinoxiale (because near the Equator, days and nights barely last around the same time). The settlements were scarce and the area was clearly void of any occupation outside of the coastal ports of St-George and Bethléem. By 1574, the Spanish and French agreed on a new border on the Amazon River with all East and South territories left to Anglo-French colonisation.

A new movement of colonisation began in the 1610. Attracted by the riches of the Tribute Fleet from Peru, many settlers installed on the northeastern tip of Ameriga in what was called France Antarctique (Antarctic France meaning the opposite of the Arctic Climate). The immigration there, strengthened by the Atlantic Trade would be unregulated for years, Port Liberté being founded by a Breton pirate around 1640 and only integrated in the viceroyalty of France Antarctique after the construction of a royal fort in the bay. The area would prove to be a pirates nest for the whole century, culminating in what some people called the Golden Age of Piracy debuting during the Imperial War and continuing with various successes for the rest of the century and ending with the elimination of the last true pirate, Bartholomew Roberts in a fight with his old friend Olivier Levasseur.

The Antarctiqual colonisation was sponsored by La Compagnie de lAntarctique founded in St-Malo by Breton and Guyennese merchants. Decided to put to use the vast territories void of human presence, they bought many lands in the colony, creating grand domains using slaves workforce and settling there many settlers. Contrary to the Jewel of the Crown which was Plantagenia, Amazonia would see a predominantly French and Breton colonisation and almost no English settlers, the Puritans attracting the people who fled the Dual-Monarchy. Slavery was the main motor of the expansion of the colony becoming the first sugar producer in the whole world after 1700. Conflicts would often erupt on the southern border with Lotharian settlers although the whole Atlantian area became a city of exchange between the Burgundian and Anglo-French colony.

Penetration of the interior was hard because of the climate and it is only by 1790 that most of Amazonie was fully claimed and colonized. The settlers of the East took control of Gouas and Monts-Diamants while Equinoxian settlers would settle Vaura. The War of Succession caused no real change for the colony with only Equinoxia taking a side during the war and sending men to Charles. This act was punished after the war by the reunion of the two vice-royalties into Amazonie, administered in Port-Liberté. The little freedom Equinoxia had was lost and Equinoxian became bitter with the rule of the monarchy.

The ideas of the German Wars erupted in Amazonia but caused no real riot except in St-Georges where Equinoxian were ready to take up arms against the oppressor. The governor of the colony dialogated with revolters but was ultimately forced to leave in 1825. The success of the Lotharian Independence and the ongoing Spanish-Colombian Wars had only strengthened the revolutionary party. An assembly was called in Port-Liberté to choose the new Constitution of the country. In the end, the Amazonian Federation was declared with the constituent republics of Equinoxie and Antarctique being equals in the terms of power and jurisdiction. However the size and the population of the Eastern Part soon allowed the politics to not mind the Equinoxian inhabitants. Thus slavery was only abolished in the Western Parts while the Eastern planters retained their workforce.

Profiting from the Lotharingian Civil War, the Amazonian government moved its army to Atlantia and integrated it in the Federation although the claim is still unrecognized by the Lotharingian government and by the local population. Amazonia stands now at a crucial point in its history : Equinoxian are looking west, up the Amazon to settle new lands but who knows what effects it could have with Gran Colombia ? The Antarctic people are now looking south and a similar idea to Arcadianism has spread over some politics, the Amerigan Ideal. The balance in the country is already shaking and with potential enemies in the North and a revanchist dictatorship in the South, who knows what awaits the only democracy of the Amerigan continent ?
A united Ameriga would be a good thing...
Here is a compilation of most frequently asked questions about the mod so you don't have to search far for the solution

The history of the World of Divergences is based on several points of divergences which mostly are located in the 15th century : The duke of Burgundy decides to continue his support for Plantagenets in the Hundred Years' War, leading to the latter unifying France and England. The personal union of Denmark, Norway and Sweden survives and evolves to a unitary state and integrates Scotland with the Stuarts leading the Union. Isabella of Spain married a Portuguese prince, instead of Ferdinand II. The Chenghua Emperor does not stop Ming China's explorations, but decides to pursue them with greater zeal than before. That is the rough edges and as you can see many nations have their own histories. Those who do not can be found on the forums where there is a dedicated DVG history thread.

Military Access is not a normal diplomatic option in DVG. IOTL (In Our Time-Line for those who wonder) Military Access was not as easy to get as in Victoria II. So in DVG only an overlord can get get access over its sphere members. It can leads to some problems at start but it is rather good in the rest of the game with less shenanigans.

Bohemia and the HRE : the HRE still exists at start although severely weakened. A Bohemian player can try and restore the Imperial hegemony by warring Burgundy and Scandinavia and keeping the Germans princes under control, all that before 1848. If they don't manage to do this then they are left with a lesser union in North Germany, the Elbian Confederation. The Dual-Monarchy events : The coutnry is divided into 3 great groups, the Anglois, the French and the English. The goal is to choose whether to accept one of the two non accepted or the two at the same time. There are many events with hidden variables so even if you don't think that it makes anything it still does. Spain and the Iberian Union : The Iberian Union is quite a strange concept in Divergences and thus need to be done by force. You have to take Aragonese territories or wait until they lose their Italian possessions for Catalonia to appear.

As you can notice if you look at infamy reduction, there is a modifier called 'Lack of International Code'. It models the fact that there is no Concert of europe at start and no formal international treaty on how states should behave. Important changes in Europe will trigger a congress that will remove the modifier but until that you are free to conquer a bit more things

Hell no, we won't go!'\n\nOne of our states has seen a surge in socialist agitation during the past few months, since the forming of a labour union at one of the local workshops. The workshop seems to have set a local example to other workplaces, and, now, labour appears to be organizing at every mill, workshop and factory in the entire state. The government has been approached by a group of concerned members of the local elite, who call upon the central government to dispatch national guard units to the province in order to ensure that order is maintained.
column3: Oh non, nous ne partirons pas !"\n\nVoilà quelques mois que l'un de nos États est confronté à une forte agitation socialiste après la formation d'un syndicat professionnel dans l'un des ateliers locaux. Cet atelier semble avoir fait des émules et des syndicats s'organisent dans les moulins, ateliers et usines de tout l'État. Un groupe constitué d'élites locales inquiètes s'est rapproché du gouvernement pour lui demander d'envoyer des gardes nationaux dans la province afin de veiller au maintien de l'ordre.
column4: Verdammt nochmal, das machen wir nicht!'\n\nIn einem unserer Staaten gibt es sein einigen Monaten sozialistische Unruhen, seit in einer lokalen Werkstatt eine Gewerkschaft gegründet wurde. Der Betrieb scheint der Vorreiter für andere Werkstätten gewesen zu sein, denn nun organisiert sich in jeder Mühle, Werkstatt und Fabrik im gesamten Staat eine Gewerkschaft. Eine Gruppe besorgter Angehöriger der lokalen Elite hat sich an die Zentralregierung gewandt und darum gebeten, Einheiten der Nationalgarde zur Beibehaltung von Ruhe und Ordnung in die Provinz zu schicken.

column2: We will not turn the arms of our soldiers against the citizens they exist to defend
column3: Nous ne retournerons pas les armes de nos soldats contre citoyens qui veulent se défendre.
column4: Wir werden nicht die Waffen unserer Soldaten gegen die Bürger richten, die sie eigentlich beschützen sollen.

column2: I suppose we have a few units that we could spare for the good cause...
column3: Je suppose que nous pourrions consacrer quelques unités à cette juste cause...
column4: Ein paar Einheiten könnten wir wohl für eine gute Sache abstellen ...

column2: Screams can be heard from a workplace in one of our states, where socialist agitators have turned an ongoing labour conflict from bad to worse. Local capitalists are appalled at the liberties these revolutionaries allow themselves with regards to how, when and where they preach their revolutionary ideology, and are considering forming a citizen guard, should the situation escalate further.
column3: Des cris se sont fait entendre dans une usine d'un de nos États où des agitateurs socialistes n'ont fait qu'aggraver un conflit en cours. Les capitalistes locaux sont consternés par les libertés que s'octroient ces révolutionnaires pour mettre en avant leur idéologie révolutionnaire et envisagent même de constituer une garde citoyenne si la situation venait à empirer.
column4: Aus einer Arbeitsstätte in einem unserer Staaten können Schreie gehört werden. Sozialistische Agitatoren haben dort einen fortwährenden Arbeitskampf noch weiter verschlimmert. Lokale Kapitalisten sind entsetzt, welche Freiheiten sich diese Revolutionäre dahingehend erlauben, wie, wann und wo sie ihre revolutionäre Ideologie predigen. Sie tragen sich mit dem Gedanken, eine Bürgerwehr zu organisieren, wenn die Situation noch weiter eskaliert.

column2: We will not recommend our citizens to form protection rackets
column3: Nous ne conseillerons pas à nos citoyens de constituer de tels groupes de protection.
column4: Wir raten unseren Bürgern davon ab, Schutztruppen zu organisieren.

column2: Anything to stave off the red hydra!
column3: Tout est bon pour écarter l'hydre rouge !
column4: Zum Aufhalten der roten Gefahr ist uns jedes Mittel recht!

column2: A factory in one of our states has become the target of a mild, but costly, sabotage campaign during the past few weeks, and local management suspects that a know socialist agitator in the area is responsible for this development, as the gentleman in question is known by management to have taken issue with a decision they recently took regarding company internal division of labour.
column3: Dans l'un de nos États, une usine a été la cible d'une campagne de sabotage au cours de ces dernières semaines et la direction soupçonne un agitateur socialiste notoire d'être responsable de ces agissements, puisque l'homme en question se serait offusqué d'une récente décision de la direction concernant la répartition du travail.
column4: Eine Fabrik in einem unserer Staaten ist während der letzten Wochen zum Ziel einer schwachen, aber für uns teuren Sabotagekampagne geworden. Das lokale Management vermutet als Hintermann der Aktionen einen bekannten sozialistischen Agitator, da dieser feine Herr anscheinend an einer kürzlichen Entscheidung des Management bezüglich der internen Arbeitsteilung Anstoß genommen.

column2: You mean you fired someone? Nothing wrong with that!
column3: Vous voulez dire que vous avez licencié quelqu'un ? Rien de mal à cela !
column4: Heißt das, jemand ist entlassen worden? Daran wäre doch nichts falsch!

column2: Denounce the profiteering of those fat-cats
column3: Dénoncer les profits de ces privilégiés

column2: A strike today in one of our states, initiated by communist troublemakers and revolutionaries, was swiftly put down by local police. The event has caused a massive backlash against the socialist movement in the state, as local farmers & peasants perceive the red ideology as being vehemently opposed to the traditions and histories of civilization in general, and , $COUNTRY$, more importantly.
column3: Aujourd'hui, une grève a éclaté dans l'un de nos États à l'initiative de fauteurs de trouble et de révolutionnaires communistes, avant d'être rapidement contenue par la police locale. Cette grève a suscité une réaction massive contre le mouvement socialiste de l'État, les fermiers locaux jugeant l'idéologie communiste comme contraire aux traditions et à l'histoire de la civilisation, en général, et plus important encore à $COUNTRY$.
column4: Heute hat es in einem unserer Staaten einen von kommunistischen Störenfrieden und Revolutionäre angezettelten Streik gegeben, der aber von der lokalen Polizei im Keim erstickt wurde. Dieses Ereignis hat der sozialistischen Bewegung in dem Staat einen schweren Schlag versetzt, da die lokalen Bauern die rote Ideologie nun als krassen Kontrast zu den Traditionen und der Geschichte der Gesellschaft im Allgemeinen ... und am Wichtigsten, zu $COUNTRY$ erkennen.

column2: Let us hope that this will be the end of this revolutionary prattle
column3: Espérons que cela mettra un terme à cette absurdité révolutionnaire.
column4: Hoffentlich ist dies das Ende dieses revolutionären Geschwätzes.

column2: But.. the plight of the workers? Exploitation by the ruling classes?
column3: Mais... la condition des ouvriers ? l'exploitation faite par les classes dirigeantes ?
column4: Aber ... was ist mit der Notlage der Bauern? Der Ausbeutung durch die herrschenden Klassen?

column2: Workers in a machine shop in one of our states have gone out in strike, protesting all manner of ills, real or perceived, in society as a whole and in the workplace. What is infinitely worse than a few redbeards taking a few days off, however, is that many other workers from all across the state have joined them in a state-wide sympathy strike, causing the productive engine of the state to grind to a more or less immediate halt. Harsh methods might have to be employed to resolve this little situation.
column3: Les ouvriers d'un atelier d'usinage d'un de nos États se sont mis en grève pour dénoncer les maux, réels ou perçus, de la société, dans son ensemble, et sur leur lieu de travail. Mais le pire, c'est que de nombreux ouvriers, des quatre coins de l'État, ont emboîté le pas à ces quelques contestataires et entamé une grève solidaire qui stoppé, plus ou moins immédiatement, l'appareil productif. Des méthodes dures sont préconisées pour remédier à une telle situation.
column4: Arbeiter einer Werkstatt in einem unserer Staaten streiken und protestieren dabei gegen allerlei Ungerechtigkeiten in der Gesellschaft und am Arbeitsplatz, egal ob diese real sind oder nur empfunden werden. Unendlich schlimmer als ein paar Rotbärte, die sich einige Tage freinehmen, sind aber die staatsweiten Sympathiestreiks, denen sich viele andere Arbeiter angeschlossen haben. Dies hat dazu geführt, dass die Produktionsmaschinerie des Staats mehr oder weniger abrupt gestoppt hat. Zur Auflösung dieser kleinen Unpässlichkeit müssen eventuell drastische Maßnahmen ergriffen werden.

column2: Time is on our side. Let us wait them out with vague promises, but little or no action.
column3: Le temps joue en notre faveur. Faisons-les attendre avec de vagues promesses, mais pas ou peu d'actions.
column4: Die Zeit ist auf unserer Seite. Lasst sie uns mit wagen Versprechen hinhalten, aber nur wenig oder gar nicht unternehmen.

column2: Curtail local press distribution for any papers suspected of collaboration
column3: S'attaquer aux journaux soupçonnés de collaboration
column4: Schränkt die Auflagen lokaler Zeitungen ein, die wir der Kollaboration verdächtigen.

column2: A new daily with no shame about its political leanings has been incorporated in $CAPITAL$, The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Red Star, official party organ for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ socialist party. The Red Star publishes deeply moving social commentary, seldom without picturesque little reports on the conditions of working men and women across the world. The Red Star stands, or so it claims, for international solidarity, worker's rights, unionism and class struggle on a broad, democratic and socialist basis.
column3: Un nouveau quotidien qui n'a pas honte de ses tendances politiques est diffusé à $CAPITAL$, l'Étoile Rouge $COUNTRY_ADJ$, l'organe officiel du parti socialiste $COUNTRY_ADJ$. L'Étoile Rouge publie des témoignages particulièrement poignants et éloquents sur les conditions de travail des hommes et femmes du monde entier. Comme il le revendique, l'Étoile Rouge soutient la solidarité internationale, les droits des ouvriers, l'unionisme et la lutte des classes sur une base démocratique et socialiste élargie.
column4: In $CAPITAL$ wurde eine neue Tageszeitung gegründet, die aus ihrer politischen Gesinnung keinen Hehl macht: Der $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Rote Stern, offizielles Parteiorgan der $COUNTRY_ADJ$ sozialistischen Partei. Der Rote Stern veröffentlicht tief bewegende Sozialkommentare, selten ohne anschauliche Kurzberichte über die Lebensbedingungen der arbeitenden Bevölkerung auf der ganzen Welt. Der Rote Stern steht eigenen Aussagen zufolge für internationale Solidarität, Arbeiterrechte, Unionismus und Klassenkampf auf einer breiten demokratischen und sozialistischen Basis.

column2: I shall suggest down at the club that they start a subscription. Gin, anyone?
column3: Je vais suggérer au club de prendre un abonnement. Quelqu'un veut du gin ?
column4: Ich werde mal beim Klub vorschlagen, dass sie das Blatt abonnieren. Will jemand Gin?

column2: What is this... horrid piece of paper... a Fish & Chips wrapping?
column3: Qu'est-ce que c'est que ce torchon ?
column4: Was ist dieses ... furchtbare Käseblättchen ... ne Fish & Chips-Verpackung?

column2: The red banners flutter before the winds, and people of all ages come out to watch, as socialists, communists, union members and workers of all ages come together in a protest march, all across country, commemorating the deaths of several demonstrators at the Chicago Haymarket Massacre in 1886. While an annually returning celebration in almost every city in $COUNTRY$, this year's incarnation has been particularly successful in one of our states, where an upsurge in socialist militancy and consciousness can be expected.
column3: Les drapeaux rouges flottent au vent et des personnes de tout âge sont venus voir les syndicalistes et ouvriers, socialistes et communistes, de tout âge eux aussi, défiler dans tout le pays pour commémorer la mort de plusieurs manifestants lors du massacre de Chicago Haymarket de 1886. Avec une commémoration annuelle organisée dans chaque ville de $COUNTRY$, le défilé a, cette année, remporté un succès particulièrement vif dans l'un de nos États où l'on peut s'attendre à un regain de militantisme socialiste.
column4: Die roten Banner flattern im Wind und Leute allen Alters schauen zu, als sich im ganzen Land Sozialisten, Kommunisten, Gewerkschaftler und Arbeiter aller Altersgruppen sich zu einem Protestmarsch zusammenfinden, um dem Tod mehrerer Demonstranten beim Chicago Haymarket Massacre von 1886 zu gedenken. Obwohl dies jährlich in allen Städten in $COUNTRY$ wiederholt wird, waren die diesjährigen Feierlichkeiten in einem unserer Staaten ein besonders großer Erfolg: Dort kann nun ein abrupter Anstieg sozialistisch motivierter Militanz und sozialistischen Bewusstseins gerechnet werden.

column2: Commemorating bomb-throwers and murderers, in one of *my* states?
column3: On commémore des poseurs de bombes et des meurtriers dans l'un de *mes* États ?
column4: Gedenkfeiern für Bombenwerfer und Mörder in einem *meiner* Staaten?

column2: Naturally we support this fine display of international solidarity between workers
column3: Naturellement, nous soutenons cette belle démonstration de solidarité internationale entre les ouvriers.
column4: Diese großartige internationale Arbeitersolidarität werden wir natürlich unterstützen.

column2: Extra extra! Grand strike in $CAPITAL$. Workers demand higher wages. Extra extra! Grand strike in...'\n\nA socialist newspaper named 'Forward!' has been published in $CAPITAL$. It reports about various strikes, current news and socialist movements in politics both close to home and abroad.
column4: Extrablatt! Extrablatt! Generalstreik in $PROVINCENAME$. Die Arbeiter verlangen höhere Löhne. Extrablatt! Extrablatt! Generalstreik in ...'\n\nDie sozialistische Zeitung 'Vorwärts!' hat die Arbeit aufgenommen. Sie berichtet über verschiedene Streiks, aktuelle Neuigkeiten und sozialistische Bewegungen in der Politik.

column2: And they say there is no leftist bias in the media... pfft.

There's foxes in the hen house,'
cows out in the corn.
The unions have been busted,
their proud red banners torn'
- Steve Earle

Capitalists in one of our states have begun employing union busting tactics to end what they describe as 'the scourge of organized labour'. By employing professional infiltrators to get under the skin of the state's labour movement, the capitalists hope to be able to sow discontent among the union rank and file.
column3:
There's foxes in the hen house,'
cows out in the corn.
The unions have been busted,
their proud red banners torn'
- Paroles de Steve Earle

Les capitalistes de l'un de nos États ont commencé à recourir à des méthodes musclées pour mettre fin à ce qu'ils qualifient de "fléau syndicaliste". En faisant appel à des professionnels pour infiltrer le mouvement syndical de l'État, les capitalistes espèrent pouvoir semer la discorde dans les rangs des syndicalistes.
column4:
There's foxes in the hen house,'
cows out in the corn.
The unions have been busted,
their proud red banners torn'
- Steve Earle

Kapitalisten haben in einem unserer Staaten begonnen, mit Streikbrechertaktiken gegen die nach ihren Worten 'Landplage der organisierten Arbeiterschaft' vorzugehen. Durch den Einsatz professioneller Spione zur Unterwanderung der Arbeiterbewegung im Staat hoffen die Kapitalisten, an der Basis der Gewerkschaft Zwietracht zu sähen.

column2: An excellent initiative that can only be applauded!
column3: Voilà une initiative qui mérite d'être applaudie !
column4: So einer hervorragenden Initiative kann man nur Beifall klatschen!

column2: They must stop infringing on organizational freedoms
column3: Il faut qu'ils arrêtent de violer les libertés syndicales.
column4: Sie müssen aufhören, die organisatorischen Freiheiten zu überziehen.

column2: Capitalists in one of our states have called a lockout following a period of intensifying labour conflicts in the area. Workers have been informed by management that no one is welcome back to work while union sympathies still run high among the employed. Local police have expressed support for the move, citing a long series of disturbances at the factory, some even bordering on sabotage.
column3: Les capitalistes de l'un de nos États ont appelé à une grève patronale après une période d'intenses conflits syndicaux. La direction a informé les ouvriers qu'ils n'étaient plus les bienvenus tant que la solidarité syndicale durerait dans ses proportions actuelles. La police locale a exprimé son soutien au mouvement, citant différents désagréments survenus à l'usine, certains étant même à la limite des actes de sabotage.
column4: Nach längeren Arbeitskämpfen haben Kapitalisten in einem unserer Staaten ihre Angestellten ausgesperrt. Das Management hat ihnen mitgeteilt, dass sie so lange nicht mehr willkommen sind, wie die hohe Sympathie für die Gewerkschaft anhält. Die lokale Polizei hat ihr Verständnis für diesen Schritt kund getan und sich auf eine lange Reihe von Störfällen in der Fabrik berufen, einige davon am Rand von Sabotage.

column2: Yes? We have trade, wars, production, and you tell me about organized labour?
column3: Ah bon ? Nous avons des questions de commerce, de guerre, de production à étudier et vous me parlez de mouvement syndical ?
column4: Ja? Handel, Kriege, Produktion - und ihr erzählt mir von organisierten Arbeitern?
Hey! Das ist aber nicht verfassungskonform!

column2: The socialist party in one of our states has recently begun undergoing a distinct metamorphosis, under the influence of its young, charismatic leader. While the party still maintains several core tenants of socialism, such as the emphasis on the state's important societal role, it has also begun embracing an aggressive and bombastic form of radical nationalism. Black flags have begun waving from the socialist party headquarters in one of our states, and while still prefixed with 'proto-', it is clear that what we are seeing is the formation of a radical new front in the state's politics: Fascism.
column3: Le parti socialiste de l'un de nos États a récemment commencé à se métamorphoser sous l'influence de son jeune et charismatique dirigeant. Tout en conservant les principes clés du socialisme, comme l'importance du rôle de l'État dans la société, il a adopté une forme plus agressive et plus ampoulée du nationalisme radical. Des drapeaux noirs ont commencé à flotter au-dessus du siège du parti socialiste de l'un de nos États et, malgré la persistance du préfixe "proto", il apparaît clair que nous assistons là à la formation d'un nouveau front radical au sein du parti : le fascisme.
column4: Die sozialistische Partei in einem unserer Staaten hat kürzlich begonnen, sich unter dem Einfluss ihres jungen, charismatischen Anführers deutlich zu wandeln. Während die Partei weiterhin einige Hauptaspekte des Sozialismus beibehält, zum Beispiel die Betonung der gesellschaftlichen Rolle des Staats, beginnt sie nun auch, eine aggressive und bombastische Form des radikalen Nationalismus zu befürworten. Aus dem Hauptquartier der sozialistischen Partei in einem unserer Staaten wehen schwarze Fahnen, und obwohl die Vorsilbe 'Proto-' immer noch Bestand hat, ist es klar, dass wir es hier mit der Bildung einer neuen radikalen Front zu tun haben: Dem Faschismus.

column2: An interesting development that we will make sure to keep an eye on.
column3: Voilà un développement intéressant sur lequel il va nous falloir garder l'il.
column4: Das ist eine interessante Entwicklung, die wir im Auge behalten müssen.

column2: Let us see if we cannot defuse some of this enthusiasm into more palatable forms
column3: Voyons voir s'il ne nous est pas possible de rendre un tel enthousiasme plus acceptable.
column4: Mal sehen, ob wir diesen Enthusiasmus nicht in etwas angenehmere Bahnen lenken können.

column2: The emerging fascist party in one of our states has formed a paramilitary corps, organized with a military command chain, ideologically coherent and ready to do the bidding of the fascist party leaders. The group is colloquially referred to as the 'Blackshirts' from the iconic militaresque shirts that they have taken to wearing. This trend is new to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ politics, and some fear that it might lead to a chain-reaction, with other parties forming military organizations of their own.
column3: Le nouveau parti fasciste présent dans l'un de nos États s'est doté d'un corps paramilitaire, organisé selon une chaîne de commandement militaire, cohérent, en termes idéologiques, et prêt à répondre aux ordres des leaders du parti fasciste. Ce corps se fait communément appeler les "Chemises noires" en raison des chemises distinctives que ses membres arborent. Il s'agit là d'une nouvelle tendance dans le paysage politique $COUNTRY_ADJ$ et certains craignent qu'elle ne déclenche une réaction en chaîne et que d'autres partis ne créent, eux aussi, leurs propres corps militaires.
column4: Die neu entstandene faschistische Partei in einem unserer Staaten hat ein paramilitärisches Korps mit militärischer Kommandostruktur aufgestellt. Es ist ideologisch gefestigt und bereit, die Befehle der faschistischen Parteiführer ausführen. Die Gruppe wird aufgrund ihrer martialischen Hemden im Volksmund 'Schwarzhemden' genannt. Dieser Trend ist neu in der $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Politik, und manche fürchten, dass er eine Kettenreaktion auslösen könnte, die zur Aufstellung militärischer Organisationen durch die anderen Parteien führt.

column2: Clamp down on the organization and attempt to shut it down
column3: Neutraliser ce corps et tenter de le démanteler
column4: Geht gegen die Organisation vor und versucht, sie aufzulösen.

column2: Leave them be, and hope that they don't gain too much ground
column3: Le laisser faire et espérer qu'il ne gagne pas trop de terrain
column4: Wir lassen sie in Ruhe und hoffen, dass sie nicht zu viel Einfluss erlangen.

column2: The fascist party has begun organizing soup kitchens for the unemployed in one of our states, citing the need to 'Protect and preserve the pureborn $COUNTRY_ADJ$ industrial workers from the ravages of international capitalism'. Several other parties, along with leading liberal and conservative dailies, have expressed sharp criticism of the party's work, claiming that it, in the end, amounts to little less than bribery and the buying of voter support. The fascists themselves do not seem overly concerned about these accusations.
column3: Le parti fasciste a commencé à organiser des soupes populaires pour les chômeurs de l'un de nos États, se référant à la nécessité de "protéger et de préserver les ouvriers de pure souche $COUNTRY_ADJ$ des effets dévastateurs du capitalisme international". Plusieurs autres partis, ainsi que de grands quotidiens libéraux et conservateurs, ont émis de vives critiques à l'égard de tels agissements, estimant qu'il s'agissait là d'une façon plus ou moins détournée d'acheter le soutien des électeurs. Les fascistes eux-mêmes ne semblent pas inquiets par de telles accusations.
column4: Die faschistische Partei hat in einem unserer Staaten damit begonnen, Suppenküchen für die Arbeitslosen einzurichten. Sie sagen, sie müssten die 'reinrassigen $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Industriearbeiter von den Verheerungen des internationalen Kapitalismus schützen'. Mehrere andere Parteien sowie führende liberale und konservative Tageszeitungen haben die Arbeit der Partei scharf kritisiert, und behauptet, dass sie letztendlich kaum mehr als Bestechung und Stimmenkauf sei. Die Faschisten selbst scheinen über diese Anschuldigungen nicht sonderlich bestürzt zu sein.

column2: The party's work is not illegal, and is therefore not a government concern
column3: Les agissements du parti ne sont pas contraires à la loi et ne relèvent, dès lors, pas du ressort du gouvernement.
column4: Die Arbeit der Partei ist nicht illegal und geht die Regierung deshalb nichts an.

column2: This is just a ruse to build support for the party, end this nonsense!
column3: Il s'agit là d'une ruse visant à rallier du soutien pour le parti. Mettez fin à cette absurdité !
column4: Das ist nur ein Trick, um Unterstützer für die Partei zu gewinnen. Beendet diesen Unsinn!

column2: Reports have reached $CAPITAL$ that the Blackshirts, the paramilitary wing of the fascist party, have begun marching down the country, toward $CAPITAL$, intent on seizing power in $COUNTRY$. The military has thus far not attempted to intervene, and we suspect that this might be due to the fact that several leading members of our armed forces have fascist sympathies themselves. This is definitely a crisis for the young $COUNTRY_ADJ$ democracy.
column3: À $CAPITAL$, des rapports indique que les Chemises noires, le corps paramilitaire du parti fasciste, marchent dans tout le pays en direction de $CAPITAL$, avec l'intention de prendre le contrôle de $COUNTRY$. Pour le moment, les militaires n'ont pas tenté d'intervenir et nous pensons que cela est dû au fait que plusieurs membres dirigeants de nos forces armées sont, eux-mêmes, des sympathisants des fascistes. Il s'agit bien là d'une crise pour la jeune démocratie $COUNTRY_ADJ$.
column4: $CAPITAL$ haben Berichte erreicht, dass die Schwarzhemden, der paramilitärische Flügel der faschistischen Partei, auf $CAPITAL$ zu marschieren und die Macht in $COUNTRY$ an sich reißen wollen. Unser Militär hat bislang noch nicht eingegriffen, aber wir vermuten, dies könnte daran liegen, dass mehrere führende Mitglieder unserer Streitkräfte mit den Faschisten sympathisieren. Dies ist definitiv eine Krise für die junge $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Demokratie.

column2: Send out the military to restore order
column4: Das Militär soll die Ordnung wiederherstellen.

column2: Neat black flags they have! I have a white one!
column3: Ils ont de bien jolis drapeaux noirs ! Le mien, quant à lui, est blanc !
column4: Die haben aber hübsche schwarze Fahnen! Ich habe eine weiße!

column2: War veterans, disgruntled with what they see as the failures of capitalism and liberal democracy, have formed a Free Corps -- an ideological an paramilitary organization ostensibly existing to protect the state and homeland, while de facto promoting a fascist political agenda -- in one of our states. The corps has already begun flexing its muscles in local politics, threatening several liberal politicians and maintaining a fairly intimidating uniformed presence in the state.
column3: Les vétérans de guerre, contrariés par ce qu'ils qualifient d'échec du capitalisme et de la démocratie libérale, se sont constitués en Corps francs, une organisation idéologique et paramilitaire avec pour vocation de protéger l'État et la patrie, tout en faisant la promotion d'un programme fasciste de facto, dans l'un de nos États. Ces corps ont déjà commencé à s'attaquer à la politique locale, menaçant plusieurs politiciens libéraux et maintenant une présence plutôt intimidante dans l'État.
column4: Mit Kapitalismus und liberaler Demokratie unzufriedene Kriegsveteranen haben in einem unserer Staaten ein Freikorps gegründet, eine paramilitärische Organisation, die angeblich Staat und Heimatland schützen soll, während sie in Wirklichkeit eine faschistische Agenda verfolgt. In der lokalen Politik hat das Korps bereits seine Muskeln spielen lassen und dabei mehrere liberale Politiker bedroht. Es hat in dem Staat eine recht einschüchternde, uniformierte Präsenz.
